"Kuhhihihihi! In short, I put those two things together! The face, which is necessary to distinguish their identity, and the pulverization of the head, the vessel for the soul, which is the perfect symbol of death!

この２つを左右ぴったり綺麗に合体させたら、アラ不思議！　この頭部半壊死体がパーフェクトであるという答えが出たわけだ！」
When I put those two parts neatly together, aah, wonderful! I came up with the perfect answer of corpses with their heads half-smashed!"

「お前、絶対、二色パンとか二色アイスが好きだろ。欲張りな子ども趣味丸出しだぜ…。」
"I'll bet you love two-colored bread and two-colored ice cream. You're just like a greedy kid..."

「………いずれにせよ。たとえ頭部が半壊していたとしても、現時点では彼らが死んだと見なすべきではないわ。」
"......At any rate, even if half of their heads are smashed, we shouldn't assume that they're dead at this point in time."

「わかってる。……ベアトがもったいぶって赤での宣言を拒む以上、全ては疑って掛かるべきだな。
"I get it. ...Since Beato is trying to act tough and is refusing to say anything in red, we've gotta suspect everything.

……もちろん、シエスタの太もも姉ちゃんたちの魔法虐殺だって鵜呑みになんか絶対ぇしねぇぜ。」
...Of course, I'm definitely not gonna swallow the theory of magical mass murder by the Chiester ass nee-chans."

「くす。本当に慎重になったこと。……最初のゲームの頃だったなら、何でもかんでも鵜呑みにしてくれていたのにね。」
"*giggle* You sure have gotten prudent. ...If this were the first game, you would've swallowed everything."

「くっくっくっく！　好敵手は、こうでなくては面白くないというものよ。
"*cackle*cackle*! I wouldn't have anything less from a rival.

今は赤がないことを幸いに、自由な想像を広げ好きに推理を重ねるがいい。一番最後の、一番美味しいところで、バッサリと赤き真実にて叩き切ってくれようぞ…！」
Since there is fortunately no red now, he can imagine whatever he wants and reason over and over again as he likes. At the very end, at the very sweetest spot, I'll cut him down at once with the red truth...!"

「………………あ、……………ぅ………、」
"......Ah, ......uu......"

静寂。真っ暗。
冷たい。痛い。
Silent. Black.

Cold. Painful.

楼座は少しずつ意識を取り戻す……。
Rosa regained consciousness bit by bit...

そして最初に考えたことは、意識を取り戻さなければ良かった、だった。
And the first thing she thought...was that it would have been better if she hadn't.

だって、こんなにも体が冷えていて痛くて、……意識が戻れば戻るほどに辛くなるから。
After all, with her body this cold and hurting, ...the pain grew the more her consciousness returned.

暗闇の中、冷え切った大理石の上でずっとうつ伏せになって寝ていたような感じ。
It felt like she'd been sleeping on ice-cold marble in the darkness, lying face-down for a long time.

……あぁ、だからいつも自分に言い聞かせてるのよ。
たとえ仮眠であっても、せめてソファーの上へ行こうって。
...Aaah, this is why I always tell myself.

Even if its just for a nap, I've got to at least grab a sofa.

ちょっと目を閉じるだけ、なんて甘えて、フローリングの上や書斎机の上に突っ伏して眠ってしまうと、後で体が痛くなって辛い思いをするって、いつも知ってるのに……。
I know that, if I naively try to close my eyes for just a second...and end up sleeping on the floor or in the study chair, it'll hurt my body later and make things difficult...

こんなにも冷たくて硬い床で眠っていたから、骨まで冷え切ってしまった。
Since I slept on such a cold and hard floor, even my bones are ice-cold.

こんなにも硬くて冷たい床で眠っていたから、押し付けていた顔半分がとても痛い。
Since I slept on such a hard and cold floor, the half of my face pressed down against it hurts a lot.

……今、鏡を見たら、きっとみっともなく跡になっているだろう。
...If I were to look in a mirror right now, I'm sure I'd see an embarrassing mark.

撫でたくらいでその跡が消えるとは思わないが、とりあえず、取り繕うように痛む顔半分をさすった…。
I didn't think that just rubbing it would make that mark disappear, but I stroked the hurting side of my face anyway, trying to smooth it over...

……ここは、………どこだろう。
...I wonder......where this is.

真っ暗闇だと思っていたが、そうではないようだった。
なぜなら、薄っすらと自分の体を見ることは出来るからだ。
I thought it was pitch black, but it looks like it isn't.

After all, I can faintly see my own body.

……光源があるに違いないのだが、天井を、……あるいは空を見上げても、真っ暗闇が広がるだけで、それらしい灯りは見えない。
...Without a doubt, there was some source of light, but even if I looked up at the ceiling...or else the sky, there was only an expanse of blackness, and I couldn't see a proper light.

自分の体がほんのりと照らされているだけで、それ以外の物は全てが暗闇に沈んでいる、……そんな世界。
My body alone was slightly lit, whereas everything else was sunk in darkness... That's what this world was like.

それはまるで、楼座だけが、忘れられた世界に置き去りにされてしまったかのようだった。
It was almost as though Rosa alone had been abandoned in a forgotten world.

意識がはっきりしてくると、どうしてこんな寂しいところに独りぼっちでいるのか不安になってきた。
As her mind grew clearer, she started getting nervous about why she was all alone in a lonely place like this.

　……誰かいませんかと、声を張り上げようとした時、
……ぺた、
…ぺた、
と足音が近付いてくるのが聞こえた。
...When she was about to call out, asking if anyone was there, she heard the

...*patter*...

*patter*...

of footsteps coming towards her.




か弱い足音だったので、子どもだろうと思った。不気味な気配はなかったので怯えはしなかった。
They were light footsteps, so she thought it was probably a kid. She didn't sense anything disturbing, so she wasn't afraid.

しかし、真里亞の足音でもないので、一体、このような暗闇で誰だろうと、足音の聞こえてくる方向をじっと見た。
But they also weren't Maria's footsteps, so, wondering who in the world would be in a darkness like this, she stared in the direction the footsteps were coming from.

………すると、……薄っすらと近付いてくる人影が見えてくる。
......As she did, ...a faint, approaching silhouette came into view.

それは、……真里亞よりずっと幼い子どもに見えた。
It looked...like a child much younger than Maria.

……誰だろう。
知らない子だった。
...Who is it?

I don't know this kid.

でも、浮かべている表情はまるで、親とはぐれてしまった迷子の子のよう。
…娘を持つ親として、胸が掻き毟られる感情を覚える…。
But, the expression on his face was like a lost child separated from his parents.

...As a parent with a daughter herself, Rosa felt as though her chest had been torn apart...

『……………………うりゅ。』
『............Uryu.』

「……あツ、…………、」
"...Ah! ......"

その子が幼児言葉のようなものを呟いた瞬間、……冷たい床で痛んだ顔の左半分が、細くて硬くて長い針でぷすりと貫かれたような痛みを感じた。
The instant the kid muttered that infantile word, ...she felt pain in the half of her face that had started hurting from the cold floor, as though it had been pierced by long, thin, hard needles.

思わず手で、痛んだ側の顔を押さえてしまう。
Without thinking, she pressed her hand against that side of her face.

『……大丈夫……？　まだ痛い……？』
『...Are you all right...? Does it still hurt...?』

「…ありがとう、僕。………ここはどこ…？　すごく、……寒いわ。」
"...Thanks, I'm fine, little guy. ......Where are we...? It's really...cold."

『……こっちへ来て……。ここにいちゃいけない……。』
『...Come this way... You mustn't stay here...』

その子は私のもう片方の手を取ると、悲壮な表情で引っ張った。
That child took my other hand and pulled with a grim expression on his face.

……何が何だかわからない。
でも、子どもの素直な表情はそれ一つで、大人の口先だけの百の言葉よりも、真実を語ることが多い。
...Rosa didn't have a clue what was going on.

However, a single honest expression on a child...can often tell the truth better than a hundred words from an adult.

事情はわからないが、とにかく楼座は手を引かれるままに一緒に駆け出す…。
She didn't know the situation, but even so, she dashed along with him, still being pulled...

しかし、自分たちの姿以外は真っ暗で何も見えない世界。
本当に自分が走って前へ進んでいるのかさえ、実感できない。
But this was a world where nothing could be seen in the darkness except for their own forms.

It didn't even really feel like she was moving forwards.

……走っているのに風すら感じられない。
まるで、まだ悪夢の中にいるかのような、そんな非現実感…。
...Even though she was running, she couldn't even feel any wind.

It was as though she was still inside a nightmare, ...that kind of unreal sensation...

だから、走っているにもかかわらず平衡感覚が保てず、私は足をもつれさせて転んでしまう。
So even though I ran, I couldn't maintain my sense of balance, and my legs got tangled and I fell.

……現実感のない世界ではあっても、硬く冷たい床に顔をこすり付ける痛みは現実そのものだった。
...Even in a world that didn't feel real, the pain of smashing my face against the cold, hard floor was reality itself.

『うりゅ……、大丈夫……？』
『Uryu, ...are you okay...?』

「うっ、………ッ…。……ごめんなさいね、頭が痛むの。」
"Ah, ......nn... ...I'm sorry, my head hurts."

……その子が、その、……“うりゅ”とかいう幼児言葉を口にしたら、また頭に針を刺す痛みが走った。
...When the kid said that...infantile word `uryu', pain like being stuck with needles ran though my head again.

二度起こっただけなのに、その子のその言葉が私の痛みを起こす切っ掛けになっているとなぜか理解できた。
Even though it had only happened twice, I was somehow able to understand that the child's word was the cause of my pain.

……だから率直にそれを口に出す。
...So I said so frankly.

「ごめんなさい。その、“うりゅ”という口癖を止めてもらえる…？」
"I'm sorry. Could you stop saying `uryu'...?"

『うりゅ……。』
『Uryu...』

「ツ、……ちょっと、止めてって言ってるでしょ…。」
"Nng, ...wait a second, didn't I tell you to stop...?"

『う、…ぁう、…うー！　ごめんなさい……。』
『U, ...au, ...uu-! Sorry...』

その子の謝罪の言葉で、今度は眉間に鋭い痛みを感じた気がした。
I had the feeling that this child's apology caused a sharp pain in my forehead this time.

………何なの、この子は……？
......What is...this child...?

　悪意がないのはわかってるんだけど、
……この子にかかわると、
……頭が辛い……。
I know there's no malice in him,

...but when I'm around this child,

...my head hurts...




『……大丈夫……？　早く行こ……。
『...Are you okay...? Let's go, quickly...

ここはいちゃ駄目……。』
You mustn't stay here...』

「どうしてここにいちゃ駄目なの…？　ねぇ、ここはどこ……？　あなたは誰？　あなたのママはどこ…？」
"Why shouldn't I be here...? Hey, where is this...? Who are you? Where is your Mama...?"

『………ボクを作ってくれたのは、
……ママだよ…？』
『......The one who made me...

...is you, Mama...』

「……え……？」
"...Huh...?"

その子は、つぶらな瞳で、私をじっと見る。
That child stared at me with round eyes.

……この子のママが、………私……？
……誰？　誰、この子。
...This kid's Mama......is me...?

...Who? Who is...this kid?

全然記憶にない。
I don't remember at all.

『ボクのこと、……忘れちゃった……？　ママがボクを作ったんだよ……？』
『Did you...forget about me...? You made me, right...?』

「……ちょっと、冗談は止めて。…私の子どもは真里亞だけよ。………そう、真里亞はどこ？　真里亞はどこなの？！　真里亞……？！」
"...Wait a second, stop kidding around. ...Maria is my only child. ......That's right, where is Maria? Where is she?! Maria...?!"

私は急に、真里亞がいないことが不安になる。
どうして私はこんなところに独りぼっちでいるの？
I suddenly grew nervous about Maria not being there.

Why am I all alone in a place like this?

真里亞はどこなの？！
真里亞がいてくれるから、私は私でいられるというのに…！
Where is Maria?!

I'm only able to be me because Maria's there for me...!

『…真里亞はいるけど、……今は真里亞じゃない。今は会わない方がいいの。その方がママのためだし、真里亞のためなの。………真里亞のためにも、逃げて。』
『...Maria is here, ...but she's not Maria now. It's better if you don't meet with her now. That's better for your sake, and Maria's as well. ......For Maria's sake as well, escape.』

「え……？　何を言ってるの？　真里亞はどこ？　真里亞？！　返事をしてー！！」
"Huh...? What are you saying? Where is Maria? Maria?! Answer me!!"

『真里亞に見つかっちゃう…！　早くこっちに来て、ママ…！』
『Maria's gonna find you...! Come this way, quickly, Mama...!』

その子は再び私の手を引っ張る。
……恐らく、引っ張る方向は真里亞と逆の方向だ。
だから私は踏み止まる。
That child pulled on my hand again.

...He was probably pulling me in the opposite direction from Maria.

So I stopped walking.

「離してよ…！
"Let go...!

大体、あなたは誰よ…！　あなたにママなんて言われる覚えはないわよ…！」
Just who are you...?! What gives you the right to call me Mama...?!"

『……ボクを作ってくれたのはママだよ…。忘れちゃったの……？　真里亞のバースデープレゼントにするために、
……ボクを手作りしてくれたの、忘れちゃったの……？』
『...Mama is the one who made me... Did you forget...? For Maria's birthday present,

...you made me with your own hands, ...did you forget...?』

「……………………あなた、……まさか……。………真里亞の、……さくたろう…………？！」
".........You...couldn't be... ......Maria's...Sakutarou......?!"

『うん………。ママに作ってもらった、ライオンのぬいぐるみだよ…！』
『Yes...... The lion stuffed animal Mama made...!』

「ぎゃッ！！」
"Gyah!!"

鋭い激痛が走る。
それは、彼に手を握られている手の平からだった。
A fierce, sharp pain struck me.

It came from the palm he had grasped with his hand.

思わず手を弾いて、手の平を見ると、
When I knocked his hand away without thinking...and looked at my palm,

………そこには親指大の穴がぽっかりと開き、どろどろの真っ赤な血を噴出していた。
......a hole the size of a thumb had opened there, and deep-red blood gushed out.

…向こう側が覗けるくらいの、大きな穴だった……。
...It was a hole so big that I could see through to the other side...

『う、うりゅ……！
『U-Uryu...!

大丈夫？！　大丈夫？！　どうしたの…？！』
Are you okay?! Are you okay?! What's wrong...?!』

さくたろうも私の傷に気付き、慌てる。
Sakutarou noticed my wound and panicked.

……その様子を見る限り、なぜ私の手が大怪我を負ったのか理解できないようだった。
...As far as I could tell by looking at him, he couldn't understand why my hand had sustained a serious injury.

しかし、私の目には、彼が私の手を握ったから、このような怪我を負ったように感じられた。
But in my eyes, it felt like I'd been injured because he'd grabbed my hand.

悪気があろうとなかろうとも、
……この子は私に害を与える存在だと理解し、急に不気味になる……。
Regardless of whether there was malice in him,

...I understood that this child was something that would do harm to me, and he instantly seemed eerie...

「あっちへ行って……！！　あなたなんか知らないわ…！　さくたろうは、気持ち悪い下手くそなぬいぐるみでしょ…！！
"Go away...!! You have nothing to do with me...! Sakutarou was just a disgusting, crappy stuffed animal, right...?!!

私は知らないわよ、ママなんかじゃないわよ…！！　あっちへ行って…！　消えてッ！！」
I don't know you, I'm not your Mama...!! Go away...! Disappear!!"

『………う、………………ゅ………。』
『......U......yu......』

ゆっくりと、……さくたろうの首元が、…一文字に裂けていく。
Slowly, ...the base of Sakutarou's neck...was sliced in a horizontal line.

ばっくりと開き、漆黒の内側が覗ける。
……血は噴出さなかった。
ただただ、虚無の漆黒が覗けるだけだった。
It gaped open, and pitch-black insides peeked out.

...No blood poured from it.

Only an empty blackness peeked out.

そして、………その裂け口の内側から…、綿雪をぶわっと噴出し、……綿埃を散らしながら、くしゃりと倒れた。
Then, ......from the insides of the gash, ...cotton snow poured out, ...and as bits of cotton scattered, he slumped over.

そこには、……黄色いくしゃくしゃの布地と、湿気って潰れた綿飴のような綿の塊の残骸があるだけだった。
Then, ...all that remained was a crumpled yellow cloth...and bits of cotton that looked like sticky, crushed cotton candy.

………ライオンの、ぬいぐるみ。
......A lion...stuffed animal.

間違いない。
あの日に私が感情に任せて引き裂いた、さくたろうのぬいぐるみの、残骸だった。
Without a doubt.

These were the remains of the Sakutarou stuffed animal I tore apart on that day, while overcome by my emotions.

それを私が認めた時、…………鋭く長く、そして鼓膜を破るほどに大きな金切り声が、世界を切り裂いた……。
The instant I realized that, ......a long, sharp shriek that could rupture an eardrum tore the world apart...

「うわあああああぁああああああああああぁああぁああぁぁッ！！！　さくたろぉおおおお、さくたろおぉおおおおおお、うわああああぁああああああああう！！　わあああぁああああああぁあああう！！」
"Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhh!!! Sakutaroooooooo, Sakutaroooooooooo, waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaauuhhhh!! Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaauuuuhhhh!!"

堰を切った洪水のように、あるいは壊れたテレビのように。
……真里亞は甲高い声で泣き叫ぶ。
Like a flood from a broken dam, or like a broken TV...

...Maria cried out in a high-pitched voice.

………その、耳をわんわんと苛む真里亞の声に、二つの感情が揺さぶられた…。
......Her voice, which made the ears throb, brought up two emotions in me...

一つは、あぁ、感情に任せてとんでもないことをしてしまった…、という後悔。
今すぐ跪いて真里亞の頭を抱いて、一緒に泣き喚いて謝罪したいという母の気持ち。
One was regret, `Yeah, I was overcome by my emotions and went overboard'.

It was a mother's desire to kneel down right away, hold Maria's head, cry with her and apologize.

……実際、私はすぐにそうした。
真里亞の頭を抱いて、私も泣きながらそれを謝った。
...In actual fact, I did that right away.

I held Maria's head and apologized, crying.

しかし真里亞は泣き止まない。
それどころか、一番の仲良しの友人を引き裂いた私を拒絶し、両手で強く押しのけた。
But Maria didn't stop crying.

On the contrary, she rejected me, the one who had torn her closest friend apart, and pushed me away forcefully with both hands.

不自然な格好で膝を付いていた私は、呆気なく後へ転ぶ。
I had been on my knees in an unnatural position, so I fell backwards easily.

真里亞は黄色い布切れと綿屑を掻き集め、……それに顔を埋めて、さらに泣いた…。
Maria scraped together the yellow scraps of cloth and cotton bits, ...buried her face in them, and cried even more...

それを見て、もう一つの感情が膨らむ。
Watching that, another emotion welled up.

みるみる膨らむ。
……そしてはち切れる。
It welled up rapidly.

...And then, it burst.

だって、謝っても機嫌直さないし、もうどうしようもないし、そもそも真里亞が悪いし…！！
After all, she refused to make up with me even though I'd apologized, and there was nothing else I could do now anyway, and it was all Maria's fault in the first place...!!

いつまでもこんなぬいぐるみ遊びにかまけているから友達が出来ないわけで、変人扱いをされてるわけで…！！
Since she's too busy playing with stuffed animals all the time like this, she can't make any friends, and that's why people treat her like a freak...!!

これはいい機会、教育的指導！
私だって甘やかしてばかりいるわけじゃないんだから…ッ！！
This is a perfect opportunity to give her some instructive guidance!

After all, it's not like I was pampered all the time...!!

物はやがて壊れる、奪われる、壊される！
Everything eventually breaks, is stolen, is destroyed by someone!

私だって玩具や宝物を、兄さんや姉さんやお父様やお母様にたくさん取られた、壊された、馬鹿にされた、捨てられた…！！
Even I had lots of toys and treasures stolen, broken, mocked, and thrown away by my brothers and sister and Father and Mother...!!

でも私、それに対し泣いたことも、……ちょっぴり涙を零したことはあったかもしれないけど……、ここまでわんわん泣いて親を困らせたり、駄々を捏ねたり、機嫌を損ねたり、床をどんどん叩いてばんばん蹴って騒がしくしたことなんて一度もない…！！
But when I cried about that, ...while I might have shed a few tears, ...not once did I sob like this and trouble my parents, throw a tantrum, get mad, hit the floor and kick and make a racket...!!

そうしたいといつも思ってたけど、したらもっと怒られると思って、ずっとずっと我慢してきた。
Even though I always wanted to, I thought I'd get in more trouble if I did, so I always, always held it back.

我慢してきたからコンナニ立派ナ大人ニナレタノニっ！！！
It's because I held it back THAT I WAS ABLE TO BECOME THE WONDERFUL ADULT I AM NOW!!!

その時、ぼろっと変な手応えがした。
At that moment, I felt something strange.

乱暴に道具を扱っていたら、とうとう壊れて、根元からぽっきり逝ってしまった時のような手応え。
The same feeling as when you use a tool recklessly, and it finally breaks, so that only the base is left.

しかし、私は道具なんか何も使ってない。
自分の両手で真里亞の頭を叩き続けていただけだ。
But I wasn't using a tool.

I'd just been repeatedly hitting Maria's head with both hands.

だから、……自分の手を見る。
So, ...I looked at my hands.

……私の両手の手首から先が、折れて、欠けて、……なくなっていた。
...From my wrists onwards, my hands had broken off, splintered, ...and disappeared.

まるで私の腕の、その部分だけが、陶製になってしまったかのよう。
……いや、まさに私の手首から先がいつの間にか陶製になっていて、壊れて落ちているのだ。
As though only that part of my arms had become ceramic.

...No, as though all of me from the wrists onwards had suddenly become ceramic, and had broken and fallen.

真里亞を叩き過ぎたから、ひびが入って割れて落ちてしまったのだ。
……だからほら、…私の両手首は、足元に砕けて落ちてるじゃないか……。
They must have gotten filled with cracks because I hit Maria too much...before falling off.

...After all, look, ...aren't both of my wrists lying smashed by my feet...?

「ひ………？　ひいいいぃいいいいいいぃいぃぃ…！！！」
"Ee......? Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeekkk...!!!"

痛みはない。
しかし、自らの両手首から先が欠けてなくなってしまうという衝撃的な光景が、私に絶叫を強いらせる……。
There was no pain.

But the shocking sight of my hands breaking off from the wrists onwards made me scream...

「な、何これ？！　何これッ？！
"Wh-What is this?! What is this?!

私の手、……手、手…！！　ひぃいいいいいぃいぃぃいッ！！！」
My hands, ...my hands, my hands...!! Eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeekkkk!!!"




「…………………………。………これでもう、……真里亞を叩けないね。」
"...............This way, ...you won't be able to hit me anymore."

私の混乱を他所に、……真里亞はとても冷たい声で、そう言いながら、……私の乱暴から頭を被っていた両手をゆっくりと解く……。
Ignoring my confusion, ...Maria spoke with an icy voice, ...slowly moving her hands away from her head, where they had been defending against my barrage...

「……何よこれ？！　私の手、私の手…！！
"...What's happening?! My hands, my hands...!!

何をしたのよ真里亞、これは何なのよ、何これ何これッ…？！」
What did you do, Maria, what is this, what on earth is this...?!"

真里亞の後に、いつの間にか黒い人影が立っている。
……大人の人影だった。
Behind Maria's back, a black silhouette had appeared.

...It was the silhouette of an adult.

…………誰？！
......Who?!

「………娘の頭を撫で、絵本をめくり、温かい食事を作ることの出来る腕ならば、……残しても良いかと考えた。」
"...If she'd used those hands for patting her daughter's head, flipping through picture books, or making warm meals, ...it may have been worth leaving them on."

「ママは真里亞の頭を撫でるより、叩く方が多いよ。……絵本なんかめくってくれない。ご飯だって作ってくれない。……真里亞が自分で買いに行くの。
"Mama hit my head more than she patted it. ...She never opens picture books. She doesn't even make me food. ...I go to buy it myself."

……でも、同じお店に何度も行っちゃいけないし、顔を覚えられてもいけない、お巡りさんに話しかけてもいけない…。………何で？　どうして？　真里亞が悪いの？
"...But I mustn't go to the same store more than once, mustn't have my face remembered, mustn't talk to the policeman... ......Why? Why is that? Is it my fault?"

真里亞はママに撫でてもらったり、絵本を読んでもらったり、一緒にご飯を食べたりしちゃいけないの…？　どうして？　どうして？！
"Am I not allowed to have Mama pat my head, have picture books read to me, or eat dinner with Mama...? Why not? Why not?!

真里亞、悪くないよッ！！　真里亞悪くない、ママが悪い！！　ママが悪いッ！！」
I didn't do anything wrong!! It isn't my fault, it's Mama's!! Mama's fault!!"

「ママは一緒に遊んでくれないけど、さくたろは一緒に遊んでくれた！
"Mama wouldn't play with me, but Sakutaro did!

霧江は冷酷に、最悪のケースを分析する。
Kyrie coldly analyzed the worst-case scenario.

彼女にとっても、最愛の夫を失ったのは悲しいことだ。

悲しみを、子を守る親としての使命感で乗り越える。
She overcame her sadness with the parental urge to protect children from sorrow.

……霧江も蔵臼も、ともに悲しみを今だけは忘れる強さを持っているようだった…。
...It seemed that both Kyrie and Krauss were strong enough to forget about their grief, if only for the time being...

涙は後でも流せる。
They would let their tears flow later.

……今は子どもたちを守るためにも、まずは行動を起こさなければならない。
...In order to protect the children, they had to act.

「とにかく、ここを脱出しよう…。相当古い牢屋のようだ。何とか鉄格子を破れないだろうか？　室内をくまなく探して、脱出手段を探してみよう。」
"Anyway, let's get out of here... It seems to be a rather old cell. Couldn't we break the bars with something? Let's try searching the entire room for some way to escape."

「おかしな拷問用の檻に混じって、拷問道具とかも落ちてないかしら。武器にもなるし、鉄格子を破る道具にもなるかもしれない。」
"I wonder if there are any torture tools lying around all these torture cages. They might be useful as weapons, or to break the bars."

霧江はポケットからライターを取り出す。
Kyrie pulled a lighter from her pocket.

自分は煙草を吸わないが、留弗夫の煙草に火を付けるために懐に忍ばせていたのだ。
……この薄暗い地下牢を探索するには、極めて重要な光源だった。
She herself didn't smoke, but she kept one tucked away in her pocket to light Rudolf's cigarettes.

...It was an extremely valuable source of light for searching in this dim dungeon.

「紗音は霧江さんを手伝い、室内を探索してくれ。嘉音は私と一緒に鉄格子の具合を確かめてみよう。これだけ古い牢屋だ。ひょっとするとガタが来ているかもしれない。」
"Shannon, help Kyrie-san search the room. Kanon, you help me check out the bars. This is a very old cell. The bars could be loose."

「わ、私は何をお手伝いしましょうかな……。」
"...W-What should I help with...?"

「体力を温存していて下さい。……やがてここに親父殿が現れるだろう。親父殿に言葉が届くのは南條先生だけです。ある意味、南條先生に我々の命は握られているかもしれない。」
"Please just keep up your strength. ...Father will probably come soon. You're the only one whose words will reach him. In a way, you might be holding our lives in your hands."

「……私の言葉など、…もう届きはせんでしょう。申し訳ないが、そのお役には立てそうにない……。」
"...My words...will no longer reach him, I think. I'm sorry, but I don't believe I will be of any use..."

「なら、南條先生のお医者としての知識を貸してください。………人間を即座に昏倒させるような毒って、存在するのかしら。」
"Then lend us your expertise as a doctor. ......I wonder if there exists a drug that can make people instantly faint."

「……人間を即座に昏倒させる毒……？　どういうことですか……？」
"...A drug that makes people instantly faint...? What are you talking about...?"

「私たちは落とし穴に落とされて、この地下牢に落ちてきたと信じている。……あの混乱している場で、私たちはそうだったろうと信じたわ。
"We believe we fell through a pit and landed in this dungeon. ...In that panic-stricken moment, that's what we believed happened."

……でも、この地下牢の広さを測ってみてわかった。この地下牢が、あの食堂の地下というのはありえないことなのよ。」
"...But I measured the breadth of this room and came to a realization. This dungeon can't be underneath the dining hall."

「どうして、ありえないってわかるんですか…？」
"Why do you say that...?"

「…………姉さんは馬鹿だな。この地下牢は、食堂に比べて狭過ぎる。」
"......You're an idiot, Nee-san. Compared to the dining hall, this dungeon is too cramped."

「その通り。１番目に落とされたのは蔵臼兄さん。２番目が私。蔵臼兄さんはこの部屋に落ちてきた時、その場を動いたかしら？」
"Exactly. The first person to fall was Krauss nii-san. The second was myself. When you fell into this room, did you move from that spot, Krauss nii-san?"

「……お恥ずかしいながら、落下の痛みで呻いていたよ。そのすぐ傍らに霧江さんが、すぐに落ちてきたんだ。」
"...It's embarrassing to say, but the landing hurt, and I lay there groaning in pain. Immediately after that, Kyrie-san came crashing down next to me."

「食堂での蔵臼兄さんと私の立ち位置と、落下時の落下場所の距離が、明らかにおかしいのよ。」
"The distance between where we were standing and the places where we landed is clearly off."

「た、…確かに言われてみればその通りです。……その次に落ちたのは私だから、お二人の位置関係はよく覚えている。……食堂でのお二人の間の距離は、この部屋よりもあったかもしれない。」
"C-Certainly, when you put it that way. ...I was the next to fall, so I remember fairly well where you two were standing. ...The distance between you two in the dining hall might have been greater than this entire room."

「私たちは、落とし穴に落ちて、ダイレクトにここに落下したわ。……集合する下水道管みたいに、一度集められてから、ここに落ちたわけじゃない。
"We fell into a pit and directly dropped down here. ...It's not like we fell into multiple interlocking pipes and were all collected here.

落下は一瞬だったでしょう？　そんな凝った配水管みたいな穴を転がされた覚えはないわ。」
The fall was instant, wasn't it? I don't remember rolling around in some sort of elaborate water pipe system."

「…………確かに、落とし穴では説明がつかんな。…おかしな話だ。」
"......True, we can't explain it with a pitfall. ...What a strange tale."

「それと、……霧江さまの仰る、人間を即座に昏倒させる毒というのは、どう関係があるんですか…？」
"What does that have to do...with a drug that makes people instantly faint, like Kyrie-sama was talking about...?"

「………………………。
"...............

……霧江さまは多分、食堂に落とし穴なんかなかったとお考えなんじゃないかな。」
...Kyrie-sama is probably thinking that there were no pitfalls in the dining hall, correct?"

「しかし、現に私たちは落ちたぞ。」
"But in reality, we did fall."

「落とし穴に落ちたような気がする、が正解よ。……無理もないわ。そうとしか例えられない体験だったから。」
"More accurately, we felt as though we fell into pits. ...That was only natural. After all, we experienced something that couldn't be described any other way."

「な、なるほど……。つまり、こう仰いたいわけですな…。……私たちは落とし穴に落とされたのではなく、
"I-I see... In other words, this is what you want to say... ...We did not fall into pits...

……例えば、毒矢のようなもので撃たれ、瞬時に意識を失い、…その倒れて床に突っ伏す瞬間の記憶を、まるで落とし穴に落ちたようと、思い込んでしまっているのかもしれない、と……。」
...We were attacked with something like a blowdart, for example, and lost consciousness instantly. It could be that we just remember the instant we fell to the floor as though it were falling through a pit..."

「…………なるほど。食堂に無数の落とし穴が仕掛けられていて、我々がそれに何十年も気付かず食事をしていたとするよりは、よほど説得力のある話だ。」
"......I see. That's a much more persuasive argument than there being numerous pitfall traps in the dining hall that we've never noticed, even after decades eating there."

「……姉さん。時計はある？」
"...Nee-san, do you have a watch?"

「え？　………う、うん。
"Huh? ......Y-Yes.

懐中時計があるわよ。………えっと、２２時４０分くらいね。」
I have a pocket watch. ......Umm, it's about 22:40."

「………うん。僕の時計もそうなってる。
"......Yes. My watch says the same.

…つまり僕たちは、食堂での大騒ぎから、十数分も時間を経過させてないってことになる。」
...In short, it's only been a bit more than ten minutes since that uproar in the dining hall, at most."

「私の時計も同様だ。…………我々が昏倒させられて、どこかへ担ぎ込まれたと仮定するには、時間の経過が短過ぎる。………時間だけを見るなら、やはり我々は食堂の真下へ、落とし穴で落とされたと考えるのが妥当だ。」
"My watch has the same time. ......That's much too short a time to knock us out and carry us somewhere. ......Judging only from the time, it's reasonable to assume that we did fall through a hole leading directly underneath the dining hall."

「時計の針なんていくらでも弄れるわ。……私たちが気絶している間に、全員の時計を巻き戻したのかもしれない。その可能性がなかったことは、証明不能よ。」
"They could've tampered with the watch hands as much as they wanted. ...While we were passed out, they may have wound everyone's watches back. We're incapable of proving that this possibility doesn't exist."

「………………………。落とし穴にせよ、昏倒させる毒にせよ、
……私たちは用心するに越したことはないというわけですな…。」
"...............Whether it was a pitfall or a drug that induces fainting,

...it does not change the fact that we need to be on guard..."

「……それで、南條先生？　昏倒させる毒は存在するんですか？」
"...Well then, Doctor Nanjo, is there a drug that can do that?"

「それは、…………。……霧江さんの論法と同じですな。…私の知らない未知の毒物に、そういう効用のものがないとは証明できません。」
"Well...... ...It's the same as your reasoning, Kyrie-san. ...I cannot prove that there isn't a drug with that effect that I don't know about."

「……用心に越したことはない、ということね。…ごめんなさい、無駄な質問だったわ。
"...As they say, you can never be too careful. ...Sorry, it was a useless question.

ただ、私の仮説により、この地下牢が食堂の真下とは限らないという可能性は、示唆できたと思う。」
I just thought that with my hypothesis, I could suggest that this dungeon might not necessarily be directly underneath the dining hall."

「なるほど…。………広大な森の中のどこかに隠されていると噂される、親父殿の隠し屋敷の地下牢に運び込まれている可能性もある、ということか。……ここを脱出して外へ出ればそれもわかる。それを詮索するのは、ここから出てからでもいいだろうな。」
"I see... ...There's always the possibility that we were carried off to the hidden mansion they say Father built in the middle of the forest. ...If we can escape from here and get outside, then we'll know. We'll save worrying about that until after we get out."

「その通りね。本当にごめんなさい。さっきから無駄な質問と詮索ばかりだわ。」
"Exactly. I'm truly sorry. I've only been asking about and prying into useless things."

「いいや、とても頼もしいよ。今後も何かに気付いたら教えてくれたまえ。ここを脱出する何かのヒントになるかもしれない。
"No, it's quite promising. If you notice anything else, please tell us. It might become a hint to escaping from here."

………留弗夫からいつも聞かされていたよ。君の発想にはいつも驚かされ、時には重要なヒントにもなるとね。……君がここにいてくれたのは、不幸中の幸いだ。」
"......Rudolf was always talking about you. He said he was always surprised by your ideas, and they would sometimes give him valuable hints. ...The fact that you're here is a blessing within a tragedy."

「……ありがとう。私も留弗夫さんに聞いてるわ。蔵臼兄さんは、普段は威張っているけれど、いざという時は責任感に溢れる、頼り甲斐のある兄だ、って。」
"...Thank you. I heard something from Rudolf-san as well. He said that you usually just swagger about, but when things get serious, you overflow with a sense of responsibility and can be a very dependable older brother."

「はははは…、さすがにそれは世辞が過ぎるね。
"Hahaha, ...that's too kind.

………くそ、それにしても頑丈な鉄格子だ。嘉音の方はどうだね。」
......Dammit, at any rate, these iron bars won't even budge. How are things on your end, Kanon?"

「………いいえ、こちらもまったく。」
"......No, this side is no better."

蔵臼と嘉音は、全ての鉄格子を色々と弄ってみる。
Krauss and Kanon tried wiggling the bars in various ways.

……何本かの鉄格子は、ねじれたり、あるいはわずかにガタガタと揺らせる程度の隙間を感じられたが、それでも人力で破壊できるようなものではなかった。
...There were a few bars that could be twisted...and a few had enough space to rattle a little bit around in, but they couldn't be broken with human strength alone.

……しかし、何かの道具を梃子のように利用すれば、まだ望みもあるかもしれない。
諦めるにはまだ早かった。
...However, there was still hope if they could use some kind of lever-like tool.

It was still far too early to give up yet.

子どもの命が掛かっているのだ。
……望みがなくても、彼らは足掻くことを止めはしないだろう。
The children's lives were hanging in the balance.

...Even if there was no hope, they couldn't stop their struggle.

そして、彼らもそうしている方が良いのだ。
And, it was better for them to act this way.

……それを止めたなら、…伴侶を失った悲しみに再び囚われ、膝を抱いてしまうに違いないから……。
...If they were to stop, ...there's no doubt they'd once again be overcome by the grief of losing their loved ones and curl up, clutching their knees...

「霧江さんたちの方はどうかね。何か見つかったかね？」
"How are you doing, Kyrie-san? Find anything?"

「………握って隠せる程度の石ころは見つかるわ。こんなものでも、武器にはなるかも。さすがに、鉄格子を削り取ることは無理でしょうね。紗音ちゃんはどう…？」
"...I've found some small stones that we could hold onto and hide. Something like this could probably be used as a weapon. Though, it'd probably be impossible to whittle down those iron bars with them. How about you, Shannon-chan...?"

「いいえ、何も。
"No, nothing.

………あ、これ、
......Ah, this is...

…………電話です。」
...a phone."

「繋がってるわけもないわ。
"I doubt it's connected.

……でも、コードは何かを縛ったり武器にも使えるかも。壊して分解すれば金属部品を取り出せるわ。蔵臼兄さん、鉄格子を開ける鍵穴は、もちろんあるわよね？」
...But, we might be able to use the cord as some form of string-based weapon. If we break it, we could take out the metal parts. Krauss Nii-san, there's a keyhole for opening the bars, right?"

「あぁ。だいぶ鍵穴の大きい、大時代的なものだがね。……針金のようなもので弄れば、騙せるかもしれないな。」
"Yes. It's a pretty large hole, quite old fashioned. ...If we twist some wire into it, we just might be able to pick it."

「電話の金属部品で、何か代用できるかもしれない。……その電話、武器になるわね。」
"We might be able to use the metal parts of the phone as a substitute for something. ...This phone will become our weapon."

「投資と同じだよ。情報は武器だ。」
"It's just like investing. Our weapon is information."

電話をまったく通信手段として考えない用途に、蔵臼たちはくすりと笑い合う。
Krauss and Kyrie laughed together at how they hadn't even thought of using the phone as a means of communication.

「…………何やってんの、姉さん。」
"......What are you doing, Nee-san?"

「あ、……その、…電話、つ、繋がってるかなって思って……。」
"Ah, ...um, ...I just wondered if maybe the phone was w-working..."

「…………馬鹿だな、姉さんは。（ぼそり）」
"......You dummy, Nee-san. (*whisper*)"

「え…？　………あれ？」
"Huh...? ......What?"

すると紗音が突然、驚きの声を上げる。
At that point, Shannon let out a small, surprised cry.

「き、霧江さま……！　……この電話、繋がってます。」
"K-Kyrie-sama...! ...This phone, it's connected."

「何ですって…。」
"What did you say...?"

その電話は、まるで引っ越して何もかも空っぽになった無人のオフィスに、電話機だけが取り残されているような、そんな感じで牢の片隅に置かれていたのだ。
It was like when people move out of an office, taking everything with them, leaving only the telephone behind... That's the feeling the phone gave off, having been left in the corner of the cell.

コードはとぐろを巻き、その先は壁に飲み込まれていて、一見すると通じてもおかしくないようには見えていた。
The cord was wound into a coil, the tip of it being swallowed by the wall, and just looking at it, there was no reason to assume that it wasn't hooked up.

……しかし、本当に繋がっていたとは…。
...But, to think that it was actually was...

霧江が紗音から受話器を奪い、耳に当てる。
確かに、ツーという電子音は耳慣れたもの。
……この電話は、確かに生きていた。
Kyrie took the receiver from Shannon and pressed it to her ear.

Certainly, the electric hum of a phone was a familiar sound.

...And this phone was certainly live.

「な、何という幸運…！　警察へ連絡しましょう…！」
"Wh-What good luck...! Let's contact the police...!"

「待ちたまえ…！　話が上手過ぎる。盗聴されてるんじゃないのかね…？！」
"Hold on...! This is too good to be true. Could it be bugged...?!"

「そんな細工するくらいなら、普通は電話線を切断するわ。……連中が本気で見落とした可能性が高い。
"If they were planning a trick like that, normally they would cut the telephone line. ...There's actually a good possibility that they overlooked this.

気付かれたら今度こそ電話線を切断されるかもしれないわ。警察への通報を盗聴されて、何も困ることはないのだし。」
If they notice, they might actually cut the line this time. There's nothing we could tell the police that would be problematic for us if they overheard."

……確かにそれもそうだ。
盗聴は、何か重要な情報を聞き出すために行なうが、今の彼らが外部とするだろう会話の中に、聞かれてまずいことは何も考えられない。
...Surely, that was true.

The point of a wiretap is to overhear some important piece of information, but the way things were right then, she couldn't think of a single thing that would come up in a conversation to the outside world that might be troublesome to have overheard.

霧江は即座に、これは罠であるよりも、金蔵のミスである可能性が高いと判断したのだ……。
Kyrie instantly concluded that it was more likely to be a mistake on Kinzo's part than a trap...

「た、確かに一理あります……。
"Y-You do have a point...

外線は確か、０番からだ……。」
I believe you start with 0 to make calls through the external line..."

「嘉音くん、私は電話するから、あなたは外の様子をうかがってくれる？　誰かが近付いてくる気配があったら知らせて。」
"Kanon-kun, I'm going to make a phone call, so will you watch how things are out there for me? If you sense somebody coming, let me know."

「は、はい……！」
"Y-Yes...!"

嘉音は鉄格子へ駆けて行き、息を殺し耳を澄ます……。
霧江は一同に見守られながら、１１０番をダイヤルする…。
Kanon raced off towards the iron bars, silenced his breathing, and strained his ears...

As everyone present watched her, Kyrie dialed 110...

しかし、何度かフックボタンを押し直し、ダイヤルをやり直す。
However, she pushed the hook down and re-dialed many times.

……うまく行かないようだった。
...It didn't seem to be working very well.

「………外線は０番から？
"...The outside line begins with 0?

１１０番は０１１０じゃないの？　うまく掛からない…。」
110 would be 0110 then, right? It doesn't seem to want to go through..."

「貸したまえ、私が掛けよう……。……………………………。」
"Hand it over here, I'll try to call.................."

蔵臼が受話器を代わり、色々と試す……。
Krauss took the receiver in Kyrie's place and tested various things...

だが結局、警察に通報することは出来なかった……。
But in the end, they were unable to notify the police...

確かに電話自体は生きているのだが、やはりどこかの回線が切断されているのだろう。
The phone itself was definitely live, but the circuit was apparently cut somewhere.

……そう甘くはないということなのか。
...Did this mean that `they' were not so naive?

「……やっぱり、無理ですか……。」
"...So it's useless after all..."

「敵も甘くはないってことね…。……………………。」
"It means our enemies aren't naive either............"

霧江は、はぁっと深い息を吐き出すと、壁にもたれ掛かって、しばらくの間、俯いた。
Kyrie let out a deep sigh, leaned against the wall, and hung her head for a while.

シビアな彼女であっても、一瞬、電話が繋がるという甘い期待を持ったのかもしれない。
As cool-thinking as she was, for a brief moment, she may actually have had the naive hope that the phone might actually work.

……そんな甘えを一瞬でも持ったことを、自嘲気味に苦笑いする。
...She sneered at herself mockingly for holding onto that naive hope for even a single moment.

そしてそれから、……一体、今、ここで何が起こっているのか、思い起こした。
Then, ...she remembered just what was happening here.

……正直なところ、…あれだけ、眼前で見せ付けられたにもかかわらず、……いや、だからこそ……。
...Truth be told, ...even after being shown a scene like that right before her eyes...or rather, exactly because of that...

……あの凄惨な虐殺を、未だ現実のものとは思えない…。
信じられないというより、信じたくなかった。
...She still couldn't think of that gruesome mass murder as something real...

It was less that she couldn't believe it...and more that she didn't want to.

右代宮金蔵が、親族たちを６人も殺した。
Ushiromiya Kinzo killed six family members.

おかしな、魔女のような、悪魔のような者たちを、
……何人も空中から呼び出して……、………魔法のようなもので、
……次々に殺し………。
He summoned strange, witch-like, demon-like people...

...right out of thin air, ......and with something like magic,

...began to kill people one after another......

………………………。
............

めちゃくちゃだ。
……確かに見たのに、その光景を、到底受け容れられない……。
It's just all so screwed up.

...Even though she definitely saw it, there was no way she could accept that spectacle...

「………そんなこと、あるわけがない。………あれはきっと、お父様の友人か何か。…それが、予め食堂のどこかに隠れていて、手品的に突然姿を現して私たちを驚かせただけなんだわ。………そう考えなくちゃ、あのめちゃくちゃを説明できない。」
"......There's no way that's what happened. ......Those were obviously Father's friends or something. ...They just hid somewhere in the dining hall beforehand and used some tricks to appear suddenly and fool us. ...There's no other way to explain something as screwed up as that."

しかし、６人の頭を砕く時に、黄金の矢が室内をぐるぐると飛び回った。
But when those six had had their heads blown apart, a golden arrow had flown around and around the room.

……あれはまるでまさに、
……魔法に見えた。
...That had truly looked like...

...magic.

あれも何かの見間違いだというのだろうか。
魔法のわけがない。きっと仕掛けがあるのだ。
Was that another thing we just saw wrong?

There's no way it was magic. It was definitely some kind of setup.

……頭を砕くくらいだから、きっと爆発物に違いない。
...Since those heads were smashed, there's no doubt it was some kind of explosive.

例えば、駄菓子屋で売っているようなスチレン製の飛行機の玩具を金色に塗り、その先端に強力な爆発物を搭載してあったとか。
For example, a styrene toy plane like they sell at candy stores, painted gold, ...and with a powerful explosive loaded onto the end of it.

……しかし、一見、ランダムに飛んで見せたが、６回それを放ち、それらが完璧に犠牲者の頭部に次々命中するなんて、考えられない。
...However, though it had seemed to be flying about at random, Kyrie couldn't imagine that after being fired six times, each time had perfectly hit the victims square in the head, one after the other.

まさか、コンピューター制御で獲物を探して飛翔し命中する、それこそ誘導ミサイル並のハイテクスチレン飛行機だったとか……？
It couldn't be that there was a computer control system for finding and hitting targets, making it a high-tech styrene plane on the same level as a guided missile, right...?

「………そんな馬鹿馬鹿しい仕掛けを、膨大な私費を投じて作らせたと？　……あの、狂った余興のために……？　“お父様ならやりかねない”って……？」
"......Would he invest such a large amount of money into developing some stupid trick like that? ...For that insane sideshow...? Does this take us back to the old `I wouldn't put it past Father'...?"

謎の人物が何人も突然に虚空から姿を現し、……６人が謎の金色の飛行物体によって頭を粉砕され、……私たち５人は、謎の落とし穴か、さもなくば昏倒する毒矢か何かで眠らされ、謎の地下牢に閉じ込められている……。
A number of mysterious people appeared out of thin air, ...six people had their heads demolished by a mysterious golden flying object, ...and the five of us were locked away in a mysterious dungeon by a mysterious set of pitfalls, or else put to sleep by some fainting poison dart...

親族会議が始まったのは２２時ちょっと過ぎから。
……それから３０分ちょっとが経過したに過ぎない。
The family conference started a bit after 22:00.

...It's only been a bit more than 30 minutes since then.

多分。そのわずかの間に起こった出来事が、……自らが目撃したにもかかわらず、理解できず、整理も出来ない。
Most likely, even though I witnessed it myself, ...that event took place in such a short period of time, so I still can't understand it, and I still can't come to grips with it.

仮に警察に電話が繋がったとしても、自分たちが見たことを正確に伝えることは、誰にも不可能だろう……。
For argument's sake, even if we did get ahold of the police, it would probably be impossible for anybody to accurately explain what we saw...

ついさっき見た光景にもかかわらず、……もう頭の中はぐちゃぐちゃで、自分が何を見たのかさえ、自信がない…。
Even though I saw it just now, ...my brain's fried, and I have no confidence in what I saw myself...

霧江は混乱に飲み込まれそうな自分を何とか奮い立たせ、正気を保つのに精一杯だった……。
Kyrie tried her hardest to cheer herself out of her overwhelming confusion, to just hold onto her sanity...

「くそ、……どうなってるんだ、
……くそ、…くそ…！」
"Dammit, ...what's going on here,

...dammit, ...dammit...!"

蔵臼は自棄になって、フックボタンを何度も押してはダイヤルをし直す。
Krauss started to become desperate, hitting the hook multiple times and resetting the dial.

……蔵臼も、一見冷静を装っているが、混乱は隠せていない。
ダイヤルを繰り返せば繰り返すほどに、冷静さのメッキは剥がれていった…。
...Krauss had also been feigning composure, but he was unable to hide his panic.

The more he retried the dial, the more the pretense of serenity peeled away...

何が何だか、わからない……。
I don't know what's going on anymore...

霧江は、さっきの出来事が夢であってほしいと、祈らずにはいられなかった…。
Kyrie couldn't help but pray that the events that had just occurred were a dream...

………その時、蔵臼の様子が突然変わった。
......At that time, the look on Krauss's face changed.

「う、お、……お…！
"Nn, ...o-oh...!

呼び出してる、呼び出してるぞ…！　コール音がする…！」
I got through, I got through...! It's ringing...!"

"I see, how shallow, old man...! Since we can't contact the police, the external line has probably been cut, but he failed to sever the internal line...!"

「内線？　蔵臼さんはどこに掛けているの…？！」
"The internal line? Krauss-san, where did you call...?!"

...Ah?! Hello! Hello?! It's me...! You're...! Gohda?! Is Jessica there, is she safe...?!!"

ご無事で良かった…！！　はい！　朱志香お嬢様たちも皆さんご無事です…！」
I'm so glad you're safe!! Yes! Lady Jessica and the other children are here as well, safe and unharmed...!"

無事で良かった……！！　母さんは無事なの？！　そこにいるのッ？！」
I'm so glad you're okay...!! Is Mom okay?! Is she there?!"

"......Your......"

蔵臼はそこで言葉に詰まる。
Krauss choked on his words.

……夏妃が目の前で頭部を粉砕され、殺されるのをまざまざと見せ付けられた……。
いつかは朱志香にもそれを話さなければならないだろう。
...Krauss had clearly seen Natushi's head crushed, had seen her killed right before his eyes...

Eventually, he was going to have to tell that to Jessica.

……しかし、今この瞬間、それを伝えるべきか、蔵臼は悩み、言葉を失った。
...However, Krauss began to fret over whether he should tell her now or not...and lost his words.

……しかし、それすらも、この場合は答えのひとつとなった……。
...But even that was an answer under these circumstances...

「……母さんはわからない……。……無事を祈ろう。…今はお前だけでも無事でよかった。」
"...I don't know about your mother... ...Let's pray for her safety. ...For now, I'm just glad you're safe.

「………………………うん。……わかってるよ。………聞いて、……ごめん。」
"............Yeah. ...I understand. ......I'm sorry...for asking."

朱志香の声が涙ぐむ…。
……蔵臼は確信した。
ゲストハウスに合流した郷田たちから、一部始終は聞かされているのだ…。
Jessica's voice was filled with tears...

...Krauss was certain now.

Jessica and the rest had heard everything, start to finish, after meeting up with Gohda and Kumasawa at the guesthouse...

恐らく、朱志香たちは６人もの人間が殺されたことを教えられ、食堂に行こうと息巻いていたに違いない。
When they learned that six people had been killed, they must have been anxious to rush over to the dining hall.

………彼らが屋敷に向かう前に電話できてよかった。
蔵臼は不幸中の幸いのタイミングに胸を撫で下ろす…。
......Luckily, he'd been able to call before they'd stormed off towards the mansion.

Krauss was relieved at this good timing during such a tragedy...

「ここには今、霧江さんと南條先生、それに紗音と嘉音がいる。地下牢のようなところに閉じ込められているが、心配するな。こっちは父さんたちで何とかする。」
"We have Kyrie-san and Doctor Nanjo, as well as Shannon and Kanon here. We've been locked in a place that's like a dungeon, but don't worry. We'll figure something out."

"A dungeon? Where?! We'll come and save you...!!"

"Yeah... ...Grandfather...

"Anyway, put your own safety first. Lock all the guesthouse doors. ...But you mustn't overestimate how safe that will make you. The large window in the first floor lounge might get broken. Stay in your room, and use a bed to make a barricade. There's a toilet and fridge in there too, right? You should be able to stay holed up until tomorrow morning. ...Listen up, I'll say it again. ...Don't think of doing anything violent. Don't even think about trying to take revenge for Mom! Only think of hiding, of getting through this without provoking our enemies."

「うん……、うん……！！　わかったよ、……父さん……！　ううぅううぅ！！」
"Yeah, ......yeah...!! I understand, ...Dad...! Uuuuuuuuuu!!"

その後、受話器は郷田が代わり、大人として子どもたちをよく監督してほしいと念を押される。
After that, Gohda took the phone...and was firmly told to supervise the kids well, as an adult.

……郷田は、顔いっぱいに脂汗を浮かべながら、ハイ！ハイ！と過剰に緊張した返事を連呼するのだった。
...Gohda, with his face covered in a cold sweat, repeatedly replied "Yes sir, yes sir!" in an excessively tense voice.

それから受話器は霧江に代わり、戦人も話し、紗音や嘉音が出れば、譲治や朱志香が出て、ならついでに南條も熊沢も、と双方全員が代わる代わる受話器に出て、所在不明ではあっても、とにかく現在は無事であることを確認し合い、励まし合い、双方の置かれている状況を完全に疎通し合った。
From there, Kyrie took the receiver and spoke with Battler, and when Shannon and Kanon got their turns, George and Jessica answered. Following that pattern, Nanjo and Kumasawa picked up as well, so that all members of both sides took the receiver in turn, confirming that everyone was safe for now, even if their location was unknown, and encouraging each other, coming to an understanding on the current situation for both sides.

いつまでもずっと話をしていたかったが、今は無駄話に花を咲かせている場合ではない。
蔵臼は一度電話を切ることを伝え、ゲストハウス側も了解した。
They wanted to talk forever, but now was not the time to chat.

Krauss explained that they would be hanging up for now, and those in the guesthouse consented.

「また何かあったら連絡する。すぐに受話器を取れるように待機していてくれ。くれぐれも用心してな。無茶なことは絶対にするんじゃないぞ…！」
"If anything happens, we'll call. Wait by the phone so you can pick it up quickly. Again, be careful. You mustn't do anything rash...!"

"Yes, of course. Well then, I'm hanging up for now. Be on your guard."

それで電話は終わった。
With that, the phone call ended.

郷田以下の男子は、迅速に階下に降り、鎧戸を閉め、厳重な戸締りを行なった。
Gohda and the rest of the men quickly descended to the first floor, closed the shutters, and secured the sturdy locks on the doors.

しかし、蔵臼が心配したとおり、１階ラウンジの見晴らしの良い広大な窓はどうしようもなかった。
However, just as Krauss had worried, there was nothing that could be done about the beautiful wide window in the first floor lounge.

ここを破られたら、簡単に中に入られてしまう。
If someone broke that, it would be easy to get inside.

殺人をもはや躊躇しない金蔵ならば、１階部分に侵入することは難しいことではないのだ。
It wouldn't be hard for someone like Kinzo, who hadn't hesitated at committing murder, to invade the first floor.

「……お祖父さまたちは武装している可能性が高い。部屋に閉じ篭るのが最善かつ、唯一の篭城方法になるね。……自ら密室に閉じ篭らざるを得ないのは苦しいところだけど、相手が銃を持っていたら、それしか方法がない。」
"...It's likely that Grandfather and his followers will be armed. Locking ourselves in our room is our best bet, and moreover our only method of forming a barricade. ...It's painful that we have no choice but to hole up in a sealed room, but if our enemies are carrying guns, then that's the only method we have left to us."

「お、お館様は実銃のコレクションをお持ちとの話です。………そう、…あれは銃だ、銃だったんだ…。
"I-I have heard that the Master has a collection of working guns. ...That's right, guns, that was a gun...

だとしたら、……恐ろしい威力の銃だ…！　と、とても太刀打ちは出来ません…！」
If so, ...it must have been a horribly powerful gun...! W-We can't contend with that at all...!"

「…………頭を砕くなんて、すげえ威力だぜ？　マグナム弾とか、そういう類のヤツかもな。下手な扉なら平気で貫通するかもしれねぇな。」
"......It takes a lot of force to smash someone's head open, right? So it might be a magnum bullet or something like that. That'd probably go through a flimsy door like it was nothing."

"If so, then that's even more of a reason to hold out in our room... Let's slide a bed in place, and block the window too. ...If we do that much, then no matter how many guns they've got, they shouldn't be able to raid us."

……こいつは高くつくぞ、クソジジイめ…！」
"Crap, ...all we can do is this passive, one-sided defense. ...Dammit, dealing a finishing blow to Dad, and even capturing Kyrie,

...that's gonna cost you, you damn geezer...!"

「むむむ、無理です、あんな連中に太刀打ちできるわけがありません…！！　しかもお館様だけでなく手下も何人も！　あ、あるいはあんな連中がもっといるかも…！　………あいつらは一体……、何なんだ……。」
"I-I-I-Impossible, there's no way we can compete with them...!! Besides, it's not just the Master, he has his underlings too! Th-There might even be more of them...! ......Just what...are they...?"

戦人は留弗夫の仇を取りたいし、霧江を救い出すためにもここを飛び出したい気持ちでいっぱいだった。
Battler was filled to the brim with the urge to get revenge for Rudolf...and to rush out of here to save Kyrie.

……しかし、郷田の怯えようを見るだけでも、それが蛮勇であるに違いないと思わされる…。
...But just by looking at how terrified Gohda was, there was no doubt in him that this would be reckless...

「……兄貴だって、……悔しいだろ。

「もちろんさ、僕だって悔しいよ。……両親を殺されて冷静でいられるわけがない。
"Of course, I'm torn up about it too. It's not like I can remain calm with both of my parents murdered.

でも、だからこそ冷静にならなくちゃいけない！　僕たちが無駄に命を落とすようなことを、殺された親たちが望むと思うかい？　思うわけがない！　せめて子どもだけは逃げ延びてほしいと願ってるはずだ。
But specifically because of that, I have to remain calm! Do you think our dead parents would want us to die in vain? There's no way they would! They'd want for at least their children to escape."

だから僕は生き残るよ。そして警察に通報し、全てを暴く。仇は法廷が取る。それが僕の復讐だ。……刺し違えてでも仇を取ってほしいなんて、…親たちが望んでいるわけもない。そうだろ…？」
"So I will survive. And I'll report this to the police and uncover everything. I'll leave my enemies to the courts. That is my revenge. ...There's no way our parents would want us to die taking revenge for them. Right...?"

...Dammit, you old bastard, what's this about a ceremony...?! If we're supposed to be sacrifices for something like that, then we'll escape no matter what it takes, ruining this precious ritual of yours..."

「それでいいよ。……それに、戦人くんにはまだ霧江さんがいる。僕にだって紗音がいる。とにかく慎重に行動して、チャンスを待とう。僕たちの不用意な行動は、捕らわれの彼らに不利益を与える可能性だってあるんだから。」

"Grandfather has a number of subordinates, and they're all armed, correct...?"

「え、……えぇ、そうです。………そして多分、
…みんな武装を……。」

all armed..."

郷田は、金蔵に仲間がいたとは話せたが、……若い女性ばかりで、魔女みたいで、おかしな魔法で殺人を行った、……とまでは言えなかった。
Gohda had been able to say that Kinzo had comrades with him, ...but he hadn't been able to mention that they were mostly young women, like witches, ...who had used strange magic to murder.

そんなことを話せば、正気を疑われるのがオチだ。
If he had said that, it would only have cast doubt on his sanity.

…いや、それどころか、自分自身でだって、自分は何を見たのか未だに理解できず、自らの正気を疑っているのだから。
...No, not only that, he himself still couldn't understand what he had seen, and was doubting his own sanity.

……しかし、性別がどうであれ容姿がどうであれ、……魔法であれ銃であれ。
...But, regardless of sex or appearance, ...regardless of whether it was done with magic or a gun.

彼女らが金蔵の命令に従い、６人を瞬く間に殺したことだけは、動かしようのない事実なのだ……。
The fact that those girls had followed Kinzo's orders......and killed six people in an instant...was an unshakable truth...

あの連中がゲストハウスにまで襲ってきたなら、……どうなるのだろうか。
この程度の戸締りなど、きっと何の意味もないだろう……。
If that group came to attack the guesthouse as well, ...what would happen?

Just closing the doors and windows like this was surely meaningless...

郷田も、……そして熊沢も。
Gohda...and Kumasawa...

あの食堂の大虐殺を目の当たりにした二人は、自分が見たものをどう受け止めて良いかさえわからず、頭を抱えるより他なかった…。
The only thing left for those two, who had witnessed that massacre in the dining hall, was to cradle their heads without knowing how to interpret what they had seen...

「………熊沢さん、大丈夫……？　お茶飲む……？」
"......Kumasawa-san, are you okay...? Want some tea...?"

「ほ、ほほほほほ…。ありがとうございますね、えぇ、ありがとうございます…。…申し訳ございませんが、しばらくそっとしていただけますか………。」
"H-Hohohohohoh... Thank you very much, thank you... ...I'm sorry, but may I be left with my thoughts for a little while......?"

真里亞が気遣うが、熊沢は未だ混乱を拭えないようだった。
Maria tried to be nice, but it seemed that Kumasawa still hadn't been able to clear away her confusion.

「……真里亞、気を遣ってくれてありがとうだぜ。熊沢さんは休ませてやってくれ。」
"...Maria, thanks for being so considerate. Let's let Kumasawa-san rest for now."

「……うー。」
"...Uu-."

朱志香も、惨劇の目撃にショックを受けているに違いないと熊沢を気遣うが、……熊沢が見てきた信じ難い光景にまでは、想像が及ぶわけもない…。
Jessica was also worried about the shock those two must have received after witnessing such a tragedy, ...but her wildest dreams couldn't even come close to the unbelievable scene Kumasawa had witnessed...

しかしそれでも、母を殺され、父が捕らわれの身になっている現状に、朱志香も落ち着けるわけがない。
Nevertheless, with her mother murdered and her father captured, it wasn't as though Jessica could stay calm either.

不安や悲しみを、金蔵に対する怒りで蓋をし、室内をいらいらと歩き回るのだった。
She sealed her anxiety and sadness using her anger towards Kinzo...and walked irritatedly around the room.

「…………熊沢さん。
"......Kumasawa-san,

母さんは本当に、………死んじゃったの？」
is Mom really......dead?"

「……え、えぇ……。……あんな酷い死に方を私は…、見たことがありませんとも……。」
"...Y-Yes... ...I've never seen such a...horrible way to die before..."

「ひょっとするとまだ生きてて、
………手当てをすれば助かるなんてことは、
……ないんだよな……？」
"Is it possible that she's still alive...

...and that if we fix her up,

...we could save her...?"




「………………………。……あ、………頭が、あんなことになって生きていられるわけが、………ありません……。」
"..................I-It's not possible for a person to have something like that done to their head......and live..."

「……………………………。……そりゃそうだぜ…。……頭が砕けちまったら、
……手当てなんて必要ねぇよな、普通……。」
".....................Yeah, you're right... ...There's no need for first aid...

once your head's smashed, usually..."

ゲストハウスに飛び込んできた郷田は、興奮のあまり、食堂の虐殺を、包み隠さず全て話してしまった。
When Gohda had come flying into the guesthouse, he had, overcome with agitation, told about the massacre in the dining hall without concealing anything.

……彼ら自身が未だ信じきれない、魔女や魔法の話だけは除いて。
...Except for the part about witches and magic, which they themselves still couldn't believe.

それはつまり、夏妃たちの無残な死に様さえ包み隠さず話してしまったということだ。
In other words, he hadn't even sugarcoated the cold-blooded way in which Natushi and the others had died.

……今さらではあるが、熊沢は、きっと自分たちは失言したに違いないと後悔していた……。
...It was too late now, but Kumasawa regretted the fact that they'd obviously said too much...

しかし朱志香は、軽く小首を振りながら、苦々しくはあっても笑いながら言った。
However, while lightly shaking her head and with a slightly painful laugh, Jessica spoke.

「……いや、むしろ話してくれたお陰で冷静になれたぜ。
"...Actually, thanks to what you told us, I was able to stay level-headed.

………頭を砕かれちまった、ってところを伏せられてたら、…私はひょっとすると生きてるかもしれないって言って、屋敷へ向かい祖父さまに出くわして、……ひょっとすると殺されてたかもしれない。……一抹の希望が、命取りになった可能性だってあるわけさ。………その意味では、感謝してるよ。」
......If you'd avoided mentioning the part about her head being smashed, ...I would've thought she might still be alive. Then I would've run off towards the mansion, met Grandfather, ...and I might've gotten killed. ...That sliver of hope could've been fatal in the end. ......So I'm grateful."

「……本当に申し訳ございません……。言葉をあまりに選ばなかったことはお詫びします…。」
"...I'm truly sorry... I'm so sorry we didn't choose our words more carefully..."

「今はいいよ。母さんはもうどうしようもないけど、……父さんはまだ生きてる。嘉音くんも紗音も、霧江叔母さんも南條先生もね。……何とか彼らを助けたいし、彼らに負担を掛けないためにも、余計なことをするべきではない。……電話の前で待機してることが、今は一番の協力になるかもしれないし。」
"Don't worry about that now. There's nothing we can do for Mom, ...but Dad's still alive. Kanon-kun and Shannon, and Aunt Kyrie and Doctor Nanjo too. ...I want to save them somehow, so we shouldn't do anything unnecessary that might make things worse for them. The most helpful thing we can do right now might be to wait by the phone."

ひょっとすると、脱出のために陽動を掛けてくれ、という電話があるかもしれない。
もしくは、所在がわかり、救出に来てくれという電話もあるかもしれない。
They might receive a phone call asking them to create a diversion while the others escaped.

Or, the others might discover their location and call for rescue.

……その時、迅速に行動するためにも、朱志香はここで待つことが、今できる唯一のことだと理解していた…。
...Jessica understood that in order to act promptly when that time came, the only thing they could do for the time being was to wait in this room...

下の戸締りと確認を終えた、譲治、戦人、郷田の３人が戻ってくる。
３人とも、手には色々と荷物を抱えていた。
Once they had finished inspecting the downstairs area and locking up, George, Battler, and Gohda returned.

Each was holding various objects.

譲治はラウンジや倉庫から見つけてきた、飲み物や缶詰、クラッカーなどの軽食、そして救急箱。
George had things like drinks, canned food, crackers, and other types of snacks he had found in the lounge and a storage room, as well as a first aid kit.

篭城する上で欠かせない消耗品ばかりだった。
They were all consumables that would be essential during a seige.

郷田は、大きな折りたたみ式の梯子と大工道具。
Gohda had a large folding ladder and carpentry tools.

万一の時は、扉を内側から打ち付けて封印するためだ。
梯子は、その際に窓から脱出するためのものだ。
Those were to seal the door from the inside, just in case.

If it came to it, the ladder was for escaping out the window.

戦人は、刃物や棒物などの武器になるものを持ち込んだ。
Battler had brought up objects that could be used as edged weapons or poles.

包丁は言うに及ばず、分解したテーブルの足は棍棒に使えるし、帽子スタンドを分解して作ったという身の丈ほどもありそうな棒は、穂先がないとはいえ、槍のように使えるに違いなかった。
In addition to the obvious kitchen knife, there was a dissembled table leg that could be used as a club...and a pole roughly the size of a person, which he'd apparently made by taking apart a hat stand. Even though the pole had no point, it could surely be used like a spear.

……相手が銃などで武装している可能性が高いため、役に立つかどうかは怪しい。
...There was a good chance that their enemies had guns, so it was dubious whether these would be of any use.

しかしそれでもないよりはマシだし、それによって少しでも安心できるなら、精神安定効果も期待できるだろう。
But it was still better than not having them, and if having these could give them at least a little peace of mind, then they'd be useful for their calming effect.

そして、室内のベッドやソファーを立て掛け、扉を封鎖する。
Then, the bed and sofa were placed up against the door, barricading it.

釘で打ちつけてまでは封印しない。
……蔵臼たちが脱出し、合流してくる可能性も残っているからだ。
They didn't go so far as to seal it up with nails.

...There was still a chance that Krauss and the others would escape and come to meet up with them.

彼らは階段上にもバリケードを設けてきたらしい。
賑やかに音がするように仕掛けをしたので、警報代わりにもなるという。
戦人の発案らしかった。
They had apparently set up a barricade at top of the stairs as well.

It had been set up in a way that would create a racket, so it would serve as a warning alarm as well.

That had apparently been Battler's idea.

その為、テレビは消す。
………１階のガラスを破られた時、その音がわかるように。
For that reason, they turned the TV off.

......This way, if the first floor window were to be broken, they would hear.

スイッチを切れば、あとは不気味な静寂。
Once the switch had been turned, all that was left was an eerie silence.

……暴れる雨と風の音。
こんな、不安感で押し潰されそうな中で、今夜を過ごさねばならないというのだろうか。
...The sound of violent wind and rain.

Were they going to have to spend the whole night being crushed by such suspense?

船が迎えに来るのは、明日の朝ということになっている。
The boat would come tomorrow morning.

しかし、天気予報を見る限り、明日いっぱいは台風で船は出せないだろう。
However, judging by the weather report, most of tomorrow was going to be covered in the typhoon, and the boat probably wouldn't come.

……明後日の朝には台風は通過するとしている。
...The typhoon was set to pass by in the morning of the day after tomorrow.

つまり、船がやってくるのは明後日の朝、……即ち、１０月６日の朝。
In other words, the boat would be arriving in the morning after next, ...the morning of October 6th.

そして今は、１０月４日の深夜。
And right now, it was late at night on October 4th.

………殺人鬼と化した金蔵が、不気味な仲間を連れて徘徊するこの島で、彼らは３０時間以上を過ごさねばならないのだ……。
......They would have to spend more than 30 hours on this island, with Kinzo turned cold-blooded murderer and his weird companions prowling about...

窓の鎧戸を閉めていても、きっと灯りはわずかに漏れている。
ここに隠れていると知らせているようなものかもしれない。
Even with the shutters closed, there would definitely be a little bit of light seeping out.

It might let the enemy know that they were hiding here.

……灯りも消すべきではないかと戦人は提案した。
...Battler suggested that it might be best to turn off the lights.

しかし、テレビを切っただけで、これだけ不気味な気配に支配されてしまったのだ。
But they had already been overwhelmed by a ghastly feeling just from turning the TV off.

……その提案を真っ向から反対する者こそいなかったが、同意する者もまた、ひとりもいなかった………。
...There wasn't anyone who directly challenged his proposal, but then again, there wasn't a single other person who agreed with it......

「……うー。テレビ駄目なの？」
"...Uu-. We can't watch TV?"

「あぁ、悪いが我慢してくれ。……敵の侵入の音を聞き逃すわけにはいかない。」
"Yeah, sorry, but you'll have to bear with it. ...We can't just let the sound of the enemy breaking in slip by."

「……………………。……つまんない。」
"...............Boring."

母親が死んだことを伝えられているにもかかわらず、真里亞だけは、どこか危機感がない。
テレビを消され、それを不満に思っているようだった。
Even though she had been told of her mother's death, Maria alone didn't feel an approaching sense of danger.

She just seemed to be upset that the TV had been turned off.

………このような異常事態を目の当たりにしていても、危機感を共有できないのだろうか？
……幼いゆえに？
......Even though she's in such a bizarre situation, can she not share in our sense of danger?

...Is it because she's so young?

幼子の、そんなわずかの違和感にさえ、今の戦人には、真里亞がとても不気味な存在に感じるのだった……。
To Battler, even this faintly unsettling feeling from such a young girl made him sense that there was something very eerie about Maria...

「とは言ったものの。………万策、尽きたわね。鉄格子は何とかなりそう？」
"That said, ......we've already done all we can. Do you think you'll be able to do anything about the bars?"

「……残念だが、想像以上に堅牢だ。
"...Unfortunately, they're tougher than expected.

いつ頃に作られたものか知らんが、耐用年数も文句なし。実に優良な物件だよ。」
I don't know when these were made, but there's no problem with their lifetime guarantee. These truly were built rather well."

くすくすと霧江は笑う。
……打つ手なしの状況下ではあるが、少しだけ和んだ。
Kyrie chuckled softly.

...They had no moves they could make, but she had calmed just a little.

「……さながらここは、取られた駒を置く、駒置き場ですな。……打つ手は、もはやありませんか……。」
"...This place is just like the capture pile of a chess game. ...So, are there no remaining moves left to us...?"

「まだよ。諦めるには早いわ。思考の停止は鼓動の停止に同じよ？」
"Not yet. It's still too early to give up. If we stop thinking, we might as well stop breathing, right?"

「だな。……チェスの駒置き場に意味はないが、将棋ならば大きな意味を持つこともある。
"Exactly. ...Chess pieces in the capture pile may serve no purpose, but in shogi, they can be quite significant.

駒置き場の一枚の歩が、相手にプレッシャーを与えることだってあるはずだ。」
Just one captured pawn should be able to put pressure on the opponent."

「なるほど…。しかし、この鉄格子はどうしようも……。」
"I see... But still, there's nothing that can be done about these bars..."

「私たちにはね。………でも、ここの場所を特定し、郷田さんに連絡することが出来れば、助けに来てもらうことは出来るかも。」
"For us, maybe. ......But, if we can figure out where this is and contact Gohda-san, he might be able to come and save us."

「なるほど…。しかし、郷田さんに、危険を強いることになりますな……。
"I see... But that would mean putting Gohda-san in danger...

その場合、成人男性が不在になるゲストハウスのお子さんたちも不安です…。」
And if that happens, I would also be worried about the children in the guesthouse, alone without a full-grown adult male..."

「リスクを恐れるなら、事態が好転するまで塩漬けにするのも悪くない。
"When you're afraid of risk, it's all right to bide your time until the price starts to go up.

……もっとも、損切りを恐れれば、紙切れ同然になるかもしれんがね。……我々の命がだが。」
...However, if you're too afraid to cut your losses, you might end up with just a scrap of paper. ...Though in this case, that represents our lives."

「親の沽券もね。……私たちで何とかするから大人しくしなさいって、偉そうに電話して、その舌の根も乾かない内に、助けを求めるなんて。実に格好悪いわね。くすくす。」
"And our dignity as parents, right? After talking big like that during the telephone call, telling them that they should behave because we'll manage something on our own, we can't just start asking for help right away. That would be very uncool. *giggle*."

「この期に及んでは、下らんプライドなどとっくに紙切れだ。
"By this point, I've long since thrown out such useless pride.

………知恵を絞ろうじゃないか。ここはどこなんだ？　本当に食堂の真下なのだろうか？　それとも、屋敷とは異なる別の場所だろうか…？」
......Why don't we put our heads together? Where is this? Is it really underneath the dining hall? Or else, is it a different place, separate from the mansion...?"

蔵臼は、霧江と南條の３人で、今後のことを話し合うのだった。
Krauss, Kyrie, and Nanjo began to discuss this further.

嘉音は鉄格子の前にしゃがみ、じっと気配をうかがっている。
Kanon was squatting by the bars, silently trying to sense anyone's presence.

……それを命じられたままだからだ。
...Just as he had been ordered.

紗音もその傍らに来て、一緒にしゃがみ込むのだった。
Shannon came close to him, and they both squatted down together.

「…………気配は感じるの？」
"......Do you sense anyone?"

「………うん。……こちらに意識は向けていないけれど、比較的近くに、誰かいる。」
"......Yes. ...They haven't focused their attention in this direction, but there's somebody relatively close by."

「それはニンゲン…？」
"Is it Human...?"

「…………山羊たちだと思う。あいつらの吐息は、実に賑やかだよ。」
"......I think it's the goats. Their breathing is rather noisy."

嘉音の気配を察する力は、ニンゲンのそれをはるかに上回っている。
嘉音は賑やかと称するが、蔵臼たちにはわずかほども気取れないだろう。
Kanon's ability to sense the presence of others was several levels above that of a Human.

He said that their breathing was noisy, but Krauss and the rest couldn't even pick up the slightest hint of it.

……だからこそ、それを素直に報告したところで、彼らは嘉音の耳を疑うだけに違いない。
...Therefore, if he had obediently reported it, they would have merely doubted Kanon's ears.

「……………捕まっちゃったね。」
".........They got us, didn't they?"

「…………………。……珍しいよ。殺されないで、捕まるなんて。」
"...............It's rare. To think that they captured us without killing us."

「今回はベアトリーチェさまがお越しにならないし。お館様が書斎を出られるし。……何が何だかわかんないね…。」
"This time, Beatrice-sama didn't make an appearance. And the Master left his study. ...I don't have a clue what's going on..."

「わかるさ。………何が起ころうと変わろうと、全てあの魔女の気まぐれと余興。結果は何も変わらないのさ。」
"I know. ......Whatever happens or changes, it's all for that witch's fickle entertainment. In the end, nothing will change."

「今回は黄金郷に、………行けるかな。」
"I wonder if we'll be able to......go to the Golden Land this time."

「さぁね。僕たちは脱落率が高いから。」
"Who knows. We have a high rate of losing."

「…………そう言えば、二人で第一の晩を生き延びたのって、ずいぶん珍しいね。……儀式が始まってるのに、こうして二人でお話できるなんて、何だかすごく珍しい気がする。」
"......Come to think of it, it's very rare for us to survive the first twilight together. ...I get the feeling that it's incredibly unusual for us to be able to talk together like this even though the ceremony has already begun."

「そうかもね。……でも、それもまた、魔女の余興だろうさ。僕たちがいつもすぐに脱落するから、今度は少し生き延びさせて、からかってやろうくらいにしか思ってないよ。」
"That may be. ...But even that's just for the witch's entertainment, I'll bet. I can't think of it as anything other than her letting us live just a little longer to ridicule us, since we usually drop out right in the beginning."

「また、………黄金郷には、辿り着けないのかな。」
"I wonder......if we'll be unable to reach the Golden Land again."

「どうせそうさ。……下手な期待を持つと、また付け込まれる。」
"I'm sure we won't make it there. ...If we hold onto any foolish hope, we'll get taken advantage of again."

「くす。そうだね。前回は嘉音くんが付け込まれたもんね。」
"*giggle* That's right. Last time, you got taken advantage of, didn't you?"

「……僕は馬鹿だ。」
"...I'm an idiot."

嘉音は口を尖らせてそっぽを向く。
紗音はくすりと笑い、謝るように肩を寄せた。
Kanon made a sour look and turned his head.

Shannon laughed softly and apologetically leaned towards his shoulder.

「でも、……お嬢様が無事でよかったね。」
"But...I'm glad Milady is safe."

「……第一の晩を逃れただけさ。……それ以降の晩に、より無残な方法で殺されるのを待たされているだけかもしれない。
"...She's only escaped from the first twilight. ...She might just be waiting for an even crueler death later on.

それを言ったら姉さんこそ。……譲治さまが無事でよかったじゃないか。二人で黄金郷に辿りつけるといいね。」
What about you, Nee-san? ...Aren't you glad George-sama's safe? It'd be nice if you two could reach the Golden Land together."

「………ありがと。同じことを嘉音くんとお嬢様にも。」
"......Thank you. I wish the same for you and Milady as well."

「ぼ、僕は期待はしてないよ。………姉さんの言うとおりだ。あの魔女は、ご褒美をぶらさげて、相手が右往左往するのを見て楽しんでるだけなんだ。………どうせ誰も黄金郷に行けやしない。……僕がお嬢様と黄金郷に辿り着きたいと願ってしまったなら。………あいつはそれこそ面白がって、絶対に僕たちを辿り着かせたりはしないさ。」
"I-I wasn't hoping for anything like that. ...It's just as you say. That witch is only having fun, dangling prizes in front of people and watching them vainly try to get them. ......I'm sure no one will be able to go to the Golden Land. ...If I wish to reach the Golden Land with Milady, ...then that person will find it funny...and will certainly never let us reach that place."

「……そうだね。………ベアトリーチェさまは、より面白くなるように、生贄の順番を考えてる。」
"...You're right. ......Beatrice-sama is thinking about which order of sacrifices will be the most interesting."

「無作為に選んでるなんて、大嘘だ。あのペテン師魔女め…。……どうせ、黄金郷に辿り着けばあらゆる願いが叶うなんてのも、嘘っぱちに決まってる。」
"The whole thing about them being chosen at random is just a blatant lie. That swindling witch... ...All that about having any wish you want granted in the Golden Land is probably just a lie too."

「………………そんなことはないよ。黄金郷は、……素晴らしいところだよ。」
".........That's not true. The Golden Land is...a wonderful place."

「行ったことあるの？」
"Have you been there?"

「………ちょっぴりだけね。それすらも、ベアトリーチェさまの戯れだったのだろうけど。」
"......Only for a little bit. Though, even that was probably just a joke of Beatrice-sama's."

「……………どんなとこなの、そこ。」
".........What's it like there?"

「うん。………素晴らしいところだよ。…うまく説明できない。安らかな夢の中みたいな世界。」
"Well, ......it's a wonderful place. ...I can't really explain it well. It's like a world from a pleasant dream."

「薔薇が咲き乱れてて、美しい蝶が舞ってるような、極楽みたいな感じ？」
"A paradise-like place, with roses blooming all over and beautiful butterflies dancing about, or something like that?"

「……そういう具体的なイメージのところじゃないの。本当に、夢の中みたいなところなの。そこにいる時は、とても穏やかで安らかで、……いつまでも眠ってることを許されてる、まるで休日の早朝のお布団の中みたいな感じ。
"...It's not a place with a tangible image like that. It's really like the inside of a dream. When you're there, it's very gentle, very peaceful, ...and you're allowed to sleep as long as you want, like when you wake up early on a day off, lying on a futon."

……カーテンの隙間から日が差してきて、そろそろ起きないと、と思うんだけど、今日は休日だから起きなくてもいいんだって気付いて、もう一回お布団の中に潜り込む時みたいな、そんな気持ちになれる場所。」
"...Sunlight comes in through the cracks in the curtains, and you think you'll have to wake up soon, but then you realize it's your day off, and you can go back to sleep... It's a place where you can feel like that."

「僕なら損したと思うな。休日なのに勘違いして起き出すなんて、姉さんくらいだ。………それで？」
"I think it'd be wasted on me. Waking up on accident even though it's your day off is something only you would do, Nee-san. ......So?"

「うん。そこにいた時はね、満たされてて、とても穏やかだった。でも、元の世界に戻ってくると、つい直前までそこにいたはずなのに、うまく思い出すことが出来ないの。
"Well, when I was there, it was very satisfying and very calm. When I returned to this world, even though I had just been there a second ago, I couldn't remember it well.

ついさっきまで見ていた夢が思い出せないのに良く似てる。…でも、とっても穏やかで静かな世界だったことだけは覚えてるの。」
It's like when you can't remember a dream you were just having. ...But I still remember that it was a very calm and quiet world."

「………それだけ？　何だ、あいつが偉そうに言う黄金郷なんて、大したことないな。……何でも願いが叶う場所だと思ってたのに。」
"......That's it? What the heck, that Golden Land she's always bragging about isn't anything great at all. ...I thought it was a place where all your wishes come true."

「その通りだよ。何でも願いが叶う場所。………少し違うかもしれない。何も願わなくてもいい場所、が正解かもしれないね。
"That's right. It's a place where all your wishes will be granted. ......Well, maybe that's not quite it. It might be better to say it's a place where you won't wish for anything."

……例えば嘉音くんが、寒くて上着が欲しいと願った時、上着をもらえればとても幸せなことだけど、そもそも温かい部屋にいられたなら、上着が欲しいなんて願う必要さえもないでしょ？
"...For example, Kanon-kun, if you were cold and wished you had a jacket, you'd be happy to be given one, but if you were in a warm room to begin with, there wouldn't even be a reason to want a jacket, right?"

……黄金郷はそういうところなの。大抵の願いは、願う必要さえなくなる。全てから解放された、何もかもが穏やかな世界なの。
"...That's what the Golden Land is like. There's no need to even wish for most wishes. It's a world where everything is calm."

与えられて幸せ、という概念さえも超越した、全てから解放された世界とでも言えばいいのかな。」
"You could even say it's a place that transcends the concept that having your wishes granted will bring happiness, ...a world released from everything."

「……………………。……何だか宗教っぽい世界だな。」
"...............It sounds somewhat like a religious world."

「そして、そこでは全てが平等なの。意思ある存在は全てが平等。……ニンゲンも家具も魔女もない。……そこでの私は誰とも対等で公平。もう家具だからと、何も自分を恥じる必要がない。

......So, you want to go to that Golden Land with George-sama. How strange. The Golden Land is a utopia where you can be pleased with everything, right? Wouldn't you be content even if George-sama wasn't there?"

"Of course, just by being peaceful, calm, and equal, it's an incredibly happy world. ...But I guess you could say that it's a world of zero, where you're released from all negative worries. The human world is filled with negatives, so of course a zero world is incredibly happy, ...but it's still zero. *giggle* What a luxurious problem to have."

……それはこういう感じ。穏やかな休日の朝のまどろみの時。……最愛の人も隣にいてくれて、手を握っててくれたなら、もっともっと、素敵な幸せになれる、………みたいな。…ごめん、姉さんは例えが下手くそだね、馬鹿だから。」
"...It's something like this. When you're nodding off on your quiet holiday morning, ...if the person you love the most is next to you and holding your hand, then it can become an even greater, more wonderful happiness, ...something like that. ...Sorry, your Nee-san is too dumb to be any good at analogies."

僕はもっとこう、俗物的な。……魔法の薬を与えられると、ニンゲンに生まれ変われるとか、そういう感じの世界を想像してたよ。」
I'm more worldly-minded. I imagined a world where we would be given some magic medicine, and we could be reborn as Humans, or something more like that."

"......If you go, you'll understand. If Beatrice-sama really is a fickle person, then surely some day, she'll let you get a glimpse of it too. ...If so, then you'll be able to understand my analogy."

"..................Well, I'm not holding my breath. ...At any rate, it seems like game over for us this time already. I'll hope for another chance."

「……そうだね。おかしな期待を持つと、ベアトリーチェさまにまた付け込まれる。………何も考えず、ただ運命に身を任せるのが、私たちには一番かもしれない。」
"...You're right. If we cling to any overambitious hopes, Beatrice-sama will take advantage of us. ...It might be best to just stop thinking...and let fate take care of us."

「………僕たちはただ、チェスの駒であればいいんだ。……何を考えても考えなくても、どうせ魔女のチェス盤からは逃れられない。後のお役目は、どういびり殺されるか、ただ待つことだけさ。……そんな僕らに、黄金郷の夢なんて虚しすぎる。」
"......We can just be simple chess pieces. ...No matter what we think or don't think, we can't escape from the witch's chessboard. Our role is now just to wait and see how we'll be tortured to death. ...For us, the dream of the Golden Land is too empty."

「………………そう、…だね。……ごめん……。」
".........You're...right. ...Sorry..."

嘉音は肩を竦め、お役目の邪魔だからそっとしておいてくれと言い放ち、紗音を遠ざける。
Kanon shrugged his shoulders, then told Shannon to leave him alone because she was in the way of his duty, distancing himself from her.

紗音は、不適当な話題を口にして、かえって嘉音を傷つけてしまった自分の浅はかさに気付き、俯いて下唇を噛むのだった…。
Realizing her thoughtlessness in bringing up such an inappropriate topic and instead hurting Kanon, Shannon bit her lower lip and stared at the ground...

紗音もそれ以上はしつこくしない。
ひとり壁際に行き、しゃがみ込んだ。
Shannon wouldn't bother him any more.

She went off and crouched down in a corner by herself.

「…………………ん、」
"............Nn-"

その時、嘉音がぴくりと反応する。
微かな物音に反応する猫の耳みたいだった。
At that moment, Kanon perked up.

It was like the ears of a cat when it reacts to a strange sound.

「どうしたの。」
"What's wrong?"

「……しっ。
"...Shh.

………旦那様、誰か来ます。」
......Krauss-sama, someone's coming."

They ended their conversation and strained their ears.

……しばらくの間、何も聞こえなかったが、やがて、ぞろぞろという複数の人間が歩く気配が聞こえるようになる…。
...For a while, they couldn't hear anything, but eventually, they were able to hear the shuffling sounds of a large group of people walking...

「……おいでなすったわね。」

「年貢の納め時か、さもなくば、最初で最後のチャンスか。」

「期待してるわ。
"We're counting on you.

………………………。」
..............."

霧江は、さっきのゲストハウスの電話で、向こうの時間を聞いていた。
During the last phone call, Kyrie had asked what the time over at the guesthouse was.

……すると、霧江の時計と同じで、その結果、彼女らの時計は巻き戻されていないことがわかったのだ。
...By doing that, Kyrie had learned that it was the same as her watch, and she had learned that their watches hadn't been set back.

ゲストハウスの壁掛け時計だけではない。
譲治や郷田などの複数人の時計とも一致した。
It wasn't just the clocks on the walls in the guesthouse.

Several people's watches, including George's and Gohda's, had matched.

……だとすると自分たちは、食堂での虐殺から、ほんの数分ほどでこの地下牢に移されていることになる。
...If that was the case, then it had only been a few minutes between the time of the massacre in the dining hall and the time they had been transported to the dungeon.

昏倒させてから運び出すほどの時間は経過していない。
Not enough time had passed for them to be knocked out and carried away.

ならばやはり、あれは落とし穴で、ここは食堂の真下なのだろうか……？
南條がうまくこの場所を聞き出せることを祈るしかない…。
Then were those really pitfalls, meaning that this was the area directly under the dining hall...?

All that they could do was pray that Nanjo could find out where this was...

「……来ます。多分、人数は４人。……お館様、並びに食堂に姿を現したうちの３人かと。」
"...They're coming. There's probably...four people. ...The Master...and three of those who appeared in the dining hall."

「もう充分だ。君も後に下がりたまえ。あとは私たちで応対する。」
"That's enough. You come back here as well. We'll deal with the rest."

「紗音ちゃん、申し訳ないけど、電話のところに座ってもらえる？　スカートで電話を隠して。」
"Shannon-chan, sorry, but can I have you sit by the phone? Hide it with your skirt."

「あ、……はい…！」
"Ah, ...yes...!"

ぞろぞろとした気配が近付き、……廊下の向こうで重い扉が開けられる音がする。
The shuffling came close, ...and there was the sound of a large door being opened in the hallway.

そして彼らが持つらしい光源が、薄暗い廊下を照らし出し、カミソリのように鋭い影で壁を撫で回した。
The light they were apparently carrying illuminated the hall, stroking the walls with sharp, razor-like shadows.

そして、彼らの持つランタンの灯りが、鉄格子越しに蔵臼たちを照らし出す。
……鉄格子の鋭い影が彼らを縦に微塵切りにする。
And then, the light from the lantern they held illuminated the prisoners through the bars.

人影は４人。

"......Hahhahahahahahahahahaha. What more is a warehouse than a place to keep things in? However, I give birth to gold and use my craftsmanship to further increase its worth. Don't you think `smith' is much more fitting?"

「…………確かに。無駄口を失礼しました。」

さすがにその牢の中に入った経験はないだろうが、この廊下を歩いた記憶はあるはずだ。」
True, you may have never entered the prison, but you should remember walking through this corridor."

...Firstly, we fell through a pitfall and were locked up in here after only a few minutes... ...Not only is the distance too great, that's physically impossible..."

......This is that place. No, to be correct, this is its basement. *cackle*cackle*...!"

I guess Father's tastes are a bit more than I can stomach."

"*giggle* But I agree. ...If a mansion I was given had this kind of dungeon in it, that'd shake me out of even a century-long love, and I'd take anything of value and run."

And here I was thinking you went head over heels for it."

ワルギリアはすぐに謝罪するが、ガァプはロノウェと一緒にそれをくすくす笑う。

まるで、自分だけは捕らわれない、あるいは、捕らえられようとも無意味であるとでも言わんばかりだった……。

"A prison is a place from which the captured cannot escape. That implies a strong will and love to not let them go for a lifetime. It's not even worth speaking of love to a woman you could give up on if she ran away."

鎖で縛ってでも逃したくないと思うほどに狂おしくなる女。そこまでに至ってこそ、我が生涯を捧げるに値する愛である。………お前にそれをわかれとは言わぬよ。」
"A woman who makes you so insane that you don't want to let her escape, to the point of binding her in chains... Because she was worthy of that, she was a love worth sacrificing my life for. ......I will not ask you to understand."

I feel the same as Goldsmith. That's why I understand the madness of your love."

「すでに宣告したとおり、お前たちは後の晩のための生贄である。都合よく人数も５人。抉りて殺す５人の人質にぴったりであろう。」
"As I have already declared, you will become sacrifices for the later twilights. There are conveniently five people here. Exactly enough hostages for the five gougings."

「……なるほど。…私たちも、年貢の納め時というわけですか。」
"...I see. ...Then it's time for us to pay the piper?"

「やがてはな。だが今はそのために訪れたのではない、安心せよ。
"Eventually. That's not why I've come to visit you this time, so relax.

それに、言ったはずだ。……もしも孫たちの誰かが、我が全てを継承するに相応しいと認められたなら、この儀式は中断する。つまり、お前たちは命拾いをするというわけだ。」
Besides, I believe I have said it already. ...If one of my grandchildren is deemed suitable to inherent everything from me, then the ceremony will be called off. In other words, your lives will be spared."

「……お、お子さんたちに、何をするつもりですか。」
"...Wh-What are you planning to do to the children?"

「次期当主に相応しいかどうか。テストを与える。その結果、私を唸らせる者が一人でもいたならば、儀式は中断する。」
"I shall give them a test. A test to see if they are suitable to be the Successor or not. If even one of them can surprise me, I'll call the ceremony off."

「………相応しい者がいなかったら、
……子どもたちはどうするつもりですか。」
"......And if there isn't anyone suitable,

...what are you planning on doing with the children?"
