今度の電話は紗音からだった。
This time, it was Shannon on the phone.

そしてその電話は、次の順番である譲治に、向かうべき場所を伝えるものだった……。
And this time, the message was to tell the next person, George, where he was to go...

朱志香は生まれてからずっと、……当たり前だが、この屋敷で育ってきた。
Of course, since the time of her birth, ...Jessica had been raised in this mansion.

いとこたちがお屋敷と呼んで萎縮するその洋館が、自分の家だった。
The atrophied, Western-style house that the cousins called a mansion was her home.

なのに、今日ほどそのいとこたちの気持ちがわかったことはない。
And yet, she had never understood her cousins' feelings as much as she did today.

……そして同時に、自分がよく見知った自宅が、これほど別の場所に感じたことはなかった……。
...At the same time, she had never felt her own home, which she knew well, to be as alien as it seemed now...

自分の、………部屋。
Her own......room.

そこはかつて、この広大な屋敷で唯一心を許せる、自分だけの隠れ家だった。
This had once been her hideaway, the only place in this vast mansion where she could feel at peace.

しかし、……今ほど、その扉に威圧感を感じることはない。
However, ...she had never felt as much pressure coming from that door as she did now.

「………テストだって…？　ちぇ、一体、何が待ち受けてやがるんだ……。まさか、私の机とか、引っ掻き回してねぇだろうな……。」
"......A test, you say...? Tch, what the hell could be waiting in there... I'm not gonna find my desk and stuff dragged around all over the place, right...?"

自らを騙すために、悪態をつく。
……自分は何も恐れていないのだと、信じさせるために。
She acted tough, trying to deceive herself.

...Trying make herself believe that she wasn't scared of anything.

覚悟を決め、自分の部屋の扉を開く。
Readying herself, she opened the door to her room.

「………………………………。」
"............"

……幸いなことに、部屋が荒らされてるようには見えず、ほっとする。
...When she saw that, fortunately, the room didn't appear to be messed up, she relaxed.

誰も、……いない。……もちろんだ。
人が隠れられる場所など、あるわけもない。
No one...was there. ...Of course.

There was nowhere for anyone to hide here.

朱志香は咄嗟に、後手で施錠してしまう。
……これで、この部屋は安全だ。
Right away, Jessica locked the door behind her.

...This way, the room was safe.

ベッドの下もクローゼットも覗くが、もちろん誰も隠れていない。
She peeked under the bed and in the closet, but of course, no one was hiding.

「……な、……何だってんだ。……はは、…はは…！」
"...Wh-What the hell. ...Haha, ...haha...!"

時計を見る。……２３時１０分、ちょっと過ぎ。
She looked at the clock. ...It was just past 23:10.

緊張が抜けて、全身に疲労感が蘇ると共に、今日一日がどれほど狂っているかを知った。
As her tension lessened and fatigue came back to her entire body, she realized how messed up this whole day had been.

まだ、２３時なのだ。
It was still about 23:00.

……いとこのみんなが集まって、楽しく遊んで、夜はみんなで色々な話に花を咲かせるつもりだった。
...The plan had been for all the cousins to gather, have fun playing around, and talk animatedly about various things together into the night.

本当だったなら、今頃まさにそうしていただろう。
それが、……どうしてこんなことに……？
Normally, we would've been doing that kind of thing right now.

Why...has that turned into this...?

「………全部、あのクソジジイのせいだ……。……よくも、母さんを……。みんなを………。」
"......It's all that damn geezer's fault... ...How could he do that...to Mom...to everyone......"

怒りと悲しみで、頭がぐるぐる回る……。
しかし、その矛先を向けるべき相手は、ここにはいないのだ。
She shook her head back and forth with anger and sadness...

But there was no one here to direct those emotions at.

……施錠によって、この部屋の安全は確保された。
それをもう一度思い出すことにより、朱志香は何とか冷静を取り戻す……。
...Because of the lock, this room's security was guaranteed.

Remembering that one more time, Jessica somehow regained her calm...

もし、このまま何も起こらないなら。
食堂に行き、母の死に顔を見たいと思った。
If it keeps up like this and nothing happens...

...I want to go to the dining hall and see Mom's dead face.

……郷田から絶対に見るべきではない惨いものだと、あれほど念を押されていても、それでもなお、最後に母の顔が見たかった…。
...Even though Gohda emphasized so strongly that it was gruesome and that I definitely shouldn't go to look at it, even so, I wanted to see her face at the end...

だが、余計なことをすれば人質に危害が及ぶと重ねて警告されている。
But we were warned repeatedly that stepping out of line even a little would put the hostages in danger.

……ひょっとして、鍵を掛けるのもルール違反に入るだろうか……？

選べるだろ？選べるものなぁあああぁ？ほおおら選べるって言ってみろよおおぉおおおおッ？！？！」

The Chiester Sisters, with their respective old wounds of the heart gouged out, escaped by disappearing.

後には、誰も聞く者はないのに金蔵がひとり、演劇を続けるかのように話を続ける…。
After that, even though there was no one to hear, Kinzo continued talking by himself as though in a play...

「……と、このように愉快なテストなわけだ。実のところを言えば、これが正解という選択肢はない。
"...Indeed, that is the nature of this charming test. In truth, no choice can be said to be correct.

むしろ、どの答えであろうとも、
澱みなく、
素早くッ、
そして確固たる信念と揺るがぬ強き自らの意志で選べるかどうかッ！！

without hesitation,

quickly,

その理由と意思の方が重要なのだ。………私はそれを知りたいのだよ。

"......Hmmmm? Me? *cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*! Yes, of course I once had the same question thrust upon me. Because I splendidly answered that devil's question, I was able to obtain gold and honor, and that witch as my possession. Which answer did I chooooooooooose? ......Do you really need me to say it out loud? Wahhahhahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha...!!!"

"Well then, have you nearly decided on your answer...?"

「……………………………。」

部屋を満たすのは、風雨の音と梢の擦れるざわめきだけ。
それはどれだけ賑やかであっても、むしろ静寂を引き立てるのだった。
All that filled the room was the stir from wind and rain shaking the treetops.

...No, ...he might actually have known.

隣の鏡には、同様に譲治の光景も映し出されている。

山羊の従者たちは、互いに顔を向き合わせ、ウンウンと頷いた。

Virgilia took the Chiester Sisters and left.

階段を上がる音が聞こえたから、上の階へ行ったのだろう。
The sound of them going up stairs could be heard, so they had probably gone to an upper floor.

霧江はチャンスの到来を悟るが、それでも鉄格子を破る方法は思いつかなかった……。
Kyrie realized that an opportunity had arrived, but even so, she hadn't thought of a way to break the metal bars...

三面鏡に映る朱志香は、観念するかのように、目を閉じる。
The Jessica reflected on the three-sided mirror had her eyes closed, as though in contemplation.

"Damn iiiiiiiiiiittt!! Aah!! Gah!!"




蔵臼は娘が殺されることを察し、半狂乱になりながら鉄格子に体当たりを繰り返す。
Realizing that his daughter was about to be killed, Krauss went half-mad and repeatedly body-slammed the metal bars.

山羊たちは、ニンゲン風情に鉄格子が破れるはずがないと嘲笑っているように見えた。
The goats looked like they were sneering at how a mere Human didn't stand a chance at breaking those bars.

確かに、蔵臼のその無駄な努力は滑稽だっただろう。
Krauss's pointless efforts certainly may have been comical.

朱志香の父として、彼女を救うために、思い切り、今を生きていた。

He was now living with all he had as Jessica's father, so that he could save her.

自分の呪われた力を使えば、鉄格子を切り裂くことも出来るかもしれない。
If he used his cursed power, he might be able to cut through even metal bars.

It would instantly be reported, and then even Virgilia and the Chiester Sisters would probably dash in.

鉄格子を破ることは出来ても、……そこまでなのだ。……無駄なのだ。
Even if he could break the bars, ...that would be the end of it. ...It was useless.

……そういう無駄な努力を、あの魔女は嘲笑っているのをもう知っているから、……嘉音は蔵臼の繰り返す体当たりを、ただじっと見ているしか出来ない…。
...Kanon already knew that the witch sneered at useless efforts like that, ...so he could do nothing but stare at Krauss's repeated body-slams...

「……あ、…………譲治さま……。」
"...Ah, ......George-sama..."

三面鏡を見ていた紗音が声をあげる。
Shannon, who had been looking at the three-sided mirror, raised her voice.

...No matter which choice that was, it was Jessica's answer. It doesn't influence my answer in any way."

...My answer is...



三番さ。」
the third option."

"...The person I love, my family and my relatives, everyone, everyone!! I'll protect them. If I'm the Head, then that's my duty!

お父さんは威張ってるだけじゃない。私や母さんを守ってた！！　……右代宮家を受け継ぐ重圧ってヤツと、……何十年も戦ってたッ！！

その背中が物語ってきた何かを、朱志香は理解している！
Jessica understood something that his back had been telling her!

顔の血は拭われ、……代わって、何百年ぶりに感じたかも思い出せない歓喜に、にやりと笑う表情が現れる。
The blood on his face was wiped off, ...and in its place...was a grin filled with a delight he hadn't felt in so many centuries that he couldn't remember.

譲治の足元に突然、漆黒の落とし穴が大口を開ける。もちろん譲治に抗えるわけもない。
Suddenly, beneath George's feet, a pitch-black pitfall opened its mouth wide. Of course, George had no way of resisting.

それに飲み込まれた譲治は、東屋の天井に開いた漆黒の穴から落ちてくる。
After being swallowed up by that, George fell out of a pitch-black hole that had opened up in the ceiling of the arbor.

その落下してくる譲治の下腹部に、狙い澄まされた蜂の一撃のような鋭いピンヒールによる後回し蹴りが打ち込まれる…！
As George fell down, he was hit by a reverse roundhouse kick from a sharp stiletto heel, like a strike from a carefully aimed bee...!

東屋から吹き飛ばされた譲治は、薔薇の茂みに飲み込まれるかと思った瞬間。
The instant George, after being blown out of the arbor, thought that he'd be swallowed up by a rose bush...

そこに再び漆黒の穴が開き譲治を飲み込む。
Another pitch-black hole opened there and swallowed George up.

すると今度はガァプの目の前の足元に漆黒の穴が開き、そこから無防備な譲治を吐き出す。
And this time, a pitch-black hole opened at Gaap's feet before her eyes, spitting a defenseless George out of it.

……その時にはガァプはすでに次の後回し蹴りの予備動作を終えている。
...At that time, Gaap had already finished the preparatory motions for the next reverse roundhouse kick.

"Ghh, ...what is...this...?"

「お帰りなさい。くす！」
"Welcome back. *giggle*!"

右側頭部。右脇の下。右膝側面。
Right side of the head. Below the right armpit. Side of the right knee.

まるで小さな竜巻のようにガァプはくるくると舞い踊りながら、右足左足右足左足で連続回し蹴りを次々に叩き込む。
As Gaap danced and spun like a small cyclone, she kept hitting him, left foot right foot left foot right foot, with successive roundhouse kicks.

四連撃目は足払いとなって譲治の足を刈り取り転倒させるが、もちろんそこに床はなく、漆黒の穴が開いていて、またしても譲治を飲み込んでしまう。
The fourth one became a sweep, cutting George's feet out from under him and making him fall down, but of course, there was no floor there, but a pitch-black hole, and George was swallowed up once again.

ガァプは再び小さい竜巻のように舞い踊る。
譲治もまた、再び東屋の天井より吐き出された。
Gaap once again spun around like a small cyclone.

George was once again spat out from the ceiling of the arbor.

「………食らって噛み締めなさい、奈落の終点が一撃。……死ね……！！」
"......Take this and reflect. The Abyss ends with a single strike. ...Die...!"

鋭き女王蜂の一撃は、昇る竜巻のように、天を刺す。
The sharp strike of the queen bee pierced the heavens like a rising cyclone.

それは天井より落下する譲治の腹部を蹴り抜いた……。
It kicked through George's lower chest as he fell from the ceiling...

そのまま、……時間が凍る。
And then, ...time froze.

譲治はガァプの蹴り上げた足一本で、宙に打ち止められていた……。
George was pinned in midair by Gaap's raised leg...

「が、………ふッ………。」
"Gah, ......mmph......"

譲治は宙に縫い止められたまま、呻く……。
Still pinned in midair, George moaned...

そしてガァプは、譲治を足一本で吊り上げたまま、……にやりと笑う。
Then Gaap, with George still hung up on her foot, ...grinned.

「………認めてあげるわ。君の態度だけは一人前よ。でも、力が伴わなきゃ駄目だわ。
"......I'll admit it. At least your attitude is that of an adult. But that's no good unless you have power to go with it.

……知ってる？　この世を統べるには３つの力が必要だそうよ。ひとつは権力。ひとつは財力。最後は何か知ってる？」
...Did you know? They say you need three kinds of power to rule this world. The first one is influence. The second is wealth. Do you know what the last one is?"

「本で読んだよ。……暴力、だろ……？」
"I read it in a book. ...Force, right...?"

「正解。君にはそれが足りないわ。」
"Correct. And that's where you're lacking."

ガァプはようやく譲治を解放する。
Gaap finally released George.

She kicked upwards one more time, changing into another roundhouse kick and knocking him into a pillar.

金蔵はその３つを兼ね備えたわ。だからこそ暴君として君臨した！　……君も金蔵の後継者を名乗るならば、その貫禄を見せて御覧なさい？
Kinzo possessed all three of those. That's why he reigned as a tyrant! ...If you're going to call yourself Kinzo's successor, try showing me a bit of that majesty, okay?"

……ほぉら、いつまで寝ているの？　立ちなさい？
"...Come ooon, how long are you gonna sleep there? Stand up, okay?

じゃないとまた、~ib~落ちるわよ~ib~？」
If you don't, you'll ~ib~fall~ib~ again, see?"

「ぃ野郎ぉおおおおおぉ！！　ひょろひょろと、ちょこまかと！！　反撃して来ねぇのかよ……、舐めてんのかッ、うぜぇヤツッ！！」
"Bastaaaaaaaaaaaaaard!! Swaying around all over the place!! Aren't you gonna strike back...? Don't take me lightly, you fuckin' bastard!!"

ロノウェは、巧みに身をかわし、飛び退り、朱志香の鉄拳をかわしているが、自らはまだ反撃していない。
Ronove dodged skillfully, jumped back, and avoided Jessica's fist, but he still didn't strike back himself.

まるで、強風になびく旗のような素早い身のこなしに、朱志香の拳は触れることさえ叶わないのだ。
Because of his dodge that was as rapid as a fluttering flag blown by strong winds, Jessica's fist wasn't even able to touch him.

朱志香は血の燃えたぎるような感覚の中に、攻撃的冷静さを取り戻す。
Amidst the sensation that her own blood was boiling, Jessica regained her offensive composure.

個室としては広いこの部屋も、いつまでもそんな大袈裟にかわし続けるには狭い。
……それを冷静に理解し、拳だけでなく、足を使い始める。
Even though this room was large for a bedroom, it was a very cramped place to keep up such exaggerated dodges in for long.

...She calmly realized that and started using not just her fists, but her legs as well.

「……ほう。……ボクシングは腕でやるだけの内は半人前です。腕は熱く吼え猛る獅子のように。そして足は冷たく獲物を狙って追い詰める蛇のように。」
"...Hoh. Boxing with just your arms makes you but half a fighter. Your arms must be like the hot roar of a lion. And your legs must be like the cold snake closing in on its prey."

「蛇に足はねーぜ！」
"Snakes don't have legs!"

「ぷっくっく、確かに。」
"Pu ku ku, true."

朱志香はロノウェを正確なフットワークで壁際に追い詰めていく。回り込ませない。
Jessica began cornering Ronove towards the wall with perfect footwork. She didn't let him get around her.

……ロノウェの華麗な回避は、見た目には派手だが、充分な足場がいる。
追い詰めればもうかわせはしない…！
...Ronove's magnificent dodges looked flashy, but they needed a large footing.

Once cornered, he wouldn't be able to dodge anymore...!

朱志香は自分の装備するメリケンサックという武器の特性をよく理解していた。
Jessica knew the characteristics of her weapon, the brass knuckle, very well.

その強力な武器の特筆すべき特長は、相手に防御さえ許さない点だ。
This powerful weapon's most notable characteristic was how it didn't give the opponent a chance to defend.

腕で防ごうとも、その腕に直にダメージを与える。
……下手な受け方をすれば骨だって折れるだろう。
Even if they blocked with their arm, that arm would receive direct damage.

...If it hit the wrong way, it might even break the bone.

だから追い詰める。
So she cornered him.

逃げ場をなくし、……この悪魔を、この拳で、削り取るッ！！
With this fist, ...she'd whittle away at this demon who'd lost any way to escape!!

「おっと…！
"Whoops...!

おや、いつの間に。」
Oh, when did...?"

"Looks like I've finally cornered you, right...? Where is everyone being held? Where's that damn geezer? You tell me everything, and I'll let you off with nothing more than plucking that mustache off, got it?"

「それは困ります。これでもセットに毎朝、１時間を掛けているのですから。」

Cry and apologize."

朱志香の左右の鉄拳がロノウェに打ち込まれる。
Jessica's fists were buried into Ronove.

しかし、そうとは思えぬ手応えとガラスを割るような音に朱志香はぎょっとする。
But there was a resistance that seemed too hard...and the sound of breaking glass, which startled Jessica.

朱志香の拳を、ロノウェは一見、手の平で受け止めたように見えた。……少し違う。
At a glance, it looked like Ronove had caught Jessica's fist with his palm. ...That wasn't quite true.

ロノウェが手の平を開くと、そこに紫色に薄く光る、ガラスの楯のような障壁が現れ、紙一重のところで攻撃を止めてしまうのだ。
When Ronove opened his hand, a faint, purple, glowing barrier like a glass shield appeared, stopping the attack by a hair's breadth.

気を取り直し、朱志香は再び左右の鉄拳を繰り出すが、ロノウェは実に華麗な仕草で、それを全て、受け止めてしまう……。
Pulling herself together, Jessica let her fists fly again, but with a truly magnificent gesture, Ronove caught all of them...

「悪魔ですので。この程度の魔法くらいは。

......Even so, you aren't bad at all. If I were a Human, I would probably resign right here. Because I am a demon, I can still continue to fight."

...Are you simply going to attack all the time, while neglecting your defense?"

...Waaah!!"

Ronove's palm shot to within a hair's breadth of Jessica's stomach.

Jessica was knocked away by the purple shield, rolled backwards, and smashed her head on the bed.

...Perhaps I'll be your opponent for just a while longer. This is also part of an examiner's role. ......Pukkukukukukuku!"

譲治は薔薇庭園の園路で、水溜りに突っ伏していた。
Gaap looked down on George, sneering.

George was on a path in the rose garden, lying face-down in a puddle.

容赦なく雨は打ちつけ、天すらも嘲笑っているように見える…。
The merciless rain beat down on him, so that it looked as though even the heavens were mocking him...

……精神は挫けていないようだが、肉体のダメージはかなりのもののようだった。
...It seemed his spirit hadn't given in, but the damage done to his body was fairly significant.

そしたら、君を地下牢へ案内してあげる。そこで君は、愛する紗音と非力な自分のために、他の人質たちを一人ずつ殺していくの。
"Then, I'll guide you down to the dungeon. There, for your beloved Shannon and your own powerless life, you will kill the other hostages one by one.

譲治は返事をしない。

その声が譲治に届くはずもない。

"Hey, could you tell me something? Why are you willing to go so far for that furniture called Shannon?

If you're trying to measure my love towards Shannon by my strength alone,

なら、呆気なく殺されたあんたのお父さんとお母さんからは何をもらったの？　………？」

It had stopped right in front of the tip of Gaap's nose.

"The thing I got from Mom was this kick."

ガァプは数瞬遅れて飛び退く。
もちろん遅過ぎる。
Several moments after, Gaap jumped back.

Of course, that was too late.

譲治が止めなければ、宣言したとおりのダメージが与えられただろう。
If George hadn't stopped, he would probably have caused the damage he'd announced.

低い沸点の怒りは真に恐れるべきものではない。

Anger with a low boiling point isn't something to be truly feared.

譲治の足元に漆黒の落とし穴が口を開く。
A pitch-black hole opened its mouth at George's feet.

しかし、譲治は素早く足を開き、その穴を跨ぐように立つ。同じ手は、通用しない…！
上半身は微動だにしない、あまりに軽やかな身のこなしだった。
But George rapidly opened his legs, straddling the hole. The same move won't work again...!

It was an extremely smooth dodge, and the upper part of his body didn't even quiver.

「忍耐とは、熱くならず、冷静に相手の出方を研究することだ。………何のために？　決まってるじゃないか。わかるかい？」

"It's to counter, to give back exactly what you got, to make them not want to take another pass at you, to make them cover their face in tears and snot and forget to wash it off, to make them want to rub their forehead on the ground and apologize over and over, to completely, perfectly, and thoroughly...!!!

……叩きのめすためだよ。」
...Beat them until they can't get up."

譲治が駆ける。
George dashed.

次々に漆黒の穴が開くが、譲治は二度とそれを踏みはしない。
Pitfalls opened one after another, but George didn't step in them again.

そして、それに固執したから、ガァプは二度捉えられる…。

そしてもちろん、ガァプの顔面を完全に捉えつつも寸止めだった。
It was stretched out more forcefully and beautifully than Gaap's had been.

Of course, while it centered directly on Gaap's face, it stopped a hair's breadth away.

この至近では落とし穴にも頼れないのだろうか。
Perhaps she couldn't rely on pitfalls at this close range.

ガァプは譲治の脛を牽制のように蹴り、譲治がそれに対応しようとした一瞬の隙を突いて、その腹部に蹴りを狙う。
Gaap kicked at George's shins as a diversion, and in the instant of weakness when he tried to deal with that, she aimed a kick at his stomach.

それはピンヒールによる蜂の如き一撃。
It was a bee-like stab by her stiletto heel.

……しかしそこにはもう譲治がいなくて空を切る。

後ろへ飛んで飛んで跳ねて後方宙返りまでして距離を離す。
She jumped and jumped and leapt and even flipped in midair, increasing that distance.

華麗なはずなのに、なぜかそれは怯えている小動物のそれによく似ていた。
It should have been magnificent, but for some reason, it was very similar to the movements of a small, scared animal.

距離を開けば、得意の落とし穴と蹴り技を混ぜての、自分の得意な間合いで戦える…！

The goats' massive bodies were buried in rose bushes.

Even taking into account that a leg's power is three times that of an arm's, this strength surpassed common sense.

あの巨体が顎を蹴り上げられて、宙を舞うなんて、壮絶過ぎる！
譲治も少しは驚いているようだった。
To think that those massive bodies had been kicked in the chin and flown through the air... It was too fierce!

Even George seemed a little surprised.

「……僕の蹴りがバケモノにも通用したとはね。驚きだよ。」
"...To think that my kick works on monsters too. Now there's a shock."

「……………あんたの反撃特化結界のせいよ。……グレイズした攻撃力をそのまま自らに上乗せしてる。……あんたの蹴りには、そのバケモノどもの怪力が加算されてるのよ…。」
"......It's because of your counterattack-style barrier. ...The attacking power that grazes you is added on to your own. ...Your kick has been supplemented by those monsters' superhuman strength..."

「へぇ……。…よくわからないけど、僕にぴったりじゃないか。
"Oh...? ...I don't really get it, but isn't that just perfect for me?

……誰であろうとも、攻撃してくるなら、等しい反撃を覚悟してもらう。専守防衛。僕のポリシーそのものだ。」
...No matter who attacks me, they should be prepared for a counterattack of equal measure. Nonaggressive defense. That's my policy."

だからガァプは容易に手出しが出来ない。
That's why Gaap couldn't easily touch him.

反撃特化結界に防御力はない。
しかし、その反撃的特性のため、攻撃を躊躇させることで防御能力を発揮する。
The counterattack-style barrier had no defensive power.

However, because of its countering ability, it could be useful in defense by making the opponent hesitate to attack.

山羊たちは愚かだから気にせずに攻撃してしまうが、ガァプにその効果は充分発揮されていた。
The goats had been foolish and so had attacked without worrying, but this second effect had worked in full against Gaap.

「こいつらは単調だね。パワーが互角であるならば、小柄な方が有利だ。」
"These guys really are dull. When your power's even, it's always an advantage to have a smaller build."

丸太のような豪腕を軽々とかわす。
He lightly dodged the log-like arms.

その豪腕が譲治を守る結界に触れると強く赤く光る。
When those arms touched the barrier that protected George, they let off a strong, red light.

……そして反撃の足刀の先端が同じ輝きを宿し、山羊自身の怪力が上乗せされる。
...The tip of the counterattacking foot would then gain the same sparkle...and the superhuman power of the goat added to its own.

２匹目の山羊が前のめりになってわずかに宙に浮く。
さらに続いて繰り出された譲治の回し蹴りは、つんのめった山羊の頭上を空振りした。
The second goat fell forward and floated in the air for a second.

Then, George's next roundhouse kick missed right over the falling goat's head.

……一瞬、命拾いしたと山羊は期待する。
...For an instant, the goat hoped it might get away with its life.

でも、ダメ！！　そのまま後頭部に踵が落とされ、地面にキスを強要される。
But no!! A heel was dropped onto the back of its head, and it was forced to kiss the ground.

「……上段回し蹴りからのネリチャギは基本だろ？　たまにやると結構当たるよ。」
"...Going from a high roundhouse kick into a neri chagi is pretty basic, right? Works pretty well every now and then."

"This guy's...a problem,

...seriously, a problem...!!"

それを、体で教えてやるよ。」
I'll make you physically aware of that."

"......Yoooooooooooouuuuuu......!!"

The only way to finish off George, now that his body was wrapped up in a counterattack-style barrier, ...was to deny him a chance to counterattack.

彼女にはその光景をありありと想像できた。
She was able to envision that scene vividly.

ガァプはとんでもない島に呼び出されてしまったものだと、金蔵を今さら恨む…！
Gaap hated Kinzo more than ever for calling her out to this ridiculous island...!

より強力なシールドでないと、もう朱志香の鉄拳を防ぎ切れないのだ。
Even though Ronove held out a shield, he had finally started using his hands.

Without a more powerful shield, he wouldn't be able to block Jessica's fists anymore.

朱志香の鉄拳へのエンチャントは、戦えば戦うほどに付与されていく。

浸透付与はすでに幾重ともなり、他にも衝撃付与、貫通付与、速度付与が与えられ、悪魔と互角に戦うに相応しい拳となっている…。
The permeating upgrade had already grown several times, and those fists had also been given an impact upgrade, a piercing upgrade, and a speed upgrade, making them fists worthy to fight on par with a demon...

Ronove's face turned into an expression he hadn't shown before.

It was full of respect for Jessica in a truly demonic way.

彼を本気にさせるほどの敵にだけ与えられる表情なのだから。

With a gesture of his whole body that you couldn't call elegant, Ronove held out a shield with all his strength, a shield the size and thickness of a wall.

その頑強さは楯ではない。
文字通り壁そのもの。

しかもそれはロノウェの渾身の魔力で、わずかずつ朱志香を押し戻していく。

朱志香は左右の鉄拳で壁を打ち破ろうとするが、硬い。……掛け値なく、硬い！

それはすぐに朱志香にも身をもって理解できた。

衝動で戦人は受話器を叩きつけてしまう。

I took the spear I'd made from the hat stand...and went outside without even an umbrella.

今の俺にはわずかでも味方が必要だ。

郷田さんは体格もいいし、戦力として期待できる。熊沢さんは古参の使用人としての知識や土地勘が大きな武器になるだろう。
Gohda-san is big, so I can probably count on him for some firepower. Kumasawa's knowledge and familiarity with the terrain as a senior servant might become a huge weapon.

二人ともマスターキーを持っているし、屋敷についても自分より詳しい。……かなり頼もしい味方だった。
Both of them have master keys, and they know more about the mansion than I do. They'll be pretty reliable allies.

シャッターを叩きながら開けてくれと呼び掛け、中の彼らにはどうしようもないのだということを思い出す。
As I banged on the shutter and called out for them to open it, I remembered that there was nothing they could do from the inside.

彼らに鍵を返してもらい、開けてやらねばならない。

「……郷田…、
さ…ん……。……熊沢……さ、
………ん………、」
"...Gohda...

sa...n... ...Kumasawa...sa...

n..."




　天井の低い梁に、
………太いロープが２本吊るされ、
……それぞれに、
……郷田さんと熊沢さんが、
From a low ceiling beam...

...hung two thick ropes,

...and at the ends,

...Gohda-san and Kumasawa-san...

…………首を、…吊るされているのだ……。
...were hanging...by their necks...




薄暗いし、色々と荷物がごちゃごちゃ置かれている狭間からなので、その様子はそれ以上詳しくはわからない。
It was dim and cramped because of the various pieces of equipment strewn about, so I couldn't make out the situation clearly.

……しかし、声を掛けてもぴくりとも反応せず、完全に首のロープに全ての体重を預けきっている様子から、生きている気配を感じ取ることは出来なかった……。
...But when they showed not even a tremor after I called out to them, and because of the way the loops around their necks seemed to carry the full weight of their bodies, I could sense no trace of life from them...

「そんな……、………嘘……だろ…………。……どうして………。」
"You've gotta be......kidding me, ...right......? ...Why......?"

シャッターは閉まったままなのだ。
The shutter was still closed.

……そして鍵はひとつしかなく、郷田さんが預かったはず。
...And there was only a single key, which had supposedly been given to Gohda-san.

なのにどうやって犯人は、……シャッターを開けて、中の二人を殺したんだよ……？
So how had the culprit...opened the shutter and killed both of them inside...?

いいや、殺されたとは限らない…。
これは自殺なんだとしたら……。
No, wait, they weren't necessarily killed...

If this is a suicide...

……密室のつじつまは合うけど、二人が首を吊って自殺する意味がわからない…！！
...That way, this closed room makes sense, but I don't know why they would hang themselves and commit suicide...!!

俺は力なく、…その場にへたり込む。
Feebly, ...I slumped down on the spot.

　これで、この島に生きてる人間は、
……俺と真里亞と、
……クソジジイだけ。
Now, the only humans alive on this island...

...are me, Maria,

...and that damn geezer.




………じゃないや、あのイカれた、ベアトリーチェとか名乗る女もだ…。
......No, there's also that insane woman calling herself Beatrice...

真里亞は初めから魔女の味方のような素振り。
そしてジジイは魔女を蘇らせた張本人。
そして、魔女本人。
There's Maria, who had acted like the witch's ally from the beginning.

And that geezer, the ringleader who revived the witch.

And...the witch herself.

……何だよ、………もう、この島には、…………俺ひとりしかいないも、……同然じゃないかよ…………。
...What the hell. ......By now, I might as well be......the only one on this island......

俺は棒切れを杖代わりに、力なく立ち上がる。
Using my pole as a cane, I feebly rose.

……クソ、こんなのじゃ駄目だ…。
みんなの仇を、俺が取らないと……。
...Damn, I can't do it like this...

I've got to avenge...everyone...

「畜生ぉおおぉぉ……、こんなんじゃ駄目だ…。あぁ、駄目だぜ、全然駄目だ…。畜生おおおおぉぉ………。」
"Damn iiiiiiiit, ...it's useless this way... Aaah, it's useless, it's all useless... Damn iiiiiiiiiiiiitt......"

今の内に、泣いておく…。
弱々しい気持ちを全て涙と一緒に、搾り出しておくために…。
Might as well cry while I can...

...So that my frail emotions will be squeezed out with my tears...

それから俺は、……背筋を伸ばし、屋敷のある方角の暗闇を見た。
Then, ...I straightened up and gazed into the darkness in the direction of the mansion.

………屋敷の玄関に、魔女が待ち受ける。
......At the entrance to the mansion, the witch is waiting.

行って、……ケリをつけてやる。
I'll go...and settle this.

このおかしなおかしな、狂った夜の元凶を、……俺の手で、ぶっ潰してやる…！
I'll find the source of this weird, insane night...and crush her with my own hands...!

土砂降りの雨の中、……俺は傘もなく、濡れるに任せて、薔薇庭園を歩く。
Amidst the pouring rain, ...I walked through the rose garden without an umbrella, letting myself get soaked.

……向こうに東屋が見えた。
...I could see the arbor on the other side.

朱志香の話では、譲治の兄貴も殺されたらしい…。
According to Jessica, it seemed that George-aniki had also been killed...

どうせ、今さら人質の命も何もない。
……俺は、道を外れ、東屋を目指す。
Well, by this point, there's no need to worry about the lives of any hostages.

...I left the path, aiming for the arbor.

そして、…………譲治の兄貴の死体が、雨曝しになっているのを見た…。
Then, ......I saw George-aniki's weather-beaten corpse...




「……………兄貴……。…………畜生…………。」
"......Aniki... ......Damn......"

死体は、東屋の前にあった。
The corpse was in front of the arbor.

せめて東屋の中で死ねたなら、雨曝しにだけはならずに済んだろうに…。
If he had died under the arbor, he might have at least been spared being beaten down upon by the rain...

兄貴の額には、まるで銃で撃たれたかのような穴がぽっかりと開いていた。
In Aniki's forehead was a gaping hole, as though he'd been shot with a gun.

雨が全て洗い流してしまったせいか、顔面が血塗れということはなく、……そのせいで、眠っているようにさえ見える。
Perhaps because the rain had washed everything away, his face wasn't covered with blood, ...so he looked almost like he was sleeping.

…しかし、服は真っ赤に染まり、大量の血が流れた痕跡を未だに残していた…。
...However, his clothes were stained a deep red, and there were still signs that a large amount of blood had flowed out...

眠っていたり、あるいは死んでいるフリをしていたなら、どんなに嬉しいことか…。
How happy I'd be if he were sleeping, or else pretending to be dead...

……しかし、雨が吹き付けるにもかかわらず、兄貴の目は見開いたまま。
...But even though the rain sprayed against Aniki's eyes, they remained open.

……そして、……額の穴は、冗談抜きで、
……本物だった…。
...And...the hole in his forehead was no joke,

...but absolutely real...

さっきの園芸倉庫の首吊りは、……ひょっとすると郷田さんたちの悪趣味な冗談かもしれない可能性も、わずかにはあった。
There had been a faint chance that even Gohda-san and Kumasawa-san hanging by their necks in the gardening shed had been them playing a bad joke.

しかし、その甘えた可能性は、完全に否定される。
But that naive possibility had now been completely denied.

そして、この死体を見て、完全に確信する。
And, as I looked at this corpse, I became completely sure.

かつて郷田さんは言っていた。
……敵は、チェスの駒を奪うかのように、命を奪ってくると。
Just as Gohda-san had once said.

...The enemy had come to take lives like pieces on a chessboard.

「………あぁ、……間違いない。……クソジジイと魔女は、
………俺たちの命なんて、本当にその程度にしか思ってないらしい……。」
"......Aaaah, ...there's no mistake. ...It seems that old geezer and the witch...

...really don't view our lives as anything more than that..."

…あの魔女め、電話でこう言いやがったな…。
俺たちのことを、“ゲーム盤の上”で、みたいに……。
...That damn witch said something over the phone...

Something about us being `on the game board'...

「…上等だぜ……。……そうかよ、こいつはゲームのつもりかよ……。なら、…お前らがみんなをゲームみたいに殺したように、
………俺がお前らをゲームのように殺してもいいわけだよな……？
"...Perfect... ...I see, she thinks this is a game... Then, ...if you killed everyone like it was a game,

......it's okay if I kill you all like it's a game, right...?

…………首を洗ってやがれ……。……ベアトリーチェ………。」
......Prepare yourself, ...Beatrice......"

稲光に屋敷の巨大な影が浮かび上がる。
The lightning caused the mansion's vast shadow to rise up.

……いよいよ、屋敷、……だ。
...Finally, ...the mansion.

見えてくるその巨大な姿に、人影はない。
俺の歓迎のために、手下どもがぞろりと待ち受けている、ということはないようだった。
As the massive shape came into view, there was no silhouette of any person.

It seemed that there weren't any underlings waiting for me in a pack, or anything like that.

………霧江さんの話によると、山羊の頭をした従者、という連中が相当大勢いるらしい。
......According to Kyrie-san, there were massive amounts of attendants with goat heads.

そんな大勢が、ぞろぞろと隠れていて俺をうかがっている、というような気配は、とりあえず今のところ、感じられない…。
At least for now, I couldn't sense a large group of them hiding and staring at me...

何だ……？
What's this...?

玄関の屋根の下に、
………何か置かれている。
Beneath the roof of the entrance,

......there's something set down.

「……何だよ、これは。………箱…か？」
"...What is this? ......A...box?"

それは女の子なんかがよく、小物を収めていそうな感じの小箱に見えた。
……あるいは応接室なんかにある、ご大層なシガーケースの類かもしれない。
It looked like the kind of small box that girls often keep trinkets in.

...Or maybe it was the same kind of extravagant cigar case you'd find in a reception room.

何れにせよ、ここにあるべきものには見えない…。
それはあからさまに、……俺に開けろと言われているように見えた。
Either way, it didn't look like something that should be here...

It clearly looked...as though I was being told to open it.

しかし、ハイどうぞと開けるのはなぜか癪に障る。
……しかし、開けないことには話が進みそうもない。
But for some reason, opening something being offered to me was irritating.

...However, it didn't look like we'd get anywhere if I didn't open it.

まさかひょっとして、開けると爆発するような罠でも仕掛けられているのではないか……？
Could it be that it's set up with some trap to make it explode when opened...?

そんなことを考えながら、屋根の下に入ることも忘れ、俺は雨に打たれるまま、その小箱を睨み続けていた。
Thinking things like that, forgetting even to come under the overhang, I continued to glare at the box, still beaten down upon by the rain.

すると、………雷鳴に混じり、何か、……音楽？　…のようなものが聞こえてきた。
Then, ......mixed in with the thunder...was some kind of...music? ...It sounded like that.

……それは、２４時を報せるホールの大時計の音色。
...It was the tone of the big clock in the hall announcing 24:00.

１０月４日という、狂った一日がようやく終わりを告げ、……そして１０月５日という、もっともっと、最高に狂った一日の始まりを告げる音でもある。
It was also a sound announcing that this insane day, October 4, had finally ended, ...and that the much more incredibly insane day of October 5 had begun.

その音が静まり、…………薄気味悪い笑い声が、どこからともなく聞こえてくる……。
That sound quieted, ......and I could hear an eerie laugh coming out of nowhere...

その声が、天より聞こえた気がして、……俺は空を見上げた。
I got the feeling that the voice was coming from the heavens, ...and I looked up at the sky.

……するとそこには、………、見たことのない女が。
...What I saw there......was a woman I'd never seen before.

いいや、見たことがないわけじゃない。
……今日、一度見ている。
No, it's not true that I never saw her before.

...I saw her once today.

そう、屋敷の中での、肖像画で……。
Yes, in the portrait inside the mansion...

服は違うが、……その顔は、あの肖像画の魔女にそっくり……。
The clothes were different, ...but that face was just like the witch of the portrait...

あぁ、白々しいぜ、俺はヤツが誰か、もうわかってる…！！
Aaah, who am I kidding, ...I already know who this person is...!!

「……て、……てめえがベアトリーチェかッ！！！」
"...A-Are you Beatrice?!!!"

「やっほおおぉおい、戦人ぁあああぁあああぁああぁ…！！」
"Yahhoooooooooi, Battleeeeeeeeeeeeer...!!"

２階のバルコニーから、……傘を差しながら身を乗り出し上機嫌に手を振っているのは、……紛れもなく、……肖像画の魔女、…ベアトリーチェ………！！
From the second floor balcony, ...leaning out under an umbrella and waving high-spiritedly, ...was, without a doubt, the witch of the portrait, ...Beatrice......!!

親玉は高みの見物で、俺は山羊の手下どもに嬲り殺しって寸法か…？！
Was the plan for the boss to take a birds-eye view and let the goat underlings torture me to death...?!

俺は槍を構え直し、周囲の物陰や玄関の扉から、どどっと山羊どもが溢れ出して俺を取り囲むのを想像しながら、全方向に身構えた…。
I adjusted my grip on the spear, and, imagining goats creeping out of the nearby shadows and the entrance and surrounding me, I raised my guard in all directions...

「あっははッ、安心しろよ、ここには私とお前以外の誰もいねぇぜ？　山羊の家具どももいなければ、悪魔の執事もお師匠様も、我が親友の悪魔もいない。
"Ahhaha, be at ease, there's no one here but you and me, see? No goat furniture, no demon butlers or Teacher, not even the demon who's my close friend."

そして、我が肉体の組成を手伝う黄金の蝶たちもいなければ、魔法陣もない、召喚者の立会いもないッ！！　……その意味が、そなたにわかるかなぁ？」
"And, there's none of the gold butterflies that compose my flesh, no magic circles, and no summoners as witnesses!! ...Do you know what that means?"

「さっぱりだぜ。寝言言ってろ…。」
"No clue. Quit babbling..."

「そなたとは確かにこの世界でも何度か会えては来たのだ。まるですれ違うかのようにな。……知ってのとおり、このニンゲンどもの世界は、ただ貴様らが存在し、妾を疑うだけで、それは膨大な毒素となる。
"It is true that I have met you several times even in this world. Almost as though we just missed each other. ...As you know, this world of Humans is filled with a toxin just by your existence and your doubting of me."

まるで、そなたというキングに対して守りを固める堅牢な城壁のようよ！　それを私は、何度もゲームを重ね、駒をひとつずつ進め、切り崩し、追い込み、じわじわとそなたの城壁を切り崩して行った。
"Almost like solid ramparts strengthening the guard around you, the king! And through multiple games, I have advanced pieces one by one, split them apart, and cornered them, leveling your ramparts bit by bit."

そしてようやくわずかの隙間を開き、そこから妾はビショップを送り込み、そなたのすぐ近くに近付けるようになった。………しかし知っての通り、ビショップは死角ある駒だ。黒のビショップは、そなたが黒きマスに留まる限り絶大な影響力を発揮するが、そなたがひょいと白きマスに一歩逃れれば、妾はそなたの隣に隣接することは出来ても、接触することは叶わぬのだ。
"Then, a faint crack finally opened, and I sent a bishop in, so that it could approach right up next to you. ......But as you know, bishops are pieces with blind spots. As long as you stay on the black squares, a bishop on black can wield a massive influence, but if you escape just one step to a white square, even if I close in right next to you, I will not be able to touch you."

だから妾は、そなたが白きマスに留まれぬよう、様々な駒を送り込み、そなたの隣の黒きマスを支配する妾の前に弾き出されるようにゲームを進めてきたのだ。
"That is why I have progressed through this game by sending in various pieces to prevent you from staying on a white square, forcing you out in front of me, the one who controls the black squares next to you."

しかァし！！
"Howeeever!!

今やそなたの城壁はぽっかりと穴を空け、妾はビショップではなく、とうとうクイーンを送り込むことが出来たッ！！　クイーンがどういう駒か、知っているか？」
There are now holes opened all over your ramparts, and I was able to send in not a bishop, but a full queen!! Do you know what kind of piece a queen is?"

「飛車＋角だろ。……言いてぇことはこうかよ。
"A rook+bishop. ...Is this what you're trying to say?

…今やお前は、黒い魔女幻想のマスだけでなく、白い人間世界のマスにまで自由に侵食できるようになったと…！」
...That now, you not only control the black squares that are part of the illusion of the witch, but have been able to eat into the white squares of the human world at will...?!"

「その通りッ！！　そなたは妾の眷属である黄金の蝶たちが存在するマスのことを、魔女幻想と呼び、観測者なき非現実と仮定して否定してきたのだろうォ…？　くっくくくく、知っておるぞぉ……！！
"That is correct!! You have been calling the squares with the gold butterflies that are my minions `the Illusion of the Witch', and you have denied them as unobserved unrealities, right...? *cackle*cackle* I know...!!"

だからこそ、妾はこうしてとうとう白きマスへ降臨したッ！！　安心しろよ、黄金の蝶も山羊たちも、悪魔も魔女もあとでいっぱい呼んでやるぜ！　そなたが望むなら妾の黄金郷へ招待してやる！！　そこで何でも願いを叶えてやろうぞ…！！　わっはははははははははは…！！」
"For that very reason, I have openly descended to the white squares like this!! Do not worry, I'll call plenty of gold butterflies and goats, demons and witches later! If you wish, I'll invite you to the Golden Land!! There, any wish can be granted...!! Wahhahahahahahahahahahahahaha...!!"

「……どうやら、この島のチェス盤は、インク壷でもぶっかけちまったみたいだな。」
"...It's starting to look like someone knocked an ink bottle over the chessboard of this island."

「なるほど、それも愉快な表現よ…！　くっくくくく、すぐにそなたもそのインクに染まるぞ。やがては真っ黒に染まり、必ず黒きキングになる…！　そなたは今や、インクの海に溺れる哀れな存在であるなぁ？」
"I see, a pleasant phrasing...! *cackle*cackle* Soon, you will be covered in ink as well. You will finally become covered with pitch black...and will surely become a black king...! You really are pitiful, drowning in a sea of ink right now, aren't you?"

「いいや、違う。島がてめえのインク壷で、全て真っ黒に染まっちまったことは認めるが。……白いマスはまだ、残ってるぜ。」
"No, that's wrong. I'll admit that the island has been stained completely black from your ink bottle, ...but there's still a white square left."

「ほう、どこに…！！」
"Hoh, where...?!!"

「俺の、足の裏にだぜ。………お前の魔法のインクが島中を覆い尽くそうと、俺が踏みしめる足の裏までは覆えない。…一見、この島が真っ黒に染まろうと、俺は俺だ。白いマスを、こうして踏みしめて立っている！！」
"Right under my feet. ......Your ink of magic tried to cover the entire island, but it can't cover the ground my feet are standing on. ...Even if this island seems to be stained pitch-black at a glance, I am me. I'm here, stepping on a white square!!"

不思議なもんだ…。
さっきまではびくびくしていた。
It's strange...

Until a second ago, I was shivering all over.

……だが、こうして目の前に堂々と現れてくれたお陰で、むしろ恐怖が薄れた。
...But now that she's appeared openly right before my eyes like this, my terror has actually lessened.

面白いもんだ。幽霊ってヤツは、気配しかない内の方が恐ろしい。
Interesting. Ghosts are most terrifying when you can only sense them.

姿が見えて、ぶん殴れる横っ面があるってんなら、何も怖くはねぇ…！！
When you can see them, and they have a face you can plant your fist into, there's nothing scary about it...!!

……しかし、あいつは決して、面白いヤツでもフレンドリーなヤツでもない。
...However, she definitely isn't an interesting or a friendly person.

……きゃっきゃと笑い転げながら、指をひとつ鳴らすだけで、俺をすぐに殺してしまえるのだ。
...She can kill me instantly by snapping her fingers while rolling around giggling.

指を鳴らすと、魔法が飛んでくるのか、部下が現れて俺を撃ち殺すのか、どちらの解釈でも関係ない。
Whether we interpret the result of her snapping her fingers as magic flying at me or underlings showing up to shoot me, it doesn't matter.

……とにかく、ファンタジーであろうとミステリーであろうと、俺を指一つ鳴らせば殺せるポジションに、あのクイーンはいる……！
...Anyway, whether this is fantasy or mystery, that queen is in a position where she can kill me by just snapping her fingers...!

　…なるほどな、……それこそが、
………白と黒の二つのマスに君臨したる、
…この島の女王という意味なのか……？！
...I see. ...So does this mean...

...she's the queen of this island,

...who reigns over both the white and black squares...?!




「さぁて。この雨の中、そなたが風邪を引くまで待つのも面白いが、そろそろ本題に入ろう。………そこに箱があるのがわかろう？　そなたへのテストはその中に入っている。」
"Well then, it might be amusing to wait until you catch a cold in all that rain, but it's about time to move to the matter at hand. ......Can you see the box down there? Your test is inside it."

「待ちな。……俺はもう今さら次期当主が誰かなんて下らねえゲームには興味ねえぜ。
"Wait. ...After all that's happened, I'm not interested in some stupid game about who'll become the Successor."

俺のゲームは、クソジジイとお前と、……みんなを殺したヤツら全員にそれぞれジャイアンパンチをブチ込むことだ。顔面が陥没するアレな。」
"My game is to take you and that damn geezer...and all of you guys who killed everyone...and smack 'em with a Gian punch. One of those face-crushers."

「ほう。妾のこのバルコニーまで、空を飛び上がってくるというのか。それは良いそれは良い、くっくっく！　ならばほら、早く来いよォ、ほらほら、パンパン！」
"Hoh. So, you will fly through the air up to my balcony? Very well, very well, *cackle*! Then, look, come on right now, here here, up up!"

「……絶対安全な場所にいやがるからって余裕ぶっこきやがって…。
"...Damn you, acting so carefree just because you're in a completely safe place...

今からそこに行くぞ、首を洗って待ってやがれッ！！」
I'm coming over there right now, so prepare yourself and wait for me!!"

「あー、ダメダメ。鍵が掛かっているぞォ。もちろん窓も全て鎧戸を下ろしてある。そなたが単騎で切り込めるほど、妾の城はもろくはない！」
"Aah, no, no. The door is locked. Of course, the shutters are down for all the windows. My castle isn't so fragile that a single knight like you could break in!"

試しに玄関の扉を開こうとするが、……なるほど施錠されていた。
周りを見ると、確かに窓に鎧戸が閉められている。
I tried opening the door to the entrance anyway, ...but it really was locked.

When I looked around, I noticed that the shutters were closed on the windows after all.

……普段はあんなもの閉められていないはずだ。
...Normally, those wouldn't be closed.

「……ち。用意周到なヤツだぜ。
"...Tch. Looks like you've prepared for everything.

……鍵はどこだ？！」
...Where's the key?!"

郷田さんと熊沢さんがマスターキーを持っているだろうが、彼らは園芸倉庫という密室内。
……今はお手上げだ…！
Gohda-san and Kumsawa-san probably had master keys, but they were in the closed room of the gardening shed.

...I can only give up for now...!

"Damn... ...Guess she's no fool herself."

"Do you really want to be right beside me so muuch? All right, if you impressively pass your test, why don't I grant you an audience? If you pass, then you'll become the Successor and my new master. ...My flesh and soul will be yours to do with as you please. For I am no more than the Ushiromiya family's furniture! Ahhahhahhahhahha!!"

"......Well, it looks like you want to make me take this test no matter what.

……いいぜ。受けて立ってやらあ。…合格したら、最初のご褒美はてめえに顔面パンチだぜ。」
...Okay. I'll give it a shot. ...If I pass, my first prize will be a punch to your face."

あぁ、若き日の金蔵を、もう一度思い出させておくれ…！！　妾にこの千年の生涯でただ一度！　支配され屈服し家具に落ちる悦びを教えてくれたあの日のことを思い出させてくれよぉおおおおおぉ！！

うひゃーっひゃっひゃっひゃっひゃ！！」
Uhyaaahhyahhyahhyahhya!!"

「……酔っ払いめ、埒が明かねぇ。」
"...You damn drunk, we aren't getting anywhere."

馬鹿笑いする魔女を無視し、俺は小箱を拾い上げる。
Ignoring the stupidly smiling witch, I picked up the box.

「そうだ。それを開け。中に手紙がある。それを読むのだ。」
"Yes. Open it. Inside is a letter. Read it."

"........."

開く。……薄っすらと煙草の匂いが香る。
I opened it. ...There was a faint smell of cigarettes.

どうやら本当に元はシガーケースらしい。
Apparently, it really had originally been a cigar case.

しかし中には煙草も葉巻もない。
But there were no cigarettes or cigars inside.

代わりに、片翼の鷲の紋章が描かれた洋形封筒が。
さらにそれを開くと、……手紙が入っていた。
Instead, there was a Western envelope with the One-Winged Eagle crest.

And when I opened that too, ...there was a letter inside.

魔女を見上げる。
ニヤニヤと見下ろしていた。
I looked up at the witch.

She was grinning down at me.

……俺が、その内容にどういう反応を示すか、楽しみに待っているという風だ。
...It seemed she was looking forward to seeing what kind of reaction I'd have to the contents.

Its contents were something like this...

以下に掲げる三つの内。
二つを得るために、一つを生贄に捧げよ。
Among the three mentioned below...

In order to gain two, sacrifice one.

一．自分の命
二．＿＿の命
三．それ以外の全員の命
1. Your life

2. ＿＿'s life

3. Everyone else's lives

何れも選ばねば、上記の全てを失う。
If you do not choose one, all of the above will be lost.

それより、二番目が空欄になってて、誰の命かわかりゃしねぇ。」
More importantly, the second one's blank, so I don't even know whose life it's supposed to be."

「うむ。その二番には、その者のもっとも愛する者の名が入る。朱志香のテストには嘉音の名が、譲治のテストには紗音の名が入った。……彼らについては、想い人がはっきりしていたから予め名前を記入してやれもしたが、そなたの想い人を、妾は知らぬ。だから誰の名を書けばいいやらわからず、空欄とさせてもらった。」
"Indeed. That second one is where you put the name of the one the test-taker loves the most. For Jessica's test, it was Kanon's name, and for George's test, it was Shannon's. ...Since they had obvious feelings for certain people, those names were written in beforehand, but I don't know whom you have feelings for. So I didn't know whose name to write and left it blank."

「そいつぁ丁度いいや。
"That's perfect.

愛してるぜ、ベアトリーチェ。お前の名前をここに突っ込んでやる。だから俺が選ぶ選択肢は二番だ。これでいいか？」
I love you, Beatrice. I'll stick your name in here. In that case, I'll choose the second choice. Happy now?"

"Hey hey, quit joking, quit joking. Heey, please, Battler. Tell me the name of the person you have feelings for. If you don't, then this won't be a test, right?"

さっきまで、酔っ払いのようにふざけていた魔女が、その威厳を取り戻す。
The witch, who had been joking around like she was drunk until a second ago, suddenly regained her dignity.

...Do you have the qualifications to inherit the Ushiromiya family and all of my gold? That is what I will test. ......State your name."

先ほどまでの様子からは想像もつかないその貫禄に、俺は何の迷いもなく、返事をしてしまう。
When faced with a dignity you wouldn't have imagined from her appearance a short while ago, I answered without any hesitation.

Know the depths of that sin."

...At that time, a massive thunderclap rang out, making my mind go blank.

The witch's expression did not look like a person forcing a tough question on someone and sneering at them.

……真剣に何かを問う、静かな気迫さえ感じられた。

戦人は雨に打たれながらも、その眼差しから目を離せずにいる。
Even though the rain fell on Battler, he did not shift his eyes from that gaze.

雨に打たれるのに任せる。

戦人が、その問いに答えるまでの間、雨に打たれているように。
So that the rain would fall on her until Battler answered that question.

………それを俺が、絶対に来させるなと祖父ちゃんたちに言ってたから、……来させなかっただけで……。」
......The only reason he couldn't come...was because I told Grandpa and Grandma not to let him come, no matter what..."

...If that wasn't a betrayal of Mom, then what was it?! Who...will clear up...Mom's regrets?!!"

なら、それを相殺して、俺が家を出て行くというので、充分問題ねぇじゃねえかよ！！　そうさ、俺にはお袋の代わりに親父をブン殴る権利が、……いや、義務があったはずなんだぜッ？！
"In that case, they cancel each other out, so there's absolutely nothing wrong with me leaving the family, is there?!! That's right, I had the right...no, the duty to smack Dad in Mom's place, didn't I?!"

霧江さんも、俺の怒りを理解していて、それでもなお交流しようと、心を砕いてくれた。
Kyrie-san understood my anger, and even so, she tried to interact with me, even if it meant tearing her heart apart.

縁寿は何も事情を知らず、俺のことを別居してはいるけど、本当の兄だと信じて慕ってくれた。
Ange didn't know anything about the situation, and even though I lived in a separate house, she was raised believing that I was her real big brother and loved me as if it were true.

"You have no right to judge that as a sin, and I have no obligation to show repentance to you! If there was anyone I should've done that for, you've already killed them!! So I won't apologize for anything! I won't repent!! That's my answer for this test!!!"

「……………………………………。
"...............

……それだけか…？」
...Is that all...?"

魔女も、それを期待していたはず。

...That was how much, unconsciously and mercilessly, Beato was now filled with a brutal emptiness that wouldn't hesitate at burying a passerby...

「……ど、どうしたのです、ベアト。」
"...Wh-What is it, Beato?"

「答えたくない。
"I don't want to answer.

……………いや、答えるのも、もはや面倒臭い。」
.........No, even answering is too much of a pain to do now."

「………どうしたのよ、らしくもなく。
"...What is it? This isn't like you.

……何かあったの？　戦人が何か言っ、
...Did something happen? Did Battler say someth-

…………く、が、ギュ、」
......ack, gah, gyah-"

ベアトリーチェは、返事もしていない。無視さえしたはずだ。
Beatrice didn't even answer. It seemed that she even ignored it.

しかし、ガァプに変化が起こる。
But there was a change in Gaap.

足元から、メリメリパキパキと、薄氷を割るような音が上り、……瞬く間に、ガァプをガラスの彫像に変えてしまう。
From her feet, a creaking, cracking sound rose, like thin ice breaking, ...and in an instant, turned Gaap into a glass sculpture.

「ガ、……ガァプ…、」
"...G-Gaap..."

「…………しばらく、消えろ。大変に不機嫌だ。」
"......Disappear for a while. I'm in a very bad mood."

ベアトリーチェは、本当に冷たい、……聞くだけで心までも凍えさせてしまうような声で、そう言い放った。
Beatrice spoke that...in a truly cold voice, which could freeze the heart just by hearing it.

「……かしこまりました。それでは私どもは、これでお暇させていただきます。
"...Certainly. Then, please allow us to retire.

………何かございましたら、いつでもお呼びを。」
......If you need anything, call at any time."

ロノウェは一礼してから、黄金の蝶の群に変わり、姿を消す。
After bowing, Ronove turned into a cloud of gold butterflies and hid himself.

ワルギリアは、彫像に変えられてしまったガァプを黄金の蝶の群にして消し去ってから、自らも蝶の群になり、それに混じり合って姿を消した。
After turning Gaap, who had become a sculpture, into a cloud of gold butterflies, Virgilia also turned into a cloud, which mixed in with the others and disappeared.

…………飲み散らかされた、書斎に、……ベアトリーチェはひとり、立ち尽くしている。
その表情は、戻ってきた時から、わずかほども変わらない…。
......In the study made untidy by drinking, ...Beatrice stood still, alone.

Since the time she had returned, her expression hadn't changed in the slightest...

……しかし、転がったワインの空き瓶や散らかったチーズの皿などに気付くと、少しだけ不快そうに眉をひそめた。
...However, when she saw the fallen empty wine bottles and scattered cheese plates, her brow furrowed, and she looked a bit displeased.

そして一言、消えろと呟くと、その瞬間、部屋は瞬き、何事もなかったかのように片付いた。
And when she whispered `disappear', in that instant, the room was cleaned up in a flash, as though nothing had happened.

応接席は綺麗に整い、ワインもチーズもない。
零した汚れも、散らかしたゴミもない。
The reception chairs were neatly arranged, and there was no wine or cheese.

There were no stains or scattered trash either.

……それどころか、空気さえも冷え切り、この部屋についさっきまで、あれだけの人数が賑やかにしていたことさえも疑わせるほどに、………静かな書斎に戻った。
...To the contrary, even the air had frozen over, and, enough to make one doubt whether a large number of noisy people really had been in this room until a short while ago, ......the study had returned to silence.

………その、沈黙の、……空気さえも凍ってしまった寒々しい書斎に、ベアトリーチェは立ち尽くしていた…。
......In that silent, ...frigid study where even the air had frozen, Beatrice stood still...

そして、呟くように呼ぶ。
Then, she called, muttering.

「………………戦人。いるか。」
".........Battler, are you there?"

「……さっきからいるぜ。
"...I've been here for a while.

………何なんだ、一体お前は。さっきから変だぜ。」
......What the hell's going on with you? You've been strange since a short while ago."

「変に見えるか。それは済まぬな。」
"Do I seem strange? My apologies."

「…………あれだけ上機嫌に酒を酌み交わしていたクソジジイをいきなり焼き捨て、お前の友人の悪魔女もガラスの彫像。……悪魔の執事もお師匠も、消えろの一言でさっさと出てけだ。……お前、どんだけ気まぐれでわがままなんだか。」
"......Even though you were drinking so happily with that damn geezer, you suddenly burned him up, and your demoness friend is a glass sculpture. ...When you told the demon butler and your teacher to leave, they disappeared right away at your words. ...Just how fickle and selfish are you?"

「戦人。もう止めた。」
"Battler, I'm done."

「何を。」
"Done with what?"

「…………妾はもう、飽きた。」
"......I've grown bored of this."

「はぁ？　………そりゃまぁ、お前がおっ始めたゲームだぜ。
"Huh? ......That's...well...you were the one who started this game.

へっ、飽きてくれて助かるってもんさ。つまるところ、投了ってわけだな？」
Heh, if you've had enough, that's great for me. So basically, you're giving up?"

「投了などではない。ただ、終わるだけだ。いや、終わりもしない。このまま、ゲームが永遠に放棄されるだけだ。」
"I am not giving up. I am simply ending it. No, I won't even end it. I am just abandoning this game for all eternity."

「そういうのを投了って言うんじゃねぇのかよ。……いや、飽きて放り出すって言葉が、お前にはぴったりだな。」
"Doesn't that mean you're giving up? ...Nah, the words `got bored of it and threw it away' fit you perfectly."

「その通りだ。飽きたから、放り出す。
"That is correct. I grew bored of it...and am throwing it away.

後は知らぬ。そのまま放置されて、好きに埃でも被ればいい。」
I don't care what happens next. It can remain abandoned and gather dust as much as you like."

「……………………。……お前どうしたんだ。何だかさっきからやりにくいぜ。
"............What's going on with you? You've been kinda hard to deal with since a short while ago."

……まださっきのワケのわかんねぇテストのことで尾を引いてるのかよ？　俺に恨みがあるなら、はっきり言えばいいじゃねぇか。お前は赤で、自分とは関係ないなんて言ってみせたが、どうせ言葉遊びだろ？　お前の顔に書いてあるぜ。俺を恨んでるってな。」
"...Are these still the aftereffects of that incomprehensible test from earlier? If you've got a grudge, all you have to do is say so clearly. You said in red that it has nothing to do with you, but that's gotta be a play on words, right? It's written all over your face. You have a grudge against me."

「お前に恨みなどないと、何度言えばわかるのか。妾はそなたが罪を残したその当時に、存在しておらぬ。」
"How many times will I have to say I have no grudge against you before you'll understand? At the time you committed your sin, I did not exist."

ベアトはカチンと来たような表情で、さらに不愉快そうに表情を歪めてそう言い放つ。
As Beato spoke with an offended expression, her face twisted to look even more displeased.

気まぐれ。移り気。気分屋。天気屋。……わがままで無邪気で、残酷。
Fickle. Inconsistent. Moody. Temperamental. ...Selfish and simple-minded and cruel.

しかしそれでも、こんなおかしな表情を見せたことは今まで一度もなかった…。
But even so, she hadn't shown an expression as strange as this even once until now...

「…………ま、お前が吹っ掛けてきたゲームだ。俺も決着がつかねぇのは残念だが、気が向いたらぜひまた誘ってくれよな。
"......Well, you were the one who provoked me into this game. I'm a bit let down that it wasn't resolved, but feel free to invite me again if you feel like it."

そん時ゃ、謹んでご辞退させてもらうけどよ？　へっへっへ。」
"But when that happens, allow me to politely refuse, okay? Heheheh."

わざとおちょくるような口調で話し掛けるが、ベアトがそれに反応を示すことはない。
He intentionally spoke in a mocking tone, but Beato showed no reaction.

……戦人は俯き、舌打ちをする…。
...Battler hung his head and clicked his tongue...

「何度も何度も１０月４日と５日をぐるぐる過ごしたわけだが、ようやくこれでお役御免だな。……これで明後日には船が来る。
"We've circled around October 4 and 5 over and over again, but I've finally had just about enough of this role. ...This way, the boat will come tomorrow."

…そうさ、そして船着場にはうみねこも戻ってくる。……俺はようやく、六軒島名物の、あのニャーニャーいう鳴き声を聞けるわけだ。何しろ、島に来た時は天気のせいか、全然いなかったからな。
"...That's right, and then the seagulls will return to the harbor. ...I'll finally be able to hear Rokkenjima's signature nya-nya- cries. After all, maybe because of the weather, they weren't there at all when I came to the island."

………うみねこのなく頃に、全ては終わる、ってわけだ。……終わり終わり、おしまいおしまい。清々すらぁ。」
"......When the seagulls cry, everything will end, I guess. All done, the end. What a relief."

"......Exactly what is it that you're misunderstanding?"

「ん？　何をだって？」
"Hmm? What'd you say?"

「………何も終わらぬと、妾は言ったぞ。これにて全ては放置される。ゲームは忘れられ、盤上の駒はそのままに放置される。
"......I said that nothing would end. With this, everything will be abandoned. The game will be forgotten, and the pieces on the board will be abandoned as they lay.

進みも戻りも、取りも取られもしない。勝ちもなく、負けもなく、引き分けすらもない。ただ、放置されるのだ。」
There will be no advancing or returning, no taking and being taken. No victory, no defeat, not even a tie. Just abandoned."

「…………つまりはおしまいってことだろ。」
"......Doesn't that mean it's over?"

「違う。妾の手番にて永遠にゲームが止まる。そなたの番は来ない。だから勝ちも負けも引き分けもない。
"Wrong. On my turn, the game will stop for all eternity. Your turn will not come. So there will be no victory nor defeat nor a tie."

………かつての妾は、そなたにそうされるわけには行かなかった。そなたに勝つという目的があったからだ。
"......In the past, I couldn't let you do that. After all, one of my goals was winning against you.

しかし、それに興味を失った。だから、これ以上、手番を進める意味が、もう何もない。」
However, I've lost interest. So there is no longer any point in making moves any longer."

「…………俺に手番が来ないというのは、どういう意味なんだ…。」
"......What do you mean...by my turn not coming...?"

俺は、ベアトがゲームに飽きることで解放され、六軒島を脱出できるつもりでいる。
I'd thought that Beato getting tired of the game meant I'd be released...and that I'd be able to escape Rokkenjima.

しかし、ベアトが繰り返し言う、ゲームの放棄とゲームの勝敗は違うという意味が、……なぜか頭に引っ掛かる…。
But for some reason, Beato's repeated words...about the difference between abandoning the game and settling it...caught my attention...

………こいつはさっきから何に不機嫌で、…何を言っているんだ……？
......Just what is it she's been saying, ...and why the bad mood...?

その時、俺の後から突然、声が聞こえた。
At that time, I suddenly heard a voice from behind me.

振り返ると、……どこかであった記憶があるような、ないような…。
When I turned around, ...there was someone I thought I might, or might not, remember from somewhere...

……瞳に光を宿さない、謎の少女が立っていた。
...A mysterious girl, with no light in her eyes, was standing there.

「………その子が言っているのは、こういう意味よ。……このゲームが、駒をそのままに、蓋を閉じられるということ。ゲームは終わらないまま、永遠に留め置かれる。」
"......What this kid's saying goes something like this. ...She means putting the lid on this game and leaving the pieces as they are. The game will be locked away for all eternity, without ending."

「あんたが元の世界へ戻ることの出来る唯一の方法は、ベアトに勝利することだけ。

......So, if Beato abandons the game, ...get it?"

いつの間にか、別の場所にも、真っピンクのドレスを来た少女がいた。
……彼女にもどこかで会ったような気がするが、思い出せない。
Suddenly, in a different place...was a girl wearing a bright pink dress.

...I had a feeling I'd met her somewhere too, but I couldn't remember.

それより、彼女の言った言葉の意味。
More important was the meaning of her words.

……ゲームが放棄されるということは、……え？
...If the game is abandoned, then...huh?

「………そういうことよ。勝負は敵味方が揃わなきゃ決着しないわ。………あなたには、もう永遠に、勝利してこの世界から抜け出すことが、出来ないということよ。」
"......That's right. A match won't be resolved unless enemies and allies meet. ......It would mean that you'd never be able to win and escape from this world for all eternity."

「差し詰め、……あなたを閉じ込めた檻の鍵を、ハトの首輪にでも括り付けて飛ばしてしまうようなものかしら。
"What it comes down to, I guess, ...is something like taking the key to the cage that you're locked in, fastening it to the collar of a pigeon or something, and letting it fly."

…………冗談じゃないわ、ベアト。そんなつまらないゲームを見に、私たちは遥々ここまで来たわけじゃないのよ。これでゲームはお開きなんて、冗談じゃないわ。」
"......This isn't funny, Beato. We didn't come this far to watch such a boring game. Calling it a day like this is no joke."

「………ラムダに同じよ。私は戦人を勝利させ、あなたを敗北させてのた打ち回らせるためにやって来たのよ。まだその目的を達していない。……こんなところでゲーム放棄されて、逃げ出されたんじゃ堪らないわ。」
"......I agree with Lambda. I came here to make Battler win and to make you writhe in defeat. I still haven't achieved that goal. ...I won't stand for you abandoning the game at a time like this and running away."

「卿らを失望させるゲームの幕切れとなったことは認めよう。
"I acknowledge that it would mean the curtain call for a game that disappoints you Ladies.

……しかし、この茶会のホストたる妾は何しろ気まぐれ。興が醒めれば、持て成す術など知らぬ。……元より、それが妾の、魔女たる所以のはず。何も問題はなかろう…？」
...However, I, the host of this tea party, am fickle. Once it's lost its fun, I know no way of entertaining. ...I believe that's been my witch-like way of doing things from the very beginning. There are no problems, yes...?"

「…………………………。……確かに。あなたの教義には反しないわ。」
"............Certainly. I won't go against your creed."

「私は認めないわよ…。……ふざけんじゃないわよ、あんたにどんだけ肩入れしたと思ってんのよ…。
"I won't accept it... ...Quit fooling around, how much do you think I've supported you...?

ここまでお膳立てさせて、これでハイおしまい？　ふざけんじゃないわよ…！！」
You think I'd be okay with that after all this preparation? Don't mess with me...!!"

"I am saying that I have tired of it. Nothing more, nothing less."

「そうは行かないわよ…。あんたにはこのゲームを続けてもらうわ。戦人に勝利したいんでしょう？
"That's not gonna fly... We'll have you continue this game. You wanna win against Battler, right?

勝って屈服させたいんでしょう？！　もう一息じゃない！　ね〜？！」
You wanna win and make him surrender, right?! You're almost there, aren't you?! Am I right?!"

「………そ、そこで俺に振るんじゃねぇ。
"......D-Don't ask me that.

……ただ、俺にも意見はある。言わせてくれ。」
...But...I have an opinion too. Let me say it."

「…………何か。」
"......What?"

「こいつは、お前に売られた喧嘩だ。俺はお前とはっきり白黒をつける覚悟がある。……何度か屈服しかけたが、途中で逃げ出して、勝負をうやむやにして逃げるつもりだけはさらさらねぇ。
"This is a fight you picked. I'm prepared to settle this once and for all. ...I've come close to surrendering many times, but I've never had any intention of escaping partway through, leaving the match undecided."

……俺がここにいて、戦う意思を見せている以上。……逃げるんじゃねぇ、ベアトリーチェ。」
"...Since I'm here, showing the will to fight, ...you'd better not run away, Beatrice."

「…………同感だわ。戦人を巻き込んでおいて、勝ちも負けも与えずに立ち去るなんて、無責任にも程がある。」
"......I agree. Getting Battler involved and then leaving without giving him victory or defeat is just too irresponsible."

いつの間にか、グレーテルまでもがいた。
Suddenly, even Gretel was there.

……そして誰もが、ベアトのことを無責任だと罵った。
...And everyone was calling Beato irresponsible.

「ほう。………どうやら妾が無責任だと罵られる最大の理由は、戦人が対戦相手として留まっているからということらしい。
"Hoh. ...It seems I'm mostly being called irresponsible because Battler will, as my opponent, be stuck.

......In that case, Battler, will you step down from being an opponent, as I shall? That way, I will have done nothing worthy of criticism."

"If I step down, will I be able to leave Rokkenjima...?"

「出られるわけもなかろうが。勝手に埃を浴びて肩にでも積もらせよ。」
"There's no chance you'll be able to leave. Just be covered in dust and let it pile up on your shoulders."

「………ふざけないで。なんて無責任な人なの。あんたはこれだけ大勢の人間を殺した。
"......Quit fooling around. What an irresponsible person. You've killed such a large number of people.

しかも、魔女の力によって、何度も何度も。惨たらしい殺し方で！　………その責任を取らず、逃げ出すなんて、絶対に許せない…！」
On top of that, using a witch's power, you've done it over and over. Killing in gruesome ways! ......I definitely won't let you escape without taking responsibility...!"

「責任。……ほぅ、妾はどのようにして、その責任とやらを取ればいいのか。」
"Responsibility. ...Hoh, what is it I should do to take this so-called responsibility?"

「決着をつけるまで戦いなさい。戦人は正面の席に座り、あなたに打ち勝つまで決して諦めずに戦う。だからあなたも、負かされるまで戦いなさい。それが嫌なら、戦人を負かせてみせなさい…！！
"Fight until a resolution is reached. Battler will sit in the chair across from you, never giving up and fighting until he beats you. So you too, fight until you're defeated. If you don't like that, try and defeat Battler...!!"

許さない、全てをうやむやにして、戦人をこの席に放り出して、
……永遠に閉じ込めて帰さないなんて、
………許さない……！！」
"I won't forgive you...if you leave everything unresolved and abandon Battler in this chair,

...locking him up and never letting him return...

......I won't forgive you...!!"

「……グレーテル。」
"...Gretel."

正直なところ、グレーテルがどういう立ち位置で俺を助けてくれているのか、よくはわからない。
To be perfectly honest, I didn't really understand from what standpoint Gretel was trying to save me.

……しかし彼女の言葉には、俺をこの狂ったゲームの世界から、何としても救い出したいという、強い意志が感じられた。
...But in her words, I could feel a strong determination to save me from this insane game world no matter what.

だから、俺もそれに応えた。
So, I responded in kind.

「ベアト。こっちを向け。」
"Beato, face me."

「…………………。」
"........."

「俺は、ここにいる。お前の正面の、ライバルの席だ。……わかるな？　俺がここに座り続ける限り。お前に逃げは、許さない。……だから逃げるな。戦え。
"I am here. Across from you, in the seat of your rival. ...Get it? As long as I continue to sit here, I won't allow you to escape. ...So don't escape. Fight."

お前が始めた戦いだろうが。これだけ何度も何度も上等を決めやがって、しっちゃかめっちゃかにやってくれたんだッ！
"Isn't this a fight you started? You did all that crap over and over, making a complete mess of things!

今さら飽きたで終わらせられるかよ！！　俺はお前の対戦相手だ！！　俺がここにある限り！！　逃げるなんて許さねえぞッ！！
How could I let you end it because you're tired, after all this time?!! I am your opponent!! As long as I'm here, I won't let you escape!!"

聞いてるのかこの無責任魔女めッ！　何とか言ってみろってんだぁあああああああぁあぁぁあぁぁ！！！」
"Are you listening, you irresponsible witch?! Try saying somethiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiing!!!"

俺が怒鳴りつけると、……しばらくの間、ベアトは沈黙していた。
After I yelled at her, ...Beato went silent for a while.

俺の言葉が届いたのか、それともまったく別のことを考えているのかは、わからない。
Whether my words had reached her, or whether she was thinking about something completely different, ...I couldn't tell.

でもしばらくの間、沈黙し、……何とも感情の読めない表情で俺を凝視し、……それに気付かれたと知って、目線を逸らせた。
But for a while, she was silent, ...gazing at me with an expression I could read no emotion from, ...and when she realized that I'd noticed, she averted her gaze.

そして背を向け、……こう言った。
Then, she turned her back to me...and said this...

「戦人が対戦相手を辞めてくれぬ以上、このゲームを放棄することは認められぬと、……卿らは仰るわけか。
"So, since Battler will not quit as my opponent, ...the Ladies are saying that my abandonment of this game will not be acknowledged.

…………ならば、問おう。そもそも、そこにいる男に、妾の対戦相手たる資格があるのかどうかを。」
......In that case, let's ask. Let's see if the man over there was qualified to be my opponent in the first place."

「………資格？」
"......Qualified?"

「…どうせ、さっきのテストとやらのことだぜ。」
"...Probably has something to do with that test or whatever just now."

「……………何をする気…？」
"......What are you planning to do...?"

「…あ、…あんたまさか…、」
"...D-Don't tell me you're..."
