やがてノックの音がした。
Eventually, there was the sound of a knock.

インカムからも、客人のボディチェックが終了し、問題がないことの連絡がある。
Also, there was a message from the intercom that the guest's body check had been completed with no problems.

鍵を開け、扉を開くと、
The door was unlocked, then opened,

………そこには高校生くらいの女の姿があった。
......and a high school aged girl was standing there.

「会長。縁寿さんがいらっしゃいました。」
"Chairman, Ange-san has arrived."

絵羽が反応し、顔を来客に向ける。
Eva reacted and turned her face towards the guest.

もっとも、護衛の呼び掛けに反応したというよりは、縁寿の化粧の匂いに反応したというべきだろう。
However, instead of reacting to the guard's call, maybe it would be better to say that she reacted to the smell of Ange's makeup.

……絵羽はこの部屋に閉じ篭って長く、わずかの匂いの変化にも敏感だった。
...After being shut up in this room for so long, Eva was sensitive to even small changes in smell.

「……………………。来たわね。
"............So you came,

……縁寿。」
...Ange."

「……来たわ。呼ばれたから。」
"...I came. You did call me."

絵羽の顔に、姪を歓待する表情は見られない。
…そして縁寿の顔にも、伯母との面会を喜ぶ表情は見られなかった。
On Eva's face, there was no trace of a person warmly welcoming their niece.

...And on Ange's face, you couldn't see the expression of one pleased to meet with their aunt.

絵羽は枯れ枝のように細くなった腕を振り、護衛に出て行けという仕草をする。
Eva waved her arm, which had grown as thin as a withered branch, and motioned for the guard to leave.

護衛は黙礼してから廊下に出た。
The guard bowed silently and went out into the hall.

「……暗い上に空気もひどいわ。カーテンでも開けたら…？」
「……………そうすると、あんたの依頼した殺し屋が、窓越しに撃ってくるって寸法なのかしらぁ……？」
"...It's not only stuffy, but dark too. Can I open the curtains...?"

"......Is your plan for that hit man you hired to shoot me through the window...?"

「………あんたの暗殺依頼なら私が受けたいわ。家でのんびり、ほんのひと月も過ごしてれば、勝手に任務が終わるもの。」
"......I wish I could get hired to assassinate you. All I'd have to do is relax at home for a month and the job would take care of itself."

「…ふっふっふっふ、はっはっはっはっは……。」
"...Heheheheh, hahhahhahhahha..."

伯母と姪にしては物騒な会話を交わしあう。
Their discussion was quite morbid for an aunt and niece.

…しかし、互いに冗談めかすような様子はない。
……少なくとも、絵羽は自分が命を狙われていると信じていた。
...However, they didn't look like they were joking.

...At the very least, Eva believed that someone was after her life.

右代宮家の莫大な財産は、その全てが右代宮絵羽によって占有されている。
All of the Ushiromiya family's massive fortune had come into the possession of Ushiromiya Eva.

…その財産には、かの右代宮金蔵が隠し持っていたと囁かれる、１０ｔの隠し黄金も含むと言われていた。
...It was said that this fortune also included the 10 tons of hidden gold that Ushiromiya Kinzo was rumored to have hidden.

その莫大な財産は、老獪で狡猾で猜疑心の強い絵羽の手元にあってはどうしようもないが、……小娘に過ぎない縁寿に相続されれば、自在に掠め取れるのではないかと目論む者たちがいると噂される。
While this vast wealth lay in Eva's cunning, sly, and suspicious hands, no one was able to complain, ...but it was rumored that as soon as it was passed on to Ange, who was no more than a young girl, certain people were plotting to snatch it away.

今や、金蔵の子孫たちは絵羽と縁寿の２人だけ。
……絵羽が死ねば全ての財産は縁寿に相続される。
By now, Eva and Ange were Kinzo's only descendants.

...If Eva died, all of the wealth would go to Ange.

…そしてさらに縁寿まで殺されることがあれば、……その財産は、縁寿の母である霧江の実家に相続される。
...And if Ange were then to be killed as well, ...that wealth would go to the family of Ange's mother, Kyrie.

その意味においては、絵羽だけでなく縁寿もまた、…正体不明の何者かにいつ命を狙われてもおかしくない立場にいた。
In this sense, not only Eva, but Ange as well, ...were in a position where it wouldn't be odd at all for their life to be targeted by some unknown person.

……そして絵羽は、縁寿を長く憎んでいた。
...And Eva had hated Ange for a long time.

大切な一人息子の譲治を失い、……自分の財産の相続人が、１２年前のあの日、親族会議を欠席して生き残った彼女だけだということを知ったからだ。
This was because she knew that, after losing her only precious son, George, ...the inheritor of her own wealth would be none other than the girl who had been absent at that family conference 12 years ago, and who had survived.

絵羽は縁寿を疎み、嫌い、そして憎悪さえした。
Eva shunned Ange, disliked her, and even hated her.

彼女を特別な学校へ隔離し、人並みの幸福や青春から遠ざけ、生涯を飼い殺すつもりであった。
She isolated Ange in a special school and separated her from the youth and happiness normal people have, trying to keep her as a pet until death.

……しかし、絵羽は不治の病を患い、その余命は皮肉にも、…１２年前の親族会議で、金蔵に宣告されていたのと同じものになっていた…。
...However, Eva had succumbed to an incurable illness, and ironically, ...her remaining life was estimated to be the same as Kinzo's had been at that family conference 12 years ago.

絵羽も縁寿も、…互いを憎しみあっている。
Both Eva and Ange...hated each other.

最後の肉親同士だというのに、…早く相手が死ねばいいのにと、憎しみあっている…。
Even though they were each other's last blood relatives, ...they hated each other so much that they hoped the other would die quickly...

「………それで？　わざわざ呼び付けて何の用…？」
"......And? Why did you go to all the trouble of calling for me...?"

「……私はもう長くないわ。……藪医者どもは、未だに私が盛られた毒が何かも検出できない。………わかってるの。きっとソ連のＫＧＢで使われてた秘密の暗殺薬なのよ。…あぁ、私は殺されるのよ、殺されるのよ…！！　良かったわね、もうじき死ぬわよ、そうすればさぞやあなたの胸がすくでしょうねぇ…！」
"...I don't have much time left. ...These quack doctors still can't detect any of the poison that's filling me up. ......I know. I'm sure it's some secret assassination drug used by those Soviet KGBs. ...Ooh, I'm gonna be killed, I'm gonna be killed...!! Isn't that great?! Very soon, I will die, which will surely be quite a load off your back...!"

「……………………………。…可哀想な人。」
"...............What a pitiable person."

いつものことだ。
This always happened.

……本題からすぐに逸脱して、物騒な話に捻じ曲がる。
...They immediately deviated from the main topic, distorting it into a more unsettling discussion.

猜疑心で肥大化した絵羽は、自身が常に命を狙われていると信じていた。
Eva, who was absolutely paranoid, believed that someone was always after her life.

実際、彼女は右代宮家の莫大な財産を相続した後、金蔵がかつてそうしたような荒っぽい方法で、手段を選ばない利殖を繰り返し、たくさんの敵を作っている。
And in actual fact, after inheriting the vast wealth of the Ushiromiya family, she had used wild methods just like Kinzo had done in the past, repeatedly making money by any means necessary and creating many enemies along the way.

莫大な資本で、急成長し始めた企業に買収攻勢を仕掛け、手打ちと称してそれを高額で買い戻させる。
With a massive supply of capital, she had plotted to aggressively buy businesses that were starting to have rapid growth, making them buy it back at a high price under the guise of reconciliation.

……それは皮肉にも、１２年前に彼の夫の会社が受けた行為の裏返しだった…。
...Ironically, it was the same type of action that her husband's company had been hit with 12 years ago...

そんなことを、ひたすらに繰り返した１２年だった。
……恨みも山ほど買っている。
She had repeated this constantly for 12 years.

...She had also earned a lot of hatred.

もしあの世の夫が聞いたなら、家族を失った寂しさの裏返しだと擁護するかもしれない。
If her husband had heard of this from beyond the grave, he might have defended her, saying that the loneliness from losing her family fueled her actions.

……しかし、今の彼女を知る者で、擁護する者は誰もいない。
...However, of all the people who knew her now, none would defend her.

絵羽はしばらくの間、自分の命が如何に狙われているかを雄弁に語り、自分に恨みを抱いているであろう人物の名を次々に挙げては、自分がまだ殺されずにいることを嘲笑う。
For some time, Eva eloquently spoke of how her life was being targeted, listing off names of people who hated her, and sneering at the fact that she still hadn't been killed.

縁寿はその中に自分の名が含まれても、特に表情も変えず、彼女が言い疲れるのを淡々と待った…。
Even though Ange heard her own name included in that list, there was no particular change in her expression, and she waited indifferently for Eva to tire herself out...

「………私はね、
…………憎いのよ。あんたが。」
「光栄ね。私もよ。」
"......You see,

...I really hate you."

"I'm honored. Same here."

「………譲治のために築いた未来だった。……それを、あんたに掠め取られるなんて。…留弗夫の娘に奪われるなんて…。………私は悔しい。
……子も残せず、
…財産すらも奪われるなんて、
………それが私には、
……許せない…………！」
"......I built this future for George's sake. ...To think that it would be snatched away by you. ...To think that it would be stolen away by Rudolf's daughter... ......I can't bear it.

...To think that...I would have my fortune stolen away...

...without even leaving behind a child...

......That,

...I cannot forgive......!"




「……だったら財産全部、お布施にでもしちゃえば？　お百度踏んでた宗教系の連中はどうしたのよ。」
"...If only you'd just give all of your fortune to charity. What about all those religious people you used to go so far out of your way to find?"

「…………くっくっくっくっく！　連中はみんな言うのよ。…多すぎる財産が私の負担になっているって。決まって、だから預けて清める必要があるとか言い出すのよ。……あっははははははははは！　それで思いついたのよ。寄付はやめたわ！」
"......*cackle*cackle*! They all say the same thing. ...My excessive wealth has become a burden to me. And they always say something about how I need to give it up and cleanse myself. ...Ahhahahahahahahahaha! Then I thought of something. I stopped donating!"

絵羽は一時期、心の安寧を求めたのか、おかしな新興宗教の教祖たちをずいぶん招き入れた。
For a time, Eva had searched for the founders of several strange and new religious cults, perhaps seeking peace in her heart.

…だが結局、彼らは彼女の心に救いを与えられず、むしろ猜疑心をさらに肥大させる結果となった…。
...But they gave her heart no relief, and if anything, they ended up increasing her paranoia further...

「………お金が余ってるなら、サラブレッド買い占めてコンビーフでも作れば？」
"......If you have too much money, why don't you start buying up thoroughbreds and make some corned beef?"

「それよりもっと面白いことを思いついたのよ。……くっくくくくくくくく！　色々悩んだわ。どうやればあなたを酷い目に合わせられるかをね。
"I've thought of something even more interesting. ...*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*! I've worried over it a lot. What could I do to make things horrible for you?"

……殺してしまおうとも思ったわ。あるいは全ての財産を消し去って、あなたを無一文にして人買いにでも売ってしまおうかとも思ったわ。素敵でしょ？　両手両足をブツ切りにされて死ぬまで客を取らされるのよ。あぁ、それも実に素敵だわ、
"...I thought about killing you. I also thought about erasing all of my wealth, leaving you penniless, and selling you off to a slave trader or something. Wouldn't that be wonderful? You'd have your arms and legs chopped off and be forced to take customers until you died. Aaah, that would be so wonderful,

くっくっくっくっくっく！！」
*cackle*cackle*cackle*!!"

「…………楽しい？」
"......Is this fun for you?"

「楽しいわ。あなたを怯えさせるのはね…。……でももうじき私は死ぬわ。…だから、私が死んだ後も、どうやってあなたを苦しませ続けるか、考えたの。………そうしたら、……くっくっくっく！　案外、単純なことだったわ。……それをあなたに話したくて呼んだのよ。」
"Oh yes, it is. It's fun to scare you, ...but very soon, I will die. ...So I thought about how I might continue to cause you pain even after my death. ......And then, ...*cackle*cackle*!! It was surprisingly simple. ...I called you because I wanted to talk about it."

「…………………そろそろ中間、近いんだけど。手短にね。」
".........I have midterms coming up. Keep it brief."

「…あなたに。
"...I have decided.

全ての財産を相続することにしたわ。」
「………………………………。…へぇ。」
I will have you inherit all of my fortune."

"...............Oh?"

「それどころか、
……私が死ぬ最後の一日まで、
…どこまでも財産を増やして、膨れに膨らしてあなたに相続することにしたのよ。…くっくっくっく、それがどういうことか、想像がつくかしら…？」
「……わかんないわ。馬鹿だから。」
"Not only that,

...but I decided that until the very day I die,

...I'll expand that fortune as much as I can, inflating it to massive proportions before having you inherit all of it. ...*cackle*cackle* Can you even imagine what that would be like...?"

"...I don't get it. Because it's stupid."

「うっふっふっふ、くっくっくっくっくっく！！　そうよねぇ、わかんないでしょうねぇ…！　楽しみにしてなさいよぅ、本当に楽しいわよ、お金持ちは…！　毎日、日本中の妖怪が朝から晩まで遊びに来るわよ。
"Ehhehhehheh, *cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*!! That's right, you don't get it, do you...?! Look forward to it, it really is fun, being rich...! Every day, youkai from across Japan come to play."

あんたの私生活はこれからは全てワイドショーと週刊誌が覗き見してくれるわ。何をしてもしなくても、マスコミは必ず私を批判する！　施せばブルジョワだと叩かれ、渋れば守銭奴だと罵られる。あぁ、本当に素敵な毎日よ？　そんな日々に、若くて先の長いあなたを、ぜひ招待してあげようと思いついたの。本当に素敵でしょう？」
"From now on, your entire life will be followed by talk shows and weekly magazines. The media will criticize me no matter what I do or don't do! If I donate, they'll attack me for being bourgeois, and if I hesitate, I'll be abused as a miser. Oh, every day really is wonderful, you see? I decided it'd be great let you have that kind of life, when you're so young and have so much ahead of you. Doesn't that sound absolutely wonderful?"

「………あんたのしてきたことに対する、世間の正当な評価でしょ。」
"......Looks like the public's opinion of all you've done was spot on."

「くっくっくっくっく！！　そうねぇ、そうでしょうねぇ。…いいわ、好きなだけ私を罵るといいわ。そしてその評価を、あなたが背負うのよ。……清貧が善人、金持ちは死ねというのが日本の文化。あんたはやがて、何をしてもしなくても、日本中から妬みと恨みの象徴に祭り上げられていく。…くっくっくっくっく！
"*cackle*cackle*cackle*!! Too true, yes, that is too true. ...Go ahead, abuse me as much as you want. Soon, you will face that same criticism. ...Japanese culture dictates that good people live in honorable poverty, while the wealthy should just die. No matter what you do or do not do, you will eventually be lifted up as a symbol of envy and hate across Japan. ...*cackle*cackle*cackle*!"

そんな生活の中で生きていくあなたのこれからの人生は、どんなにも歪なものなのかしらね…？　あんたの味方は誰もいない！　あんたの悩みなど誰も聞かない。あなたを罵ることは公然としたスポーツになる。そしてそれを誰も止めない！
"I wonder how twisted your life will become after living that way... You have no allies! No one will listen to your worries. Abusing you will become a public sport. And no one can stop that!"

　あぁ、縁寿！　うっふふふふふふふふ、
あぁ、本当に楽しみよ。…あんたはどんな人生を送って、どう終えるのかしら…！　世界中の誰も信用できず、誰も愛せず、誰とも語り合えない人生をたっぷり満喫しなさい…！！　その苦労話を持って地獄へ墜ちてくるのを、私はのんびりと待っているわ。うっふふふふ、
あはっはははははははは、
わーっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっは、
がはッ、
"Oh, Ange! Heheheheheheh,

oh, I'm really looking forward to it. ...I wonder how you will live your life...and how you'll end it...! Enjoy to the fullest a life of being unable to trust anyone in the world, being unable to love anyone, being unable to talk with anyone...!! I'll be patiently waiting for you to take that story of hardship down with you into hell. Heheheheh,

ahahhahahahahahahaha,

wa-hhahhahhahhahhahhhahahahahahahahahahhahha,

gkk,

げほげほ、
*cough*cough*,

がはッ！！」
ghah!!"




狂った笑いは、苦しい咳の声に変わる。
Her insane laughter turned into a painful cough.

縁寿は表情ひとつ変えずに、ただただ淡白に、
……六軒島の唯一の生き残りを見つめていた。
Without changing her expression in the slightest, looking completely unconcerned,

...Ange stared at the only survivor of Rokkenjima.

咳き込む声に不審を感じたのか、短いノックと同時に護衛が飛び込んできた。
Perhaps because he found the violent coughing suspicious, the guard gave a short knock on the door and rushed in at the same time.

縁寿はじろりとそれを見て、無言で、自分はここから一歩も動いていないとアピールする。
Ange glanced at him, wordlessly making it clear that she didn't intend to move a step from where she was.

……自分に、絵羽殺しの濡れ衣を着せるための、何かの罠さえ縁寿は覚悟していた。
しかし、幸いにもそれは杞憂。
...Ange was prepared for some kind of trap to frame her in Eva's death.

However, that was fortunately a needless fear.

護衛は絵羽の背中を擦りながら、魔法瓶の白湯をマグカップに注ぐ。
その間にも苦しそうに絵羽は咳を繰り返していた。
As the guard rubbed Eva's back, he poured hot water from a thermos into a mug.

As he did, Eva kept coughing, apparently in pain.

縁寿は、これが自分が見ることのできる六軒島の魔女の最後の姿だろうと思った。
Ange figured that this was probably the last she'd see of the Rokkenjima Witch's final days.

ようやく喉を潤して呼吸を整える。
…しかし瞳の奥のぎらぎらした狂気はまったく収まらない。
Eventually, the coughing subsided, and Eva regained her normal breathing.

...However, the glittering madness inside her eyes hadn't subsided in the slightest.

「くっくくくくくくくくくくくく！！　あの呪われた莫大な黄金と右代宮家当主の家督、……そして、
…………黄金の魔女、ベアトリーチェの名を、
…今こそあなたに譲るわ。…………魔女の名に相応しい、狂って歪んだ生涯を楽しみなさい…！」
"*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*!! Now, I will give to you...

that cursed mass of gold and the Ushiromiya Family Headship, ...as well as...

...the name of the Golden Witch, Beatrice. ......Enjoy the insane, twisted rest of your life, fitting for the name of the witch...!"

「そんなのいらないわ。それより教えて。……あの日、六軒島で何があったの。………事故があったなんて、私は信じない。あの日に何があったのか、父さんと母さんと兄さんがどうして死んだのか、本当のことを教えて……！！」
"I don't need that. More importantly, tell me. ...On that day, what happened on Rokkenjima? ......I don't believe it was an accident. Tell me the truth about what happened that day, and why Father and Mother and Nii-san died...!!"

「くっくっくっくっく…！　あぁ、それが一番の嫌がらせよねぇ？　……あの日に何があったか？　１９８６年の今日、何があったのか…？　……何て言葉を残して３人が死んだのか、……知りたいわよねぇぇ…？
"*cackle*cackle*...! Oh, yes, that is the best way I have to harass you, isn't it? ...What happened on that day? What happened on this day in 1986...? ...You want to know what they said before they died, riiight...?"

ぉ教えないわよォおおおぉ、
"I won't tell yoooooouu,

あーっひゃっひゃっひゃっひゃッ！！　呪われた黄金は残す！　でもね、あんたが望む真相は、私が地獄まで持って行くわ…！　それがあんたに出来る一番の嫌がらせよォ！！
aaahhhyahhyahhyahhyah!! I'll leave behind the cursed gold! But you know what? I'll take the truth you seek with me to hell...! That's the best way I can torment you!!"

悔しい？　聞きたければ地獄まで行って、あんたの家族に聞いてみるといい！　なら今すぐ死なないとねぇ？！
"Oh, are you mad? If you want to hear it so much, try going to hell and asking your family there! In that case, you'd better die right now, right?!

あっははははは、今すぐヘソでも噛んで、死んじゃえばぁッ？！
Ahhahahahahaha, if only you'd just give up and die right now!!

わーっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはっはッ！！」
Waaahhahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!!"

その笑いは、再び咳き込むまで続く。
That laugh continued until she started coughing again.

そしてその咳は、彼女が呻きだして痙攣を始めるまで収まらないのだった……。
And that cough did not subside until she started moaning and going into convulsions...

１９８６年１０月４日。
October 4, 1986.

六軒島で、右代宮家恒例の、そして最後の親族会議が開かれた。
On Rokkenjima, the Ushiromiya family's customary...and final family conference was held.

そしてその翌日の１０月５日。
And on the next day, October 5...

“とても不幸な事故”が起こり、右代宮家一族は全滅した。
`An extremely unfortunate accident' occurred, and the Ushiromiya family was wiped out.

“幸運にも”右代宮絵羽はこれを逃れ、右代宮家のほぼ全ての財産を相続することとなった。
`Fortunately', Ushiromiya Eva escaped from that...and inherited almost all of the Ushiromiya family's fortune.

しかし、右代宮家を取り巻く不穏な噂の数々と、その後の絵羽の振る舞い、“不幸な事故時”の不自然な行動などから、遺産の独占を狙った陰謀ではないかと世間で騒がれることになる。
However, due to the many turbulent rumors surrounding the Ushiromiya family, the way Eva acted afterwards, and her unnatural actions `at the time of the unfortunate accident', the public was in an uproar over whether this might have been a conspiracy to get all of the inheritance for herself.

世論に押される形で、検察は何度か捜査を試み、マスコミは六軒島疑惑と名付けて陰謀の輪郭をなぞり出していったが、この“不幸な事故”が、犯罪であることを立証できるだけの証拠は、ついに見つけることができなかった。
Under pressure from the public, prosecutors repeatedly tried to investigate the matter, and the media began tracing the outline of a conspiracy they called the Rokkenjima Suspicion, but in the end, they weren't even able to find proof that this `unfortunate accident' was a crime.

しかしマスコミはその後も六軒島疑惑を、絵羽の陰謀であると印象付けていった為、世論は彼女こそが真犯人であると信じていった。
However, because the media continued to give the impression that the Rokkenjima Suspicion was a conspiracy of Eva's, public opinion began to believe that she was the true culprit.

…もちろんそれには、その後の彼女による、莫大な財産を運用した、社会的に批判されやすい数々の強引な経済活動からの悪印象も影響している。
...Of course, that was also influenced by the bad impression caused by all that easily-condemnable, overbearing financial activity, which she had carried out using that vast wealth.

彼女が何かをして取り沙汰される度に、ワイドショーは六軒島疑惑を蒸し返しては、彼女こそが犯人であり、それを逮捕できないのは警察すらも買収されているからだと司法を糾弾した。
Every time she did something and the rumors started spreading, the media would bring back the Rokkenjima Suspicion, blaming the criminal justice system by saying that she was the true culprit, and that the only reason she hadn't been arrested was because even the police had been bribed.

そしてますますに、彼女が大悪党であるという印象を強めていった…。
So the impression that she was a great villain grew stronger and stronger...

彼女の心はやがて荒み、
…皮肉にも、世間が期待するような人間に変貌させていく…。
Her heart eventually degenerated,

...and ironically, it began to transfigure her into the kind of human that the public expected...

今や絵羽には、心を許せる友人も、家族もいない。
By now, Eva had no one she could trust...and no family.

……最愛の夫、秀吉はすでに過去の人で、ワイドショーは夫の会社を時に取り上げ、乱暴な経営であったと、その過去の業績を批判し穢している。
...After her beloved husband passed away, the talk shows occasionally mentioned his company, saying that it was run recklessly, while criticizing and disgracing its former accomplishments.

最愛の一人息子、譲治についても、世間が期待する通りのステレオタイプである“大金持ちのドラ息子”という形に脚色され、…彼が如何に素朴で素直な人格であったかなど、誰も知ろうとはしない。
Even her beloved son, George, was dramatized as the stereotypical `rich, lazy son' that the public expected, ...and no one even wanted to know what a simple and honest character he had possessed.

…それらが如何に絵羽を傷つけ、荒ませていったか、…誰も興味がない。
...As to how much all of this hurt Eva and ran her to ruin, ...no one cared.

世間はただただ、親族を皆殺しにまでして大富豪となった悪女が、どんな気の毒な晩年を送るかということだけに、好奇の関心を寄せているだけである。
The public was only interested out of curiosity...about how a super-rich evil woman who killed her whole family lived her pitiful later years.

だからどんどんと。…そしてやがて。
…絵羽は、狂人呼ばわりされる性格に変貌していった……。
So that happened more and more, ...and eventually...

...Eva's personality was transfigured until people started calling her a lunatic...

彼女は時に、かつて自分が憧れていた父、金蔵の晩年もまったくそれと同じであったことを思い出し、自らを嘲り笑ったと言われている…。
It was said that this sometimes reminded her of her father, whom she had once admired, in his later years, and that she laughed at herself with scorn...

そして、その最後の親族会議の日。
And, on the day of that final family conference...

右代宮留弗夫の娘、縁寿は体調を崩し、母親の実家に預けられていた為、参加しなかった。
Because Ushiromiya Rudolf's daughter, Ange, had been sick and had stayed with her mother's family, she had not participated.

当時６歳だった彼女は家族を失い、絵羽を後見人として迎えることになる。
At the age of 6, she had lost her family and had gained Eva as her guardian.

絵羽は、唯一の肉親となった縁寿を、“とても大切にした”。
Since Ange had become Eva's only blood relative, Eva `took very good care of her'.

何かの危害に遭うことがないよう、常に身辺には物々しい護衛が付けられた。
She had imposing guards surrounding Ange's person at all times, to prevent her from coming to harm.

……彼女は友達と遊ぶことや、一緒に登校や下校すること、そうしながら四季を味わう権利さえ奪われてしまった。
...Ange had even her right to play with friends, to come home from school together, and to enjoy the seasons together...stolen away.

“快適な生活と充実した学校生活を送るため”、全てが世話された気品溢れる全寮制学園に送られ、世俗から完全に切り離された。
`So that she can live a full and pleasant school life', Eva had sent Ange to an elegant boarding school that took care of her every need, completely isolating her from the world.

彼女は年頃の少女たちが口ずさむかもしれない、流行りの歌さえ知らない。
She didn't even know the popular songs that girls her age might hum.

友人たちとウィンドゥショッピングを楽しんだり、クレープを頬張ったり、ましてや胸が高鳴るような異性との出会いさえ、…一度も与えられなかった。
She was never given a chance to enjoy window shopping with her friends or stuffing her mouth with crepes, ...much less an encounter with a member of the opposite sex to make her heart throb.

縁寿に、友人はひとりもいない。
縁寿と不用意に親しくすれば、護衛か、あるいは教師に咎められる。
Ange did not have a single friend.

If anyone carelessly acted friendly with Ange, they would be scolded by the guards, or else the teachers.

……やんごとなき右代宮家の令嬢に、卑しい人間を近づけないよう、彼らは皆、厳命されている。
...All of them were strictly ordered not to let shabby humans approach the daughter of the esteemed Ushiromiya family.

右代宮絵羽はその頃、ワイドショーを常に賑わせ、数々の経済的悪行で常に取り沙汰されていた。
During that time, the talk shows were always mentioning Ushiromiya Eva, always spreading rumors about her countless financial misdeeds.

……その“娘”であると知る周囲は、自然と彼女を敬遠していく。
...Those who knew who her `daughter' was naturally began to keep their distance.

…彼女は今や、学園においても魔女と呼ばれ、何か良からぬことがある度に、彼女の意を汲んだ学校側が何か工作をしたのだと、証拠もなく真実のように囁かれている。
...Even now, she was called a witch at school, and anytime something bad happened, even if there was no proof, it would be whispered--whispered as though if were absolute truth--that she had imposed her will on the school staff.

環境が、人を作る。
今や彼女は、周囲が恐れる通りの荒んだ心を持っている。
The environment makes the person.

By now, she had a heart as wild as those around her feared.

…誰にも心を許さず、信じようとしない。
誰も愛さず、愛そうとしない。
...No one trusted her, so she never bothered to believe in anyone.

No one loved her, so she never even tried to love.

しかもその上、絵羽が不治の病に掛かると、それもまた陰謀説がささやかれ、今度はその黒幕に縁寿が祭り上げられていく…。
And when Eva caught an incurable illness on top of all this, it was whispered that this too was a conspiracy, and this time, Ange was set up as the mastermind...

魔女の娘は魔女だと、誰もが囁く。
ワイドショーも週刊誌も、そうだと囁く。
Everyone whispered that the daughters of witches are witches too.

Even the talk shows and the weekly magazines whispered that.

　…だから縁寿も、
きっと、
いや、
どうせそうなのだろうと、それを受け入れた。
...So Ange also...

accepted it as though it was definitely...

no,

as though it was obviously true.




だから、自分をすでに魔女だと信じている彼女に、今更、黄金の魔女の名を譲ると言われても、何を今更という気持ちにしかならない。
Therefore, since she already believed that she was a witch, when she heard that the name of the Golden Witch was being turned over to her, she only felt like saying `You just figured that out now?'

しかし、彼女はこれだけは確信している。
However, she was at least sure of one thing.

自分が引き継いだこの魔女の肩書きは、きっともう誰にも世襲されることはないだろう。
This title of witch that she had inherited...would definitely never be inherited by anyone else.

自分が、最後の右代宮家当主で、最後で孤独な、黄金の魔女なのだ……。
She would be the last Head of the Ushiromiya Family, and the last lonely...Golden Witch...

縁寿の姿は、高層ビルの屋上にあった。
Ange could be seen on the roof of a skyscraper.

強く冷たい風は、彼女がこれまでに浴びてきた世間の風に比べれば、生温くて微笑ましいくらいだった。
Compared to the winds of the world that had beaten down upon her until now, this strong, cold wind was warm and pleasant.

眼下には美しい夜景と、赤と白の光の大河が煌々と流れている。
Below her lay a beautiful nighttime scene, and a dazzling river of red and white lights.

今夜は晴れのはず。
…だから本当は、無数の星が広がっているはずなのだ。
…しかし、地上の灯りが眩しすぎて、それらが見えることは決してない。
It was supposed to be clear out that night.

...So there really should have been countless stars stretching out over the sky.

...However, the light from the ground was too bright, so you couldn't see them at all.

…縁寿には、その見えない星明りの中にこそ、自分が本当に求めるものがあるように思えてならない。
...Ange couldn't help but think that what she truly sought must lie in that unseen starlight.

眼下の現実の世界も、ここからなら遠く見える。
The world of reality below her looked so far away from here.

…自分が本当にいるべき世界に、ここが一番近い場所だと思えた。
...She could imagine that this place was the closest to the world she really should be in.

…………縁寿が呪うものはひとつしかない。
......There was only one thing that Ange cursed.

どうして１２年前のあの日、自分は親族会議に行けなかったのか。
Why had she not been able to go to that family conference, on that day 12 years ago?

もし一緒に行けていたら、家族といつまでも一緒にいられただろうに。
Even though, if she had gone, it would probably have been possible for her to stay with her family forever.

…このところ、繰り返し繰り返し、…家族の夢を見るのだ。
...Lately, ...she'd been dreaming about her family over and over again.

１２年前の私が、必死に呼び掛けて、親族会議に行かないようにと訴えるのだ。
The person I was 12 years ago calls out frantically, urging them not to go to the family conference.

しかし、お父さんにもお母さんにも、遠くて手が届かない。
But both Dad and Mom are too far away, and my hand won't reach them.

私のことを、とても可愛がってくれた戦人兄さんの、私を撫でてくれるその手に、
Battler nii-san always loved me a lot, and he'd always pat my head,

………あとちょっとで届きそうなのに、それさえも届かない。
......but even though it looks like that hand's about to touch me, even it does not reach.

そんな夢を、なぜか繰り返し見るようになっていた。
For some reason, I started having that dream over and over.

……私は同じ夢を見る度に、さらに力強く手を伸ばそうと、夢の中で無駄な努力を繰り返すのだ。
...Every time I had that the same dream, I uselessly tried to stretch out my hand even more forcefully, over and over and over.

せめて戦人兄さんだけでも、生きていてくれたなら。
Even if only Battler nii-san had lived...

………私はこの冷たく寂しい現実を、せめて二人で支えあいながら生きていけるのではないか。
......Then, perhaps, we'd at least be able to support each other in my cold and lonely reality.

でも、その手はいつも、届かない。
But his hand never reaches me.

だから私は、こんなにも高いビルの屋上に上っても、
……みんなからは遠く離れている。
Even if I climb to the roof of this tall building,

...I'm so far away from all of them.

……夢の中に現れる、謎の少女が私に訴えかける。
...A mysterious girl appears in my dreams and urges me.

１２年前に何があったか、その真実に辿り着きなさいと、夢の中の少女が訴える。
She urges me to find the truth of what happened 12 years ago.

「……………………。……父さんたちにあの日、
…何があったのかを知ることができたなら、
…………帰ってきてくれるの？　せめて誰かが…！」
"...............If only I could learn...

...everything that happened to Father and the rest of them on that day,

......would they come back? At least one of them...?!"

その言葉に、
…答える者が、いるわけがない。
There was no way...

that anyone would answer that question for her.

わかってる。
………この世に、私の家族も友人も、何もいないのだ。
I get it.

......In this world, I have no family or friends.

だから、
…………行こう。…帰ろう。
……家族のところへ。
So,

......let's go. ...Let's go home.

...To where my family is.

縁寿の姿は、…柵を最初から越えていた。
From the start, ...Ange's figure had been on the outer side of the fence.

眼下の景色はとても遠くて美しくて、むしろ幻想的でまったく恐怖感を感じさせない。
The scenery below her eyes was distant, beautiful, and so fantastical that it actually didn't give rise to fear.

下を向いてたら、きっと下の世界へ連れて行かれてしまうだろうから。
If I look down, I'll surely be swallowed up by the world below.

……私は上を向く。
...So I looked up.

上の世界へ、家族のいる世界へ連れて行ってほしいから。
Because I wanted to be taken to the world above, the world where my family was.

………何が莫大な財産よ。
何が呪われた黄金よ。
何が黄金の魔女ベアトリーチェよ。
......Who cares about vast wealth?

Who cares about cursed gold?

Who cares about the Golden Witch, Beatrice?

私が本当に欲しいものは、山成す黄金であろうとも、手には入らない…。
What I really want, even a mountain of gold couldn't get me...

その為に必要なのは、一歩前へ踏み出す、たったそれだけの勇気。
What I need for that...is to take a single step forward, ...just that little bit of courage.

…………その時。…私は確かに声を聞いた。
その声を、私は知っている。
......At that moment, ...I definitely heard a voice.

It was a voice I knew.

ずっと、……私を夢の中で呼んでいた声…。
A voice that had...called to me in my dreams for so long...

私の目の前に、……つまりそこは漆黒と夜景の中空なのだけれど。
……そこに、夢の中で見たあの少女の姿があった…。
Before my eyes...in other words, in mid-air above that jet black nighttime scenery...

...There was the figure of the girl I'd seen in my dreams...

彼女は夢の中で聞いたのと同じ声で、もう一度言った。
She spoke again, with the same voice I'd heard in those dreams.

「………あなたの助けが必要なの。」
"......Your assistance is required."

「…私の、
…………助け……？　誰が……？」
"...My...

...assistance...? Who needs it...?"

「………あなたの家族がよ。…あなたの家族は、永遠に１２年前の今日から明日に閉じ込められているわ。」
"......Your family needs it. ...Your family has been eternally imprisoned in the span from this day 12 years ago until the following day."

「そ、…それを救えば、
……私の家族は帰ってくるの？！」
"I-If I save them,

...does that mean my family will come home?!"

私がもっとも尋ねたかったことを問うと、少女は残酷に言葉を切り、俯く仕草を見せる。
When I asked the question I had most wanted to, the girl cruelly stopped talking and hung her head.

「……それは約束できないわ。敵は黄金の魔女ベアトリーチェ。…強大な相手よ。私には太刀打ちできない。……でも、同じ黄金の魔女なら何とかなるかもしれない。」
"...I cannot promise that. The enemy is the Golden Witch, Beatrice. ...A mighty opponent. I cannot oppose her. ...But, another Golden Witch might be able to manage something."

「…………な、何の話か、わからないわ。」
"......I-I don't know...what you're talking about."

「……１９８６年のベアトリーチェに太刀打ちできるのは、
１９９８年の、最後のベアトリーチェだけ。………つまりあなたよ。縁寿。……………エンジェ・ベアトリーチェ。」
"...The only one who can oppose the Beatrice of 1986...

is the final Beatrice of 1998. ......In other words, you. Ange. ......#fefefeANGE#ffffff Beatrice."




「１２年前の魔女が、
……私の家族を奪ったの………？」
"That witch from 12 years ago...

...took away my family......?"

「そう。あなたの仇に当たる。…………あなたに常に孤独な未来を強いる元凶よ。」
"That's right. She is your foe. ......The root cause that always leads to your future of isolation."

「…………………………。
……私の、
……家族の、
………仇。」
"............

...My...

...family's...

...foe."




「……見返りに、あなたの望むもっとも理想的な世界、家族の帰ってくる世界のカケラを探してあげるわ。………でも、必ず希望が叶うと約束は出来ない。…１９８６年のベアトリーチェのゲーム盤はあまりに完璧。
"...In exchange, I will search for a Fragment with the ideal world that you wish for, a world where your family comes home. ......I make no promises that your desire will be granted. ...Beatrice's game board in 1986 is quite perfect."

……今日の手土産に、その理想のカケラを持参しようとしたんだけれど、未だに見つけられないの。…………かなりの強固な運命よ。ラムダデルタと戦った時以来のね。」
"...I had planned on bringing you that ideal Fragment as a present today, but I still can't find it. ......This is a very firm fate. I haven't seen the likes of it since the time I fought Lambdadelta."

「………………………………………。な、
".....................I-

……何を言ってるのか、
I don't know...

…わからない。」
what you're talking about."

「………あなたに、復讐のチャンスを。…見返りに、あなたが享受できる可能性の中で、もっとも幸せな結末を探して持ってくることを約束するわ。」
"......I'm giving you a chance for revenge. ...In exchange, I promise to search for and bring you the happiest resolution among the possibilities you're capable of accepting."

「…………………………復讐……。」
"............Revenge..."

「……徒労になるかもしれない。仮に復讐を成し遂げられたとしても、家族が帰ってくる絶対の保証はない。奇跡的確率で、せいぜい１人を連れ戻せるかどうかよ。」
"...It may be a fruitless effort. Even if you succeed in your revenge, there's no definite proof that your family will return. Even if you manage to hit a miraculous probability, you may only be able to bring one person back, if that."

…縁寿は、あの夢の意味を理解する。
...Ange understood the meaning of that dream.

……あと少しで、せめて戦人兄さんには手が届きそうな、あの夢を。
...The dream where it seemed that, with just a little more stretching, her hand might be able to reach at least Battler nii-san.

「奇跡的な確率でも、……それはゼロよりは高いのよね…？　１％くらい…？」
"A miraculous probability...means it's still higher than zero, right...? Is it 1%...?"

「……あらゆる可能性の数値は、結果の前に無力よ。だからその数字を、私には語ることができない。」
"...Trying to read any probabilities before the result is useless. So I cannot tell you that number."

「でも、私が何もしないよりは、絶対にわずかの可能性がある。」
"But it'll definitely be slightly more likely than if I do nothing."

「えぇ。あなたが希望を捨てない限り。…ただし覚悟して。それは遥かにゼロに近い。」
"Yes. As long as you do not throw that desire of yours away. But be prepared. It is extremely close to zero."

「………………
".........

いいわ。
Okay.

乗るわ、その話。」
I'll take you up on that offer."

「……いいのね？　多分、もう二度とここへは帰って来れないわよ。」
"...Are you sure? You probably won't be able to return here again."

「ここは、私のいるべき世界じゃないわ。……そして、私のいるべき世界は、私が自分で探す。あなたの名前を聞かせて。」
"This isn't the world I'm supposed to be in. ...I'll find the world I am supposed to be in myself. Tell me your name."

「奇跡の魔女、ベルンカステル。そして我が名において、
"The Witch of Miracles, Bernkastel. And by that name,

あなたを黄金の魔女、エンジェ・ベアトリーチェだと認めるわ。……今こそ、あなたは本当の魔女よ。」
I acknowledge you as the Golden Witch, ANGE Beatrice. ...As of now, you are a true witch."

彼女が私のことを魔女であると宣言した瞬間。
…私の中で何かが大きくかわるような、そんな眩暈を感じた。
The instant she proclaimed that I was a witch...

...I felt dizzy, as though something inside me had changed drastically.

その時、バタンという音が聞こえた。
…屋上へ通じる階段室の扉の開く音だ。
At that time, I heard a *clunk*.

...It was the sound of the door that opened to the staircase to the roof.

絵羽伯母さんのところの護衛どもだった。
It was Aunt Eva's guards.

…護衛とは名ばかり。
私を閉じ込める、もっとも身近な檻じゃないか。
...They're only `guards' in name.

Aren't they the cage that wraps the tightest around me, shutting me in?

私がすでに柵を越えている姿を見つけ、仰天しながら駆けてくる。
They saw that I was already on the other side of the fence and dashed forward, horrified.
